column8: ,4 month work term,The GIS Assistant will endeavour to serve the various client groups with technical services to support the deployment and utilization of the Geographic Information System.  The GIS Assistant will work alongside team members to learn and develop their skills over the course of the semester.,Assist in the creation, maintenance and enhancement of a variety of cartographic map products

column1: Assist in the maintenance of versioned feature classes within the County's enterprise geodatabase
Assist in the updating of metadata

Assist with scanning and digitizing of hard copy plans, data creation/conversion/quality control, collection and/or processing of data using GPS technology and mobile GIS applications, documentation, and various spatial analysis as required.

Assist in the shared routine tasks of the GIS team and participate as an integrated member of the GIS team","Must be a registered full-time post-secondary student during the preceding academic year and be returning to school in a technical program on a full-time basis in the next academic year.
Demonstrated experience in GIS software and concepts is a necessity.  Preference will be given to candidates experienced in the use of the current version of ESRI's ArcGIS Desktop.
Experience working with Microsoft Office, Outlook, and in a Windows environment is required.
Excellent writing, communication, organizational, and analytical skills are a must.
Experience with airphoto interpretation is an asset
Experience with GPS data collection is an asset
Experience in a municipal setting and/or knowledge of municipal infrastructure is an asset
Ability to interpret engineering drawings and/or registered
Knowledge of geocoding, georeferencing and geoprocessing
Understanding of ArcGIS extensions is an asset
Experience providing customer service","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The Simcoe County Archives (SCA) collects, preserves, and makes available the history of the County of Simcoe as manifested in the records of local government, businesses, organizations, and individuals. Collections range from 1492 to 2019 and include textual records, photographs, artwork, maps and plans, sound recordings, and video in a variety of formats, both analog and digital. Members of the public can access our collections in our reading room.","The Archives Assistant will assist and support Archives' staff with all aspects of archival service provision, including, but not limited to:

column1: Should the progress of the pandemic require working remotely, duties may include:
Transcribing digitized finding aids and inventories
Assisting with metadata application and revision
Occasionally assisting with research requests by searching digitized finding aids and inventories
In-person duties may include:
Inventorying donations of archival and historical material and creating box lists
Comparing and reconciling transferred municipal government records and pre-compiled file lists
Re-boxing, re-foldering, and/or relocating archival and historical material
Encapsulating records and making envelopes
Assisting with reference services by retrieving records and putting them away
Data entry and word processing, including transcription of finding aids and inventories and assisting with metadata application and revision
Assisting with research and outreach, including:
Undertaking research by preparing one or more blog posts
Selecting and recommending of material for social media posts
Digitizing archival and historical material
Other duties as required","Must be a registered full-time post-secondary student during the preceding academic year and be returning to school on a full-time basis in the next academic year.
Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
Cannot be employed in another full-time job.
Ability to lift boxes up to 40lbs.
Excellent writing, communication and organizational skills.
Must be detail oriented and accurate with data entry
Software experience with Windows, MS Office (especially MS Word and Excel), and Internet applications.
Good people and customer service skills.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,PROJECT ENGINEERING STUDENT

column1: LOCATION
SOCIAL HOUSING DEPARTMENT
COUNTY OF SIMCOE, MIDHURST, ON
POSITION DESCRIPTION

The Project Engineering Student is a shared position between the Local Housing Authority and the Not for Profit departments.  This position is geared towards the development of 2nd to 4th year engineering students enrolled fulltime in either Mechanical or Civil Engineering at an accredited university.  The position is focused on assisting maintenance managers with construction and renovation projects including project design, tendering, administration and installation.  In addition, the position will be required to participate in special projects, preventative maintenance systems, and equipment and building envelope trouble shooting and resolution.  The position requires both strong technical ability as well as excellent communication skills as meetings; reports and communications are frequently required between Boards of Directors, contractors, tenants, and County Executive.","DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Review, modify, and create PM's for new or existing equipment as well as train operators on PM checks and systems.
Schedule site visits and inspections as required to review, comment, and update statuses of ongoing projects.
Conduct site meetings during the tendering or contract administration processes.
Assist maintenance managers with the creation of tender documents, reviewing specifications and obtaining quotations for repairs.
Schedule site visits and inspections to review projects to ensure work is completed properly, as per applicable legislation, and in the best interest of the County.
Create reports identifying any issues and effectively communicate issues to required stakeholders.

Provide advice and guidance on projects including site inspections, direct contractors in completion of work; inspect work in progress for adherence to specifications by contractors and final inspection reports for deficiencies in all work.
Evaluate building materials, construction methods, and completed work.
Work with Social Housing Team to accomplish other project and program goals.
Report regularly to Maintenance and Facility Project Manager(s).
Develop and maintain effective relationships with other departments, managers, and fire departments, alarm companies, building inspectors, engineers, architects, consultants and all trades.
Arrange meetings, prepare agendas, manage personal calendars as required.
Participate in committees as required.
Comply with Provincial and County occupational health and safety legislation, regulations, policies and procedures.
Maintain confidentiality in accordance with the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.
Perform other duties as assigned.","REQUIREMENTS/EXPERIENCE
Current 2nd or greater year enrolment in a fulltime accredited University Engineering program in either Civil or Mechanical Engineering.
Strong knowledge of all facets of building construction, materials and methods is an asset.

Knowledge of mechanical, structural, gas, electrical, environmental systems and facility infrastructure as well as familiarity with the Building, Electrical and Fire Code, accessibility and related renovation issues is an asset.
Ability to read and interpret renovation and construction drawings.
Self-motivated, able to act independently and as part of a team.
Ability to exercise discretion and maintain confidentiality.
Proven ability to foster a cooperative work environment.
Strong analytical skills, ability to analyze budgetary expenditures, identify cost savings and value added.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong planning and organizational skills.
Strong independent working ability.
Strong time management and multi-tasking skills.
Knowledge of word-processing, spreadsheet and auto-cad application skills.
Valid G Class Driver's License and access to a reliable vehicle is manditory.
Available for after hours call-outs.
Criminal reference check with vulnerable sector clearance.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,We are seeking an enthusiastic student who is currently enrolled in a post-secondary program in Information

column1: Technology, Geography, GIS, Geomatics or closely related field. Our ideal candidate has a minimum of 0-3
years related experience with GIS tools and technologies, and ESRI GIS software products. We are seeking a
student with experience in editing and maintaining spatial data; experience with versioned editing considered
an asset. The ideal candidate has experience with the following: ArcMap, ArcGIS Server, ArcSDE, Spatial
Analyst, Model Builder, Geocortex, and Python.
The ideal candidate is computer proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) and knowledge of laptops, PCs,
printers, iPhones, and Windows systems (Windows 10, Office 365 preferred) would be an asset. We are
seeking an individual with superior interpersonal skills including the ability to work effectively in a team
environment, a demonstrated ability to make decisions involving routine tasks within established procedures,
and excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to give, obtain and/or exchange routine
information.","Reporting directly to the Supervisor, Data and Applications, this role is responsible for providing first line
technical GIS support to internal staff, as well as deploying of new hardware, which includes physically
removing and installing computers at the primary and remote sites (including occasional weekend work). As
the IT Student, GIS you will perform the following duties, including but not limited to:
? Act as the first point of contact for phone calls and emails for staff regarding GIS issues and queries
? Troubleshoot basic GIS related problems, including map updates, both remotely and in-person
? Follow and update existing documentation of GIS processes, as well as create new documentation
where none currently exists in collaboration with other IT staff to enable consistent results
? Receiving, logging and managing calls from internal staff via telephone and email, including escalating
unresolved calls to the appropriate GIS team member
? Ability to geo-reference digitized historic air photos","1 year of related work experience with GIS tools and technologies
Demonstrated work experience with ESRI GIS software products
Experienced with the following: ArcMap, ArcGIS Server, ArcSDE, Spatial Analyst, Model Builder, ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online
Experience with editing and maintaining spatial data and geo-referencing
Experienced in the creation of workflow models, Microsoft Office, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, and FME.
Experience with Python and Javascript programming skills and understanding of relational databases
Solid understanding of cartographic design, map projections, horizontal and vertical datum, and complementary technologies such as remote sensing and GPS","Targeted Clusters

column1: LOVE WHAT YOU DO
Hear from our previous co-ops about their take on a placement at Economical!"" link - https://en.videos.economical.com/watch/gqVGRy5B4eVex9GAiCnDL8

From classroom to co-op to career, every step of your journey has an impact on your future. That's why it makes sense to choose a co-op placement with a company that offers truly rewarding work and real-life experience. At Economical Insurance®, your contributions, creativity, and energy will be put to good use, and you'll get to be involved with initiatives that support our strategic goals and use your skills in a supportive team environment.

Our family of companies includes Sonnet, the only Canadian home and auto insurer offering a fully online buying experience, and Petline, the largest Canadian pet insurance company. We're also preparing to become a publicly traded company, a once-in-a-lifetime career opportunity for everyone who joins our team.

If you're looking for a company that takes care of its people - full time, part time, and co-ops alike - and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.","What can you expect in this role?

Quality Assurance is a highly strategic and challenging area of our IT business that deals with the validation and verification of software systems and data.  Economical Insurance is seeking a technical Student in Quality Assurance to join us in this important area.

You are a student of a Computer Science or related program.  You want to work in an Agile team in a professional environment and expand your skills on a project that matters.  You are willing to get your hands dirty both testing and/or coding.  Your programming skills and expertise in software are impeccable.

This is a technical role, spans multiple technology spaces, and offers a good opportunity to gain and apply experience in a range of systems supporting multiple projects and infrastructures.  The successful candidate will be involved with identifying test scenarios, creating and executing test cases and potentially writing automated test scripts.
You'll be working closely with the Quality Engineering team that operates in an Agile environment, working on initiatives that span the business to implement common QA, DevOps, and Development goals.
Job Responsibilities
Analyzing requirements in order to identify and create test scenarios
Designing, creating and executing manual tests
Designing and scripting automated regression tests
Testing data seeding, data masking and data analysis
Analysis and reporting of testing results
Working in an Agile environment to achieve the highest possible quality standards and improve current QE capabilities","What do you bring to the role?
Working toward bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or related field
Knowledge of CS fundamentals including data structures, algorithm design and complexity analysis
Experience with consuming RESTful APIs an asset
Understanding of the manipulation of XML and XSD Schemas an asset
Proficiency working with JSON, XML, CSV data formats
Hands-on skill and utilization of SQL for the querying of relational data
Experience in web technologies such as HTML, CSS, Javascript
Proficiency in at least one programming language such as Java, C++ or Python
Hands on exposure to Test Automation Frameworks / Test Harness an asset
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery concepts and approaches an asset
Understanding of and experience with DevOps an asset
Experience and understanding of Agile software development methodologies
Strong English communication skills - both verbal and written
We also take potential into consideration. If you don't have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot you deserve it.","Targeted Clusters

column1: LOVE WHAT YOU DO
Hear from our previous co-ops about their take on a placement at Economical!"" link - https://en.videos.economical.com/watch/gqVGRy5B4eVex9GAiCnDL8

Work is a big part of our lives, so it makes sense to choose a company that offers truly rewarding work. At Economical Insurance®, your contributions, creativity, and energy won't go to waste. Our passionate culture and pioneering mentality infuse everything we do, which is why our one-million-plus policyholders know we'll protect their homes, businesses, farms, cars, and pets like they're our own.

We're not afraid to see how far we can push the envelope to make insurance better. Our family of companies includes Sonnet, the only Canadian home and auto insurer offering a fully online buying experience, and Petline, the largest Canadian pet insurance company. We're also preparing to become a publicly traded company, a once-in-a-lifetime career opportunity for everyone who joins our team.
If you're looking for a company that takes care of its people - and its customers - and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.
What can you expect in this role?

The Opportunity - Technology Business Coordinator Co-op: Reporting to the Director, receiving day-to-day coaching and guidance from Technology Business Partners and Architects. You'll work collaboratively with various technology teams to assist with strategic planning and help provide technical solutions that are of value to our business partners.","Responsibilities
Create and maintain new and existing intake requests through JIRA & Clarity
Clarity and JIRA intake request tracking and reporting
Liaise with business partners to identify and define problem statements and objectives to achieve desired customer outcome
Provide 2021 Strategic Planning support and consolidation of all requests
Creation and/or updating of executive PowerPoint presentations
Chair meetings, take & distribute minutes to all team members and stakeholders
Keep the Technology Business Partner or Architect apprised of any emerging issues as they arise that may impact our customer","What do you bring to the role?
Who We Are Looking for:
Self-driven, able to move tasks & requests forward independently and with personal accountability
Team player and excellent collaborator, able to both lead & participate to develop solutions with strong customer focus
Detailed orientated, organized and resourceful
Adaptive and Agile, able to rapidly pivot your efforts between multiple priorities as business needs change to provide value to our customers
Qualifications
Previous experience working in a technology solution environment is an asset
Previous experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment is an asset
Proficient in MS Office 365 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and MS Teams is an asset
Experience with JIRA, ServiceNow & Clarity (CA PPM) is an asset
We also take potential into consideration. If you don't have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot - you deserve it.","Targeted Clusters

As a Technical Specialist Communications in Technology Solutions, you specialize in writing and editorial services for Technology Solutions (TS) employees, TS leaders and internal business customers, including supporting:
Strategic communications for TS projects, programs and initiatives (drafting communications for new processes and tools for internal customers)
Leadership reporting (business slides and management reports)
Town Hall messaging, TS Events, and Newsletter/online articles
Creation of consistent and compelling TS messaging across various communication platforms (Teams, Microsoft Office, SharePoint, Email)
Facilitation of information sharing, knowledge and expertise within the TS organization through the development and management of communication vehicles and promotion of good communication practice
Job Responsibilities:

As an influencer, provides communication guidance and support for TS and project teams, ensuring critical (technical and non-technical) information is shared to the right people, at the right time, with the appropriate level of detail
Collaborates with TS team members to ensure deliverables (such as work instructions or communications) align to corporate branding, processes, and writing guidelines
Plans and prioritizes tasks to ensure effective and efficient delivery of knowledge-related deliverables
Participates in governance forums as required and ensures follow-up items are completed in alignment with the target requirements and business priority
Validates completeness and accuracy of knowledge-related deliverables and confirm outcomes have met the requirements
As a communication and knowledge resource, provides insight and recommendations based on industry and technology trends, technology strategy, and experience with team members
Builds relationships with business and TS partners across all teams, working collaboratively to identify solutions and resolve issues","What do you bring to the role?

Experience assessing communication options for the implementation, decommissioning, or upgrade of a technical solution or service; analyzing, reviewing, and providing options, recommendations, and guidance to team members
Sound knowledge of communication best practices, project delivery practices, and writing standards for socializing technical processes, services, and tools
Ability to work independently developing communication plans, and executing project tasks and deliverables (multi-tasking), with minimal supervision
Developing subject matter expert in communications and knowledge management who advises the project team on best practices, including industry trends
Undergraduate degree in English, Business, Computer Science or related discipline
0-3 years in a communications or technical writing role
We also take potential into consideration. If you don't have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot - you deserve it!","Targeted Clusters

Reporting to the Manager, Deskside & Support, the Co-op Student supports new and existing systems and technology for Economical Insurance.  The summer student works in a team environment to deliver a high quality of customer service and technical support with a focus on response and resolution to support business operations.
Job Responsibilities:
Technical support and troubleshooting of hardware, software and application issues.
Resolving medium complexity incident and request tickets from the Help Desk.
Installing, upgrading, maintaining and decommissioning hardware and software
Deploying client hardware (i.e. desktops, laptops, VOIP phones, Blackberry, etc.).
Service and support of printers and multi-function devices.
Scheduling, supporting and troubleshooting video conferencing.
Collaboration with third level for technical analysis and problem resolution.
Diagnosis and investigation to identify underlying root cause.","What do you bring to the role?
Personal Characteristics:
Professional, friendly and courteous in all interactions.
Ability to perform well in a busy operation, remain calm under pressure and adapt to a changing environment.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and prioritize on an ongoing basis.
Self-motivated, consistently demonstrating an ability to take initiative on any issue.
A driven problem solver and a strong team player.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Required Skills:
Working towards a university degree/college diploma in a related technology discipline
Demonstrated technical aptitude and ability related to both hardware and software
Some lifting of computer equipment may be required (approximately 40 lbs)
We also take potential into consideration. If you don't have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.

The IT Asset/Change & Release Coordinator, Technology Solutions (TS) will be reporting to the Senior Technical Analyst and will be a part of the Technology Solutions Asset Management and Change & Release Management teams. The Asset Management team manages all ITAM activity and implements best practices to reduce life cycle cost, risk and support audit controls for all IT hardware and software. The Change & Release Management team is responsible for ensuring all Change activity for Economical is conducted using ITIL certified best practices to ensure operational stability to the IT managed environments.
Job Responsibilities:
Asset Management
Coordinate and execute annual hardware audit activities across multiple office locations
Tracking, auditing and reconciliation of technology hardware and software
Perform and maintain documented Asset Management processes
Software Asset Management
Coordinate and execute uplift of software contracts and data into tracking database (working with multiple stakeholder teams)
Contribute to process improvement and automation
Create and maintain standard operating procedures and documentation
Change & Release Management
Lead and coordinate the annual audit of our enterprise standard change catalog
Submit approval requests to Service Owners
Coordinate responses in the formal catalog repository

column1: LOVE WHAT YOU DO
Hear from our previous co-ops about their take on a placement at Economical!"" link - https://en.videos.economical.com/watch/gqVGRy5B4eVex9GAiCnDL8

From classroom to co-op to career, every step of your journey has an impact on your future. That's why it makes sense to choose a co-op placement with a company that offers truly rewarding work and real-life experience. At Economical Insurance®, your contributions, creativity, and energy will be put to good use, and you'll get to be involved with initiatives that support our strategic goals and use your skills in a supportive team environment.

Our family of companies includes Sonnet, the only Canadian home and auto insurer offering a fully online buying experience, and Petline, the largest Canadian pet insurance company. We're also preparing to become a publicly traded company, a once-in-a-lifetime career opportunity for everyone who joins our team.

If you're looking for a company that takes care of its people - full time, part time, and co-ops alike - and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.","What can you expect in this role?

The Access Technical Analyst executes the processes and procedures to manually provision and de-provision access for individuals both internal and external to the organization.  They are responsible for ensuring proper approvals are in place and that access is enabled/disabled in a timely fashion based on the nature of the request.  They are also responsible for monitoring automated provisioning workflows, producing reports and metrics, and handling exception approval processes when required.   They are also responsible for troubleshooting access issues.  The incumbent strives towards operational improvements and excellence and works with the team to identify opportunities to improve process, standards and tools in their function.
Job Responsibilities:
Access Process Stewardship
Executes the Access processes and procedures to enable/disable access for Economical employees, brokers and others as required
Follows all controls and gates within the processes, ensuring proper approvals have been obtained prior to granting of access
Participates in the facilitation of attestation/certification events that occur periodically
Process Improvement

Identifies opportunities for improvement in processes, standards, tools, policies, etc. and shares them with his/her team in order to improve service delivery, reduce risk, cut costs and otherwise support business strategy
Quickly adapts to new and modified processes and procedures
Security Awareness
Is aware of Economical Corporate Security policies and overall Security best practices and notifies leadership of anything that is at risk of breaching these policies and practices
Acts as a security ambassador within the organization, helping others understand the importance of security and bringing about awareness","What do you bring to the role?
Experience with the following technologies / tools / concepts / methodologies related to security is an asset:
Identity Access Management
Experience in Information Technology in an asset
Experience in access management considered an asset
We also take potential into consideration. If you don't have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot  you deserve it.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The Empire Life Insurance Company (Empire Life) offers individual and group life and health insurance, investment and retirement products. Our mission is to make it simple, fast and easy for Canadians to get the investment, insurance and group benefits coverage they need to build wealth, generate income, and achieve financial security.

column1: We want you to join our innovation lab and its fast-paced, and passionate engineering team to change the industry.  Ideate, build, and test innovative solutions which will lead the digital insurance market.   We recently launched an award-winning industry-first full online life insurance application and we're just getting started - with many more exciting projects in the pipeline.  The Empire Lab is developing a lean and highly collaborative work environment in our new Toronto space.  Be part of accelerating the daily evolution of this storied company.  Develop your skills on an evolving team with the excitement and freedom of a well-funded start-up but supported with industry expert guidance.  Our size and history position us well to innovate in our chosen markets while being nimble and minimizing bureaucracy.  Help Empire continue to lead the way in insurtech / fintech.

Empire Life welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the screening and selection process.

Co-op developers have a unique opportunity to explore emerging technologies through generating ideas, requesting funding and stopping projects based on your market learning.","You will learn, apply and experience the innovation process and lean concept development by:
Aiding in ideation to solve real market problems
Designing, prototyping and testing ideas with customers, in the actual market
Answering critical business questions by collecting real market data
Rapidly develop your solution concept into functional prototypes (for web and/or mobile)
Investigate the potential of new and emerging technologies (e.g. big data, platform features, AI)
Refine presentation skills by pitching concepts and demos to senior executives
Learn and share developer insights with other teams and partners
Gain experience making real business process improvement through digitization
Opportunity to work as part of a dynamic, agile team to delivering cutting edge digital transformation online

Contribute to building proof of concept and exploratory work for an API and services-enabled application architecture, and to deliver interconnected capabilities through a distributed digital ecosystem
Work closely with digital marketing experts to assess and analyze supporting technologies, data and patterns
Research and try out innovative solutions and approaches, challenge existing scenarios and brainstorm new techniques
Work remotely, but connected via Slack, chat, Google Hangouts, etc.
Participate in daily team hangouts","Tech Stack
Team adopts a loosely hyper-agile methodology and uses the latest DevOps tools including:
Slack - our team's main communications channel.  We also use Slack bots of all shapes and sizes to automate our processes
GitHub
Jira - planning and tracking work
CircleCI - automated behat testing and Continuous Integration and Deployment
Dynamic Dev, Staging and Prod regions
Amazon EC2, S3 and Heroku
Languages include: Node, React, Django, Flask, Python, Drupal/PHP, Java and others","Targeted Clusters

column1: We are looking for a co-op developer to join the Group IT team who is motivated, self-directing and recognizes opportunities to improve our processes. We encourage new ideas but also look for someone who is willing to roll up their sleeves to help in every aspect of the SDLC including developing, unit testing, implementing, and maintaining complex software.

This is an exciting time to work in insurance and to make an impact on the ever-changing technological landscape. If you're looking to innovate and introduce best practices, don't miss your opportunity to share your talents with one of Kitchener-Waterloo's Top Employers for 2021!
What we offer:
-A healthy work/life balance and employee wellness. Exhausted developers are bad developers. We want you to enjoy your life outside of work.

-We care about your career and foster a culture of learning. We provide dedicated time to improve your skills, lunch and learns, online and live courses, knowledge sharing between team members, and many more opportunities.
-We value open, honest communication between team members, challenging each other to continually improve.","What you'll do:
Design solutions, write code, perform unit testing, develop appropriate artifacts, documentation, and facilitate final delivery.
Conduct thorough unit testing, often developing and leveraging automated unit testing frameworks, and improve performance of single functions through performance tuning.
Plan design and implementation activities, ensure technical solution quality, and drive technical platform evolution and improvements.
Present technical topics at regular team meetings and manage low-level planning of work items.
Estimate activities and tasks required to perform design, coding, and unit testing.","What you'll need:
Enrolled as a full-time, post-secondary student in a recognized institution, working towards a degree or diploma in Computer Science or a related field.
You are a creative and analytical thinker who is self-driven, capable of working independently and as part of an agile team.
Code quality is important to you and you are willing to take the time to do things right.
You have solid problem-solving and coding skills, and knowledge of common algorithms, data structures, and design patterns.

Knowledge of Web Services, REST API and Web API.
Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server with the ability to write and tune queries and stored procedures.

Experience with source control (Team Foundation Server, GIT)","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,The Fertility Partners,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",22,"

column8: ,4 month work term,About Us

column1: The Fertility Partners is the largest network of fertility clinics in Canada, with a focus on building success for our clinics through delivery of world-class medical outcomes and best-in-class patient experiences. Over the past year, we've developed tremendous momentum in the marketplace and have acquired 10 clinics with over 21 locations across Canada with the opportunity to expand internationally.
The Fertility Partners is a private equity backed roll-up investment. Private equity investors include Peloton Capital Management (Canada) and HEAL Partners (Australia).

Candidates who will be successful at The Fertility Partners are passionate about bringing their knowledge and experience to work every day to bring an inspiring vision to life. We're creating a purposeful culture by bringing people together who value being part of a supportive collaborative team, while rolling up their sleeves to achieve success within our fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.
The Role

Working at The Fertility Partners presents a strong opportunity to learn in a fast-paced private equity investor backed business. We are a small team, and you will work alongside senior executives in daily operations. Your work will help drive key decisions the business is making. This will include several projects/tasks related to head office reporting, the operational improvement of current clinics and the investment in new clinics.","Work on projects across multiple teams including finance, accounting, and operations.
Project management of some acquisitions, integrations, and implementations.
Collaborate with internal teams to develop and implement processes.

column8: ,4 month work term,About Us

column1: The Fertility Partners is the largest network of fertility clinics in Canada, with a focus on building success for our clinics through delivery of world-class medical outcomes and best-in-class patient experiences. Over the past year, we've developed tremendous momentum in the marketplace and have acquired 10 clinics with over 21 locations across Canada with the opportunity to expand internationally.
The Fertility Partners is a private equity backed roll-up investment. Private equity investors include Peloton Capital Management (Canada) and HEAL Partners (Australia).

Candidates who will be successful at The Fertility Partners are passionate about bringing their knowledge and experience to work every day to bring an inspiring vision to life. We're creating a purposeful culture by bringing people together who value being part of a supportive collaborative team, while rolling up their sleeves to achieve success within our fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.
The Role

Working at The Fertility Partners presents a strong opportunity to learn in a fast-paced private equity investor backed business. We are a small team, and you will work alongside senior executives in daily operations. Your work will help drive key decisions the business is making. This will include several projects/tasks related to head office reporting, the operational improvement of current clinics and the investment in new clinics.","Work on projects across multiple teams including finance, accounting, and operations.

column1: ,The Globe and Mail,Head Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate",4,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Globe and Mail's first-ever commercial software team is growing very fast, and we need talented individuals like you to help us succeed. Our mission is to help other media companies as well as The Globe itself, to embrace audience engagement and add value to our storytelling capabilities. We have established a state-of-the-art platform using Kubernetes and we are expanding the cutting-edge technology that we have been developing to accommodate terabytes of data.

column1: Your work will be critical in helping the newsroom of several media organizations to engage with their audience in real-time.

Depending on whether we have transitioned back into the office, successful applicants will work at our new downtown office, located by Toronto's Distillery District. Other benefits include team building activities, casual work attire and an innovative working environment.","Who are you?
You enjoy learning and collaborating with a team of professional software and data engineers and architects
You are data savvy and have a knack for manipulating terabytes of data
You aspire to be a platform architect and like getting your hands dirty by building data pipelines
You are self-directed and have the desire to explore and learn new technologies
You thrive in a fast-paced environment and can deliver results quickly through iteration
What your day looks like:
crafting automated installation for our containerized data pipeline
exploring ways to improve the cost-efficiency of our cloud infrastructure
improve the Jenkins build pipeline (CI/CD)
engineering better ways to monitor our infrastructure
containerizing new data pipeline components via Docker
implementing automated integration tests","Skills that will help you succeed in this role:
experience with Docker
experience in shell script and any Unix-based operating system
experience with any build tools, i.e. Maven, Gradle, SBT, NPM
knowledge of computer networking, i.e. subnets, routes, IPs and ports

experience with Kubernetes, Terraform and Helm Charts
familiarity with Prometheus and Jenkins","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Our Mission

column1: The Globe and Mail Data Science team's mission is to help the organization make sense of the terabytes of data that is generated by our publishing platforms. We are extending and enhancing our analytical capabilities so that our editorial team is better equipped to answer questions such as: What type of content should we produce more of? Which content is better placed behind the paywall? When is a good time to publish new content?
Your work will be critical in helping our editorial team with their storytelling to better serve our millions of Canadian readers.

Depending on whether we have transitioned back into the office, successful applicants will work at our new downtown office, located by Toronto's Distillery District. Other benefits include team building activities, casual work attire and an innovative working environment.
Who are you?
You enjoy collaborating with others to build something from nothing
You are data savvy and have a knack for manipulating terabytes of data
You aspire to be a data architect and like getting your hands dirty by building data pipelines
You are self-directed and have the desire to explore and learn new technologies
You thrive in a fast-paced environment and can deliver results quickly through iteration","What your day looks like:
collecting, processing and storing terabytes of data for use by analysts, data scientists and other stakeholders around the company
building and maintaining data APIs to support new features for our in-house analytics suite of tools
collaborating with our data scientists and data engineers to develop new approaches to solidify our ETL processes
monitoring and improving performance of ETL processes","Skills that will help you succeed in this role:
experience writing APIs and knowledge of API best practices
experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., Elasticsearch, Postgres, Redis)
experience with version-control and related tools (i.e. git), issue and project-tracking tools (e.g. Jira)
It would be great if you have:
experience with real-time analytics
exposure to distributed computing (e.g., Spark and Scala)
functional programming experience
an interest in data analytics and data science","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,The Home Depot Canada,Head Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate",7,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Home Depot Canada is the Canadian arm of the world's largest home improvement retailer with 182 stores in 10 Canadian provinces and employs more than 28,000 associates from coast-to-coast of all skill levels in full and part-time positions.

column1: Based out of our dynamic Toronto-based Store Support Centre (SSC), we have many opportunities available for students seeking a big challenge with great rewards.
Our SSC serves stores across the country. Some companies call it their ""head office"" but at The Home Depot we are dedicated to being the number one customer service retailer in the world.
AT THE HOME DEPOT, OUR VALUES AND UNIQUE CULTURE ARE OUR COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE.

Our associates are proud to work here and it shows.  One of our most important values is taking care of our people.  We do this by encouraging associates to embrace their entrepreneurial spirit by being creative and taking risks. We give opportunities to learn, grow and succeed. We recognize each other's hard work and acknowledge achievements.
Some of the other great things that make the SSC an excellent place to work:
Mentoring from Outstanding Leaders
Onsite Gym and Fitness Consultants
TTC Accessibility and Free Underground Parking
Walking Trails nearby
Associate Resource Groups (Orange Women's Network, Orange Pride, etc.)
Active Social Committee (Summer BBQ's, Holiday Party, Children's Holiday Party, etc.)
Giving Back to Our Communities (250 local community improvements across Canada)

Ability to Volunteer through a Team Depot events","Our IT team consists of some of the brightest technical people in the business. This team utilizes industry-leading technologies and works with business partners to understand strategic initiatives and deliver leading edge capabilities.  Help build our site to enhance our customer experience!

Come join our Ecommerce IT team, and work on our National enterprise website, homedepot.ca.  The site runs on Hybris / Java / Spring Framework, and we're looking for Java / Spring Developers to join our team.  You will work on functionality like Store Cart Checkout, Pricing, Product Details.  Our Co-op Students work on Production projects and issues.","Required Skills:
Working towards a degree in Computer Science, or related education
Development Experience with Java (1+ Years)
Spring Framework or any similar Java Framework (Spring MVC, Spring Boot, Jboot etc)
Object Oriented Development Experience
Development on Ecommerce / Storefront Projects (Magento, CommerceOS, Ebay etc)
Optional experience:
Javascript (Animation Libraries, AMD modules / Common JS Modules)
Jquery
Enterprise CMS Experience (Java based preferred)
Any Ecommerce platform experience like Magento, OSCommerce, Hybris, ATG, MS Commerce Server
Development on Web portals or websites","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,The Hospital for Sick Children,Neurosciences and Mental Health,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Intermediate,7,

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term required,The Children's Stroke Program is a leading center for clinical training, research and education in paediatric stroke worldwide. The Program supports the world's largest childhood ischemic stroke registry, The International Pediatric Stroke Study (IPSS), that has allowed clinicians, scientists and researchers from over 100 institutions to conduct cutting-edge research, helping us to better understand paediatric stroke and its causes, risk factors and improving outcomes. Collaborative initiatives and multi-disciplinary research have led to the establishment of standardized guidelines for stroke diagnosis, recommended clinical imaging protocols, and outcome assessments that explore neurological and cognitive deficits in paediatric stroke patients. Today, the IPSS continues to serve as a global network for pediatric stroke research and SickKids is proud to provide the data infrastructure, management and tools to facilitate this high-caliber research productivity.

column1: Within the Children's Stroke Program, The Stroke Imaging Laboratory for Children (SILC) facilitates large-scale imaging data acquisition (locally/internationally), processing and analysis. SILC aims to apply advanced neuroimaging techniques to uncover the neurobiological processes underpinning the mechanisms of injury, plasticity and recovery following paediatric stroke through analysis of our complimentary clinical and imaging databases. With this data, we have the potential to establish a more personalized, predictive and preventative model of care, and transform the field of childhood stroke.

We are looking for a Co-op Student to conduct advanced neuroimage processing and aid in the development of neuroimage analysis pipelines. The position is a unique opportunity for a qualified individual with background in engineering, programming and medical imaging.  The successful candidate will be supervised by Dr. Nomazulu Dlamini, Director of the Children's Stroke Program, Scientific Director of the International Pediatric Stroke Study and co-Director of SILC, and the team Research Analyst overseeing our neuroimaging data and existing pipelines.

This person will be joining a dynamic and hard-working team of clinicians, scientists and research personnel dedicated to improving the lives of children with stroke.","- Support The Stroke Imaging Lab for Children by learning about and conducting neuroimage (MRI) processing and analysis for various imaging methods e.g. fMRI, DTI.
- Participate in planning and development of neuroimage processing and analysis pipelines using various programming and scripting languages.

- Conduct literature reviews to identify appropriate methodologies to improve our understanding of paediatric stroke.","- Working towards an engineering degree, with particular interests in Biomedical Engineering and medical imaging.
- Experience using scripting and programming languages such as Bash, Python, Matlab.
- General knowledge of medical imaging methods, in particular structural and functional MRI.
- Experience using MRI image analysis tools e.g. FSL, AFNI, FreeSurfer, would be an asset.
- Experience in conducting literature reviews and critical appraisal of scientific articles.
- Ability to function independently yet collaboratively within a team.
- Willing to work closely with clinical and research collaborators.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- Have strong analytical and problem solving skills.
- Highly motivated with effective organizational skills involving time management and prioritization.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,The Hospital for Sick Children,SickKids,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",10,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The successful candidate will work in the academic research group of Dr. Stephen Scherer, embedded within The Centre for Applied Genomics (TCAG) at SickKids hospital in downtown Toronto. This group has a major focus on the genetics and genomics of autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and related neurodevelopmental conditions, grounded in previous work on genome-wide copy number variation. The student will work under the direct supervision of a member of our highly experienced team of researchers. This position represents an opportunity to contribute to worldwide consortium efforts in understanding the molecular neurobiology underpinning speech, language and social interaction disorders, and will present a significant learning opportunity to the right candidate. We are accepting students requiring either 4- or 8-month work terms.","This position will entail mainly laboratory (wet bench) work, validating discoveries made via high-throughput genomics approaches at TCAG. It is expected that the bulk of the work will be in designing PCR primers, amplifying regions of genes of interest, and preparing these amplicons for Sanger (capillary) sequencing at TCAG. Along with this work, it is possible that the student will also validate genomic copy number variants (CNV) using quantitative PCR. The student will also be responsible for identifying variants in sequence data and interpreting their potential impact on gene function.","The student will require a thorough academic grounding in genetics/genomics and/or molecular biology.

column1: Practical experience working in a research laboratory performing molecular biology techniques (not simply laboratory coursework) is required.
Experience analyzing and interpreting DNA sequence variant data will be an asset.
Experience in human genetics is preferable. Computational, bioinformatic and/or statistical expertise will be seen as a benefit.
The successful candidate will need to be collegial, interactive, and able to respond to both critical timelines and direction.
Excellent English language skills (both spoken and written) are required.
Previous experience presenting data to peers and co-workers will be helpful.
Organization and careful record-keeping are critical.
*Please do not apply if your major is in a discipline that is not relevant to genomics research.*","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,The Hospital for Sick Children,SickKids,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",9,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The successful candidate will work in the academic research group of Dr. Stephen Scherer, embedded within The Centre for Applied Genomics (TCAG) at SickKids hospital in downtown Toronto. This group has a major focus on the genetics and genomics of autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and related neurodevelopmental conditions, grounded in previous work on analysis of whole genome sequencing data. The student will work under the direct supervision of a postdoctoral fellow, within a highly experienced team of bioinformaticians from a diverse set of backgrounds. This position represents an opportunity to contribute to the development of novel methods for analysis of genome-wide data, including network and pathway analysis, and/or application of machine learning methods to identify genomic features from whole genome sequence data. We are accepting students requiring either 4- or 8-month work terms.","This position will entail working on methodologies and pipelines for whole genome analysis, under the supervision of an experienced mentor. Tasks may include writing scripts for parsing data; construction, maintenance and/or testing of analytical pipelines; methods development for novel approaches to network/pathway analysis; methods development for novel applications of machine learning to whole-genome sequence data; or other tasks as required.","The successful candidate will have a demonstrated ability to develop novel algorithms and approaches to analysis of complex data types.

column1: Proficiency in programming is desired. Thorough knowledge of a scripting language such as Python or Perl will be extremely helpful.
Practical working knowledge of R / Bioconductor is desirable.
Experience working with genomic data, particularly genome sequence data (and preferably from human samples) will be an asset.
Advanced knowledge of statistics would be a ""nice to have"" additional skill.
A thorough grounding in genetics/genomics and/or molecular biology would be a desirable asset, as would practical experience working in a research laboratory performing molecular biology techniques.
Experience in human genetics is preferable.
The successful candidate will need to be collegial, interactive, and able to respond to both critical timelines and direction.
Excellent English language skills (both spoken and written) are required.
Previous experience presenting data to peers and co-workers will be helpful.
Organization and careful record-keeping are critical.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,The Hospital for Sick Children,Surgery,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Intermediate, Senior",22,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,Research Assistant - Spine and Foot & Ankle Program

column1: Background information:

The division of Orthopaedic Surgery at Sick Kids and the Sick Kids Research Institute are dedicated to the enhancement of knowledge and treatment of pediatric orthopaedic conditions by high quality research. Our team of Orthopaedic Surgeons, trainees and Research Coordinators work collaboratively with multiple disciplines within the hospital to promote healing, prevent injury and improve quality of life through evidence-based medicine and innovation.

Our interest is in the outcomes of pediatric spine, foot and ankle conditions and surgical innovation. As new surgical techniques and medical devices are developed, evaluating the results of these advances is critical. Children will be enrolled inpatient registries. In addition to their medical and demographic information, we collect patient-reported outcome measures to ensure we capture the parents' and patients' perspective of changes in their pain and function as a result of their conditions and surgery. Current advances in foot and ankle surgery include the use of minimally invasive osteotomies around the foot with a side cutting-irrigated burr to decrease neurovascular and wound healing complications, and use of 3D modeling and custom cut guides for osteotomies around the ankle for improved accuracy and less operative time. Cutting-edge spine surgical research includes developing new blood transfusion protocols based on deep learning methodologies, development of enhanced recovery after surgery pathways for surgically treated spine patients and implementation and testing of navigation systems for surgical accuracy.","Student Job Duties, Tasks and Responsibilities:
· Students will be assigned primarily to one of the two programs (spine or foot & ankle); if students have a preference it will be considered
· Outpatient clinic review (including identification of study patients, obtaining research consent, in-clinic administration of questionnaires, sending/collecting follow-up questionnaires)
· Log monitoring and record keeping
· Study criteria review, eligibility screening
· Involvement in literature searches and identification of orthopaedic-related issues (e.g. scores, questionnaires, classification systems, etc.)
· Assist in preparing Research Ethics Board application submission and possibly manuscripts or abstract submissions
· Attendance of hospital teaching/information rounds (for student's interest)","Skills / Qualifications Needed:
· Basic computer skills, particularly database, spreadsheet and word processing (REDCap is most ideal)
· Excellent communication (verbal/written) and interpersonal skills
· Ability to work independently and as part of a team, as well as with children and families
· Excellent attention to detail and proven ability to learn new skills
· Excellent organizational skills to manage multiple tasks in a timely manner and flexibility to adapt to changing workload
· Able to keep written records
· Able to understand written and verbal directions
· Demonstrated knowledge of medical and scientific terminology an asset
Skills that students will develop or any learning that will take place on the job:
· Gain a basic understanding of the research process from initiation (protocol development), database creation and maintenance, to conclusion of a research study (testing hypothesis)
· Gain insight into policies, procedures and legislation governing the conduct of clinical trial trials in Canada
· Attendance of hospital teaching/information rounds on various topics

· Students may have an opportunity to accompany the Surgeon into the Operating Room and observe a surgical procedure. This is dependent on whether there is a patient enrolled into a surgical study during the students' placement and following authorization by hospital officials and patient consent
· Develop knowledge of medical and scientific terminology","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,The Mitchell Partnership Inc.,Head Office,2,Open for Applications,North York,Junior,31,

column8: ,4 month work term,The Mitchell Partnership Inc. was founded in Toronto (1958) as a mechanical building services consulting engineering practice. We have established alliances with selected firms-worldwide, facilitating qualified local representation in major centres. Our design philosophy expands TMP's services beyond traditional boundaries. We have cultivated a sensitivity for client and market priorities in all facets of the building services mechanical engineering field. Project types include a broad spectrum of commercial, high rise, institutional, retail and industrial applications of all sizes.

column1: The Mitchell Partnership Inc. has gained a unique reputation for the design of energy efficient mechanical systems. We research new and proven opportunities, listen to our clients' needs, and investigate local conditions before arriving at recommended design solutions. Many of our techniques have since become industry standards. In addition, our 25 years of overseas project participation has developed within us a respect for other social and technical cultures.

The Mitchell Partnership Inc. has prospered as a strong member of a project team. We contribute our full resources to the specifics of our own discipline, while maintaining an overall dedication to the ultimate success of the project and the objectives and requirements of the Client.
Job Description:

The position of Student Designer will involve hands on design of mechanical services under the supervision of a professional engineer. The position allows for a variety of work within the office as the position is not department specific. Whenever possible we try to get our students out into the field to witness the construction process first hand.  Opportunities exist for involvement with Plumbing, HVAC, Controls and Fire systems design and review.","Specific responsibilities of past student positions have been as follows:
HVAC load calculations and energy analysis
Duct distribution design
Hydronic systems design
Building condition reports
Commissioning reports and surveys
Assistance to project managers","This work experience will develop the following skills:
Problem solving skills (solving load problems)
Design experience
Drawing interpretation skills
Exposure to the field of Consulting
Increased understanding of mechanical services and their integration with all other aspects of a building
Report writing skills
Design review skills","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,The New Quarterly,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Intermediate, Senior",4,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The New Quarterly is an award-winning Canadian literary journal published out of St. Jerome's University. The student hired will serve as an assistant to The New Quarterly's Managing Editor. The student should have impeccable writing, editing, and communication skills. The student should also be self-driven, disciplined, organized, and efficient. The student should have interest in event planning; social media marketing; email communications; creative writing publications; and website editing, maintenance, and publishing (we will provide training). We will do our best to adjust the job to match a student's interest and skills to fulfilling projects.","Work includes daily administrative tasks, including, but not limited to:

column1: -   Inputting, tracking, and managing creative writing submissions and contest entries.
-   Maintaining correspondence with writers re: rejection, acceptance, and contracts.
-   Overseeing subscription management, answering subscriber questions and filling requests when needed.
-   Conduct relevant research for the magazine by tracking surveys, contest entries, and other data.

column1: ,The Ontario Public Service,Ministry of Economic Development, Job Creation, and Trade",1,Open for Applications,Toronto,"Junior, Intermediate",13,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Provides day-to-day support for the Business Advisory Services Branch within the Trade Policy, Industry and Investment Division at the Ministry of Economic Development, Job Creation and Trade (MEDJCT).

column1: Works under the guidance and in support of a Senior Policy and Program Advisor and a Team Lead within the Director's Office. The Director's Office team collaborates with three teams of Regional Managers and 26 Senior Business Advisors in the branch, who operate in Central, Eastern and Western regions across southern Ontario.
About the Business Advisory Services Branch

To help businesses grow, our Senior Business Advisors work with established firms to better understand business needs and growth opportunities to build the capacity of small and medium-sized businesses to scale and grow.
Our advisors provide tailored options, advice, analysis and practical recommendations for the unique business challenges faced by:
- established small and medium-sized businesses (10-500 employees)
- producers of tradable goods and services across all sectors
We support small and medium-sized businesses with:
- accessing capital
- assessing organizational strengths and identifying potential opportunities for improvement
- doing business with government
- understanding and navigating government regulations and compliance challenges
- making connections to other provincial ministries, and other levels of government
- networking with other businesses
- making connections with local partners (e.g. to help find skilled staff)
- facilitating discussions and referrals to support business capacity building, such as technology adoption and export readiness programs.

The team acts as a central voice for SMEs by collecting and analyzing qualitative business intelligence data from regional advisors and their client companies and ensuring this information is considered in government decision-making. In addition, the team creates resources to assist businesses in understanding new government changes, such as program or policy initiatives, that may affect their business.
The team also collaborates with the Ministry's policy and program areas to help drive change that benefits Ontario's SMEs, including COVID-19 related support to business.
Websites:
https://www.ontario.ca/page/ministry-economic-development-job-creation-trade
https://www.ontario.ca/page/business-advisory-services-small-medium-sized-businesses
About the Ministry of Economic Development, Job Creation and Trade
Ministry of Economic Development, Job Creation and Trade supports a strong, innovative economy that can provide jobs, opportunities and prosperity for all Ontarians.
What we do
- support job creation, innovation and economic growth for all Ontarians
- deliver a range of programs, services and tools to help businesses innovate and compete in today's fast-changing global economy
- help make investing in Ontario more attractive for businesses, while protecting the public interest
- cut red tape by eliminating unnecessary regulations to make Ontario companies more competitive
- support the growth of small and medium-sized businesses so they can connect with new export markets and customers
- manage a network of international trade and investment offices in key markets around the world
- organize international business missions to increase export and investment opportunities for Ontario's companies
- ensure Ontario's interests are well-represented in all trade matters and negotiations (including CUSMA, CPTPP and CETA) and drive strategic investment and trade analysis
- drive internal trade by working bilaterally with other provinces and territories and by implementing the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
- develop and implement marketing strategies and tactics that favourably position the province's key economic strengths and promote Ontario as the best place to invest, work, live and succeed
- develop strategies for priority industries and sectors in Ontario
- build strategic partnerships with leading companies and stakeholders within Ontario's economy
- work with research partners in universities, colleges and hospitals, entrepreneurs and business leaders
- foster scientific discovery and commercialization of new technologies and products that can be marketed to the world
- harness Ontario's talented workforce, entrepreneurial spirit and highly developed industry clusters
- promote economic immigration programs to attract skilled international talent
About the Trade Policy, Industry and Investment Division
The division is comprised of 6 branches including the Business Advisory Services Branch
Division Mandate:
- Operating as a 'resource hub' for existing and new businesses to obtain advice, services and supports to reduce barriers and maximize success, both in Ontario and globally;
- Acting as the ministry liaison to provide coordination with, and oversight of Invest Ontario;
- Developing government-wide investment- and sector-related policies and strategies to foster economic growth and strengthen Ontario's global competitiveness; and,

- Developing policies and strategies to support trade negotiations internationally and domestically.","- Conducts research and analysis to support the review and development of government policy and programs related to the economic development of SMEs.
- Writes briefing materials and reports. This can involve the collection and compilation of information, statistics and data for a variety of sectors and companies.

- Participates as part of a team to coordinate and successfully implement tools to assist Regional Senior Business Advisors in their work with businesses across the province. Tools can include summary notes about new and changed policies, programs and legislation.
- Utilizes the Ministry electronic customer relationship management (eCRM) software system to review data on businesses across Ontario.
- Supports the branch's COVID-19 business recovery efforts.","Knowledge
- General knowledge of major business sectors in Ontario (e.g., manufacturing, technology), and relevant business support programs and policies.
- General understanding of Federal and Provincial legislation, Ministry goals, objectives, and business support programs and policies.
- General understanding of business and economics is an asset but not required.
- Knowledge of computer operations and relevant software (Microsoft Dynamics/other CRM, Word, PowerPoint, Excel).
- Familiarity with Microsoft SharePoint and Teams are assets but not required.
Skills:
Research skills
- Research, summarize and analyze business-related data.
- Present findings in an organized and effective manner.
Oral and written communication skills
- Develop presentation materials that meet the unit's needs.
- Develop reports for management.
- Communicate in a clear and concise manner.
Interpersonal skills
- Work effectively with team members and others in the Ministry/ externally, such as government partners and businesses.
- Provide excellent customer/ client service.
Coordination and organizational skills
- Work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
- Independently manage daily work priorities and tasks to meet deadlines/targets.","Targeted Clusters

column1: We are looking for a student who can bring their knowledge of the Ontario Planning process and critical data to support and enhance our development application review process.
Position Purpose:

Reporting to the Manager, Programs and Process Improvement, this role is responsible for assisting the Branch with the input, maintenance and statistical analysis of planning and development related data; providing research on various planning topics as input into branch initiatives, reports and other documents; responding to inquiries from the public, local municipal staff and the development industry; supporting Development Planning section with administrative processing of new development applications; delivering strategic planning programs (including the Region's Centres and Corridors strategy), as well as collation of data and information, as directed.

PROCESS AND PROGRAM IMPROVEMENT
INITIAL LOCATION:      17250 YONGE STREET, NEWMARKET

UNION AFFILIATION:   CUPE LOCAL 905 (YORK REGION UNIT)
HOURS/WEEK:             35
Benefits to Student:
Gain valuable work experience in their field of study.
Apply learned skills in a professional setting.
Enhance their interpersonal and teamwork skills with professionals in the field.
Enhance critical thinking, written and oral communication skills.
Gain direct experience in the public sector environment and increase knowledge in the Planning & Economic Development field.
Work with a dynamic team of professionals, in a collaborative environment, supportive of educating young and up-coming professional planners.","1. Primary Responsibilities
Performs quality assurance tasks to ensure the accuracy of planning and development data gathered through the processing of new and revised development applications.
Conducts queries and performs statistical analysis of development data.
Inputs planning and development data as required.
Assists with various Regional planning initiatives and programs, such as the Centres and Corridors program, including participating in public events, education and outreach.
Provides research assistance on various planning topics; and assists with the preparation of reports as directed.
Updates various Department/Section manuals and process guides as required.
2. Other Duties
Assists the Development Planning section with administrative processing of new plans of subdivision and plans of condominium.
Responds to front counter inquiries from the public, municipal staff, development industry and consultants.
Performs other duties as assigned in accordance with Branch or Department objectives.","Qualifications
Currently enrolled on a full time basis in a University Degree program in Urban Planning, Geography, or related field.
Returning to school full time.
Knowledge of and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies including customer service, communication, team work, initiative/self management and accountability, and flexibility/adaptability.
Knowledge of data integrity and quality assurance concepts and practices.
Knowledge of the land development process in Ontario.
Self-motivated approach to working in both a team environment and on an independent basis.
Computer literacy utilizing MS Office software applications such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Working knowledge of GIS software (ArcMap) and Adobe products is an asset.
Ability to work outside regular business hours as required.","Targeted Clusters

column1: Position title: OperationsTechnician- Coop Student
Department: Transportation Services

POSITION PURPOSE:

Reporting to the Manager, Traffic Systems and Electrical Operations and under the direction of the Operations Technologist, Traffic Systems, provides technical operational support capability to ensure traffic operational characteristics are efficient and effective along the regional road network and to minimize vehicle congestion and delay utilizing the capabilities of the Centralized Traffic Control System (C.T.C.S.) along the Regional arterial road system.","MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Technical and Administrative Functions:
- Directly programming modems, Bluetooth devices, cameras and other technical components in support of intelligent devices at traffic signalized intersections.

- Analyzes traffic signal performance, initiates and performs response action to operational/communication outages to ensure safe and effective ongoing performance of the Region's traffic control systems.
- Maintains and reviews the operational performance of various systems.

- Investigates, coordinates and prepares response correspondence and reports on the assessment of the operational performance of traffic signal, Bluetooth and CCTV programs and associated communication support systems.
- Reviews, monitors and ensures plans of traffic control systems and records are in accordance with operational policies.
- Assists in traffic signal control system development, including ongoing review and assessment of emerging traffic control technology.
- Scheduling of mobile camera and portable message trailers for traffic surveillance and incident posting.
2. Other Duties:

- Performs other duties as assigned and in accordance with Branch and Departmental objectives.","- Currently enrolled in a full-time post secondary Engineering Program (University or Community College).
- Valid Ontario Class ""G"" driver's license free of any serious offenses under the Highway Traffic Act. (0 demerit points)

- Knowledge of and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies including customer service, communications, team work, initiative/self management and accountability, and flexibility/adaptability.

- Communication skills to correspond, create documents and to deal effectively with the general public over the phone and in person when handling complaints and/or requests (occasionally hostile).

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,Analyst, Treasury Office:

column1: The Treasury Office invests the Corporation's surplus funds and acquires, when necessary, appropriate cost effective external financing. We also manage the Corporation's financial underwriting and banking relationships. The Treasury Office analyzes and makes policy recommendations with respect to the Corporation's reserves and Development Charge Bylaw, property taxes and inter-governmental revenues. Treasury Office consists of five units:
- Cash and Investment Management
- Financing and Reserves
- Tax and Inter-governmental Revenues
- Growth Economics and Finance
- Development Financing and Administration

This analyst position is a shared resource amongst all of the business units within Treasury Office. Staff members in the Treasury Office provide financial analysis and recommendations to elected officials and senior management regarding changes to government legislation, tax policy, new sources of funding and other financial and economic matters. We also have the important role of protecting the Corporation against material financial loss resulting from the loss/destruction of its assets from third party liability claims.","Reporting to the Manager, Tax and Inter-governmental Revenue, the Analyst will:

Assist with the day-to-day operational functions of the Tax and Inter-governmental Revenue unit, including property tax analysis and forecasting, analysis of new provincial and federal funding program
Assist with tasks required by other units within Treasury Office on an as-needed basis
Support the development, review and coordination of Departmental deliverables, including reports to Committee and Council
Conduct research and prepare presentations, briefing notes, memos, and other documents as required using various software applications
Support the department in research and financial analysis efforts, including the development of financial models, data collection and analysis
Manage information in accordance with legislation and corporate standards","QUALIFICATIONS:
Currently enrolled on a full-time basis in a Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Public Administration, Policy Studies or related program.

Knowledge and skills in areas pertinent to the position, including public policy and administration, finance, economic analysis, strategic and business planning, project management and program evaluation.
Knowledge of and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies, including customer service, communication, teamwork, initiative/self-management and accountability, and flexibility/adaptability.

column1: ,The Regional Municipality of York,Finance Department,1,Open for Applications,Newmarket,Intermediate, Senior",8,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Treasury Office analyzes and makes policy recommendations with respect to the Corporation's reserves and Development Charge Bylaw, property taxes and inter-governmental revenues. The Treasury Office invests the Corporation's surplus funds and acquires, when necessary, appropriate cost-effective external financing. The office also manages the Corporation's financial underwriting and banking relationships. Treasury Office consists of five units:

column1: - Cash and Investment Management
- Development Financing and Administration
- Financing and Reserves
- Growth Economics and Finance
- Tax and Inter-governmental Revenues

This analyst position will be reporting to the manager of Growth Economics and Finance. This unit is responsible for providing strategic advice regarding the impact of growth on the Region's finances. Key files managed by the unit include: updating Region's development charge background study and bylaw, conducting long-term development charge collections forecast, modeling the impact of legislative changes on development charges, and conducing policy and legislative research regarding new revenue sources.  From time to time, this analyst may also support other treasury functions.","Reporting to the Manager, Growth Economic sand Finance, the Analyst will:
Make improvements to the Region's long-term development charge collections forecast model (an Excel model with VBA components) to make it more robust and efficient
Assist with tasks required by other units within Treasury Office on an as-needed basis
Support the development, review and coordination of Departmental deliverables, including reports to Committee and Council
Conduct research and prepare presentations, briefing notes, memos, and other documents as required using various software applications
Support the department in research and financial analysis efforts, including the development of financial models, data collection and analysis
Manage information in accordance with legislation and corporate standards","QUALIFICATIONS:
Currently enrolled on a full-time basis in Applied Math, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Public Administration, or related program.
