column8: ,4 month work term,About Us:

column1: In 2017, York Region was voted one of Canada's Best Diversity Employers and Canada's Top Employer for Young People. York Region offers career opportunities for both professionals and students. Our employees enjoy working in an environment of respect and dignity. Employees are central to providing and improving public services and directly contribute to a healthy community.

TRANSPORTATION SERVICES DEPARTMENT
TRANSPORTATION AND INFRASTRUCTURE PLANNING","Your Role:

column8: ,4 month work term,POSITION TITLE:                DATA & ANALYTICS TECHNICIAN - STUDENT

column1: DEPARTMENT:                    TRANSPORTATION SERVICES
BRANCH:                             ASSET MANAGEMENT
INITIAL LOCATION:            90 BALES DRIVE EAST, EAST GWILLIMBURY
REPORTS TO:                     PROGRAM MANAGER
UNION AFFILIATION:          CUPE LOCAL 905 (YORK REGION UNIT)
HOURS/WEEK:                    35

York Region has been recognized as a top employer in the Greater Toronto area. The Greater Toronto Top Employer award recognizes companies that are leaders in their field for progressive programs, benefits, employee satisfaction and community involvement. This serves to confirm what our dedicated staff have always known: York Region is not only a great place to live, it's a great place to work. York Region also continues to create and support corporate programs to help better serve its employees and the business needs of The Region. We view our diverse workforce as a strength and are committed to respecting cultural differences and promoting respect and dignity in the workplace.

The Transportation Asset Management Data Analytics (TAMDA) team is looking to hire a student(s) with a positive attitude, willingness to learn and ability to work within a team. The successful candidate(s) will bring knowledge in desktop and web based spatial technologies, database management and data modelling, visual analytics and presentation software. Our team is comprised of GIS and data professionals with many years of experience in their respective fields as we develop and support a variety of products for the Transportation Services department of York Region. As a member of the TAMDA team the candidate(s) will gain experience in application development, data management best practices and customer service as they work with clients.
Position Purpose:

Reporting to the Program Manager, and under the guidance and direction of senior staff, is responsible for delivering individual or team project work, supporting program operations, performing research, and undertaking special assignments. Activities of the Branch include data preparation, data management, developing and advancing web content and solutions, conducting data analysis, designing and developing information products, supporting learning events, and in-general supporting clients.
Benefits to Student
Gain valuable work experience in their field of study.
Apply learned skills in a professional setting.
Enhance their interpersonal and teamwork skills with professionals in the field.
Gain direct experience in the public sector environment.
Enhance written and oral communication skills.","Program Functions:
Supports the update and/or enhancement of Transportation data, through applied research and automation.
Assists in the design and development of information products such as maps, web maps, storymaps, dashboards, and other graphic products.
Assists in the development and enhancement of web map applications and websites.
Supports projects involving spatial analysis, image processing and text analytics.
Assists in the documentation of business processes and the collection/completion of metadata for various products.
Performs analytics and develops products drawing data from multiple sources including open data, databases, and spreadsheets.
Presents analysis and findings using various charts and visualization techniques/technologies.
Supports data quality and validation, documentation and data governance efforts.
Responds to general inquiries and fulfils data requests from internal and external clients.
Researches potential data strategies, solutions and technologies to meet departmental needs and evaluates opportunities for improvement.
Supports stakeholder meetings.
Supports learning events by developing training materials, conducting surveys, etc.
Project Functions:
Attends project meetings and participate in project workshops.
Assists with planning and coordinating project meetings/workshops.
Reviews documents and project plans; maintains up-to-date project status reports.
Takes meetings minutes and circulates minutes and other relevant materials as required.
Liaison, Communication and Customer Service Activities:
Ensures that services provided meet Regional customer service standards.
Manages information in accordance with legislation and corporate standards.
Other Duties:
Performs other duties as assigned in accordance with Branch or Department objectives.","Qualifications:
Currently enrolled on a full time basis in a post-secondary program in Computer Science, Geographic Information Systems/Geomatics, Environmental Science, Earth Science or related program.
Experience or knowledge in programming and development of statistical/processing applications.
Knowledge of databases including database design, integration, SQL, and data preparation tools (ETL).
Knowledge of Esri ArcGIS products: ArcMap/ArcGIS Pro/ArcGIS Online required. Other Esri products desired.
Knowledge of data visualization software (e.g. Power BI).
Knowledge of graphics software and understanding of visual design, including cartographic design.
Adept with MS-Office software applications.
Ability to learn and apply new technologies with minimal guidance or support.
Knowledge of and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies including communication, innovation, teamwork and collaboration, and personal ownership.
Ability to organize daily workload, set priorities and meet required deadlines.
Ability to work independently and work cooperatively with staff as part of a team.
Ability to travel to off-site work locations in a timely and efficient manner, as required.
Ability to work outside regular business hours, as required.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,The Regional Municipality of York,York Region Transit,1,Open for Applications,Richmond Hill,Intermediate, Senior",30,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Reporting to the Program Manager, Transit Planning, and under the guidance and direction of the Service Planners, is responsible for performing a variety of functions relating to the planning of public transit services; assisting with the collection, analysis and management of system performance related data (service hours, ridership, etc.); performing duties relating to introduction, revision and/or monitoring of transit services (service expansion, route reconfiguration or schedule changes, etc); reviewing development applications as they relate to transit supportive design; assisting with stakeholder consultation, preparing maps, assisting with the administration of specialized transit software, etc.

column1: Benefits to Student
Gain valuable work experience in their field of study

Apply learned skills in data analysis, data management, public administration, policy development, stakeholder consultation, specialized training as it relates to the provision of public transit services
Enhance their interpersonal and teamwork skills with professionals in the field
Contribute to the improvement of the urban environment by improving access to public transit services, thereby reducing the adverse effects of traffic congestion and low-occupancy vehicle usage
Gain valuable, specialized knowledge of transit planning and operations","Major Responsibilities
Assists with maintaining the databases for various transit statistics, including ridership, revenue hours, development review, etc.

Assists with development review process by reviewing development applications and/or conducting on-site visits and reporting back to the Service Planning team on the status of various subdivision and other development projects (using written text and digital photography)
Assists with ridership surveys (e.g. administrative functions of planning work, preparing field sheets, etc.)
Conducts ridership surveys (e.g. On/off counts, transfer traces, etc.)
Conducts schedule adherence and running time studies for planning purposes
Responds to customer service concerns and feedback on behalf of Service Planners when required
1. Data Management Activities:
Assists with the collection, tabulation and analysis of ridership data
Prepares monthly ridership reports for review by Service Planners
2. Administrative Functions:

Assists in the set up and maintenance of Service Planning files, including electronic file management and maintaining hard copies of various project files and library materials in accordance with Regional standards
Organizes meetings relating to various transit planning projects including preparation of agendas, minutes, room preparation, etc.
3. Inspection and Monitoring Functions:
Conducts site inspections as they relate to service performance and ridership
Monitors service and customer activities to assess effectiveness
4. Program Planning and Development Activities:
Assists in the documentation of processes as they relate to the Transit Service Planning functions
Assists with various aspects of Annual Service Plan development including standards review, service development and review, stakeholder consultation, etc.
Assists in the development of thematic maps and presentations to support Service Planning functions
5. Liaison, Communication and Customer Service Activities:
Participates in various forums to deliver transit information relating to services, programs, future plans, standards, etc.
Communicates effectively both orally and in writing to deliver transit information to a wide variety of stakeholder groups including businesses, students, general public, service agencies, etc.
6. Other Duties:
Performs other duties as assigned in accordance with Branch and Department objectives","Qualifications
Currently enrolled as a full-time student in a post-secondary related program
Valid Ontario Class ""G or G2"" driver's license, free of any demerit points and reliable vehicle for use on corporate business
Computer literacy utilizing MS Office software, and accuracy and proficiency utilizing word processing, spreadsheet, presentation and scheduling applications
Knowledge of, and demonstrated ability in, corporate core competencies including communication, team work, initiative/self-management and accountability, and flexibility/adaptability
Organizational skills to set priorities and work independently demonstrating accuracy and attention to detail while meeting deadlines in the presence of frequent interruptions
Good communication skills to deal with internal and external customers
Ability to work outside regular business hours, as required","Targeted Clusters

2.  Data Management and Administrative Functions:
- Assists with collection, tabulation and analysis of operational data.
- Collects data, analyzes and summarizes findings relating to various transit systems performance indicators including revenue hours, on-time performance, ridership, etc.

- Assists in set up and maintenance of scheduling files, and electronic file management and maintaining hard copies of various project files and library materials, in accordance with Regional standards.
- Assists in the documentation of processes as they relate to the Scheduling functions.
- Assists in the development of schematic maps and presentations to support Scheduling functions.
3.  Inspection and Monitoring Functions:
- Conducts site inspections as they relate to service performance and ridership.
- Monitors service and customer activities to assess effectiveness.
4.   Liaison, Communications and Customer Service Activities:
- Ensures services provided meet Regional customer service standards.
- Manages information in accordance with legislation and corporate standards.
- Participates in various forums to deliver transit information relating to services, programs, future plans, standards, etc.
- Communicates effectively both orally and in writing to deliver transit information to a wide variety of stakeholder groups including businesses, students, general public, service agencies, etc.
5.  Other Duties:
- Performs other duties as assigned in accordance with Branch or Department objectives.","Who We Are Seeking

column1: ,The RPM Groups,RPM Home Services,3,Open for Applications,Cambridge,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",3,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The RPM Group represents an exceptional line of home attic insulation. Our marketing sales representatives receive ongoing training, management, and administrative support to enable professional development and opportunities for advancement.

column1: RPM's Eco-Friendly Cellulose Insulation is a non-toxic natural product produced from 100% recycled papers helping reduce landfill waste and preserves natural resources. If there are baffles missing or incorrectly installed, we'll add them between every cavity that connects to the soffits. This will create a good ventilation system so the air can then pass over the insulation without disturbing it. Once ventilation is established, we add our blown-in insulation until an optimal depth, or R-Value, is reached.

RPM'S organization is founded and managed by sales professionals. We understand the needs and challenges faced in the sales profession and strive to create an environment where dedicated and focused individuals have access to resources and people that help them develop rewarding, fulfilling careers.

This position is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP).  The program provides funding to hire students for the purposes of experiential learning and is administered by Employment and Social Development Canada through partner organizations.
General eligibility requirements:
A Canadian Citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Registered as a full-time student in a post-secondary institution program
Not an international student requiring (or on) a work permit
Not an immediate family member of the employer","Responsibilities
- Meet with clients to fill out assessment forms
- Set free appointment for technicians
- Organize paperwork and calendar scheduling
- Meet at client's home to assess attic
- Laser measure square foot of attic, check f baffles and vapor barrier if needed
- Complete assessment paperwork
- Schedule appointment for tech to complete job","Hard worker/dedicated
-    Reliable and Punctual
-    Time Management
-    Communication skills
-    Positive attitude
-    People person
-    Work well in a team
-    Goal oriented","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,The STEAM Project,Divisional Office,4,Open for Applications,Richmond Hill,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",4,"

column8: ,4 month work term,We are looking for co-op students from a variety of backgrounds who are passionate about inspiring children and teens in the areas of Science, Technology, Engineering, Design, and the Arts. We develop projects and experiences that give kids hands-on opportunities to learn and build. We also offer virtual classes to kids across Canada to whom we ship project boxes. The co-op positions being offered are in-person and we are located in the North end of Richmond Hill. Please comment on your ability to commute to the Richmond Hill location in your Cover Letter.

column1: Please explore our website before applying so that you can learn about our programs: www.thesteamproject.ca
You may want to watch one of our former staff describing what it's like in our programs: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FSpFK8J0E6k&t=9s
Role and Responsibilities:

Work in a team developing hands-on projects, products, and lessons that will be used to teach children and teens about STEAM topics. These can include robotics and electronics projects, woodworking and mechanical projects, Art- and Design-based projects,  coding and game design, woodworking, and more.
Mindset:
Design the most enjoyable experience for kids participating in our programs
Strive to ensure the greatest educational impact of the projects
Optimize the use of materials, workflow, cost, and efficiency of production of projects","- Assist with planning and developing projects, activities, and lessons for kids and teens
- Develop level criteria for knowledge and skills
- Update safety and equipment guidelines and routines
- Delivery safety and skill training to campers
- Deliver lessons and activities","Prior Experience/Skills in the following areas will be helpful:
- Hands-on experience with hand and power tools
- Hands-on experience designing (2D/3D) for digital fabrication such as 3D printing and laser cutting
- Hands-on experience using digital fabrication equipment
- Experience with Coding, robotics and/or Electronics
Experience working with Children and/or teens will be helpful
Safety Training in the following areas will be helpful
- Emergency First Aid certification (Standard First Aid with CPR-C preferred)
- Experience with safety measures in a workshop and with fabrication equipment","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,theScore Inc,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",22,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Score Media and Gaming Inc. empowers millions of sports fans through its digital media and sports betting products. Its media app 'theScore' is one of the most popular in North America, delivering fans highly personalized live scores, news, stats, and betting information from their favorite teams, leagues, and players. The Company's sports betting app 'theScore Bet' delivers an immersive and holistic mobile sports betting experience and is currently available to place wagers in New Jersey, Colorado, Iowa and Indiana. Publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq (SCR), theScore also creates and distributes innovative digital content through its web, social and esports platforms.

column1: Typical Workday at theScore:
Assist theScore team across a range of marketing, growth and communications activities, including, but not limited to:
Researching and disseminating internally relevant daily news and trends related to mobile apps, digital, sports media, and sports betting.
Assisting in the development of marketing materials, including presentations, digital advertising, and newsletters.
Assisting in PR and communications activities, including researching and building media lists, and other material development as required.
Reviewing and analyzing data and assisting in compiling and distributing internal reports.
Other duties as required.
Requirements:
Holding or working towards a degree in public relations, communications, marketing, sports business or other related field.
Knowledge of a variety of tools including Word, PowerPoint and Excel. Experience using Photoshop or other design software is an advantage.
Excellent writing and research skills.
Good knowledge of all major social media platforms.
Self-starter able to work independently, as well as collaboratively as part of a fast-moving and agile team.
Knowledge or experience of sports and online gaming / sports betting is an advantage.","Typical Workday at theScore:
Assist theScore team across a range of marketing, growth and communications activities, including, but not limited to:
Researching and disseminating internally relevant daily news and trends related to mobile apps, digital, sports media, and sports betting.
Assisting in the development of marketing materials, including presentations, digital advertising, and newsletters.
Assisting in PR and communications activities, including researching and building media lists, and other material development as required.
Reviewing and analyzing data and assisting in compiling and distributing internal reports.
Other duties as required.","Requirements:
Holding or working towards a degree in public relations, communications, marketing, sports business or other related field.
Knowledge of a variety of tools including Word, PowerPoint and Excel. Experience using Photoshop or other design software is an advantage.
Excellent writing and research skills.
Good knowledge of all major social media platforms.
Self-starter able to work independently, as well as collaboratively as part of a fast-moving and agile team.
Knowledge or experience of sports and online gaming / sports betting is an advantage.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,theScore Inc,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Intermediate, Senior",1,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term required,Score Media & Gaming Inc. (""theScore"") empowers millions of sports fans through its digital media and sports betting products. Its media app 'theScore' is one of the most popular in North America, delivering fans highly personalized live scores, news, stats, and betting information from their favorite teams, leagues, and players. theScore's mobile sports betting app 'theScore Bet' delivers an immersive and holistic mobile sports betting experience. Natively built for iOS and Android devices, theScore Bet is deeply integrated with theScore's media app and is currently available to residents of New Jersey. Publicly traded on the TSX Venture Exchange (SCR), theScore also creates and distributes innovative digital content through its web, social and esports platforms.

column1: As part of the theScore team, you will be working with a team of smart, friendly, and dedicated Engineers, Product Managers and Designers determined to deliver some of the best apps the market has to offer. We want you to be challenged and to get the full experience of what it's like to work at theScore!","Working with our preferred technology stack (Primarily Elixir/Phoenix, Ruby on Rails, modern JavaScript).
Develop, scale, and optimize amazing GraphQL & RESTful APIs.
Be part of our backend service teams supporting web and mobile clients.
Build front-end applications using modern JavaScript technologies (React, TypeScript).
Participate in the design, architecture, and delivery of new features in a collaborative agile/scrum environment.
Other duties as required.","A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, distributed systems, algorithms and software design.
Passionate about clean code architecture and software craftsmanship.
Experience with modern web framework and API development (Elixir/Phoenix, Ruby on Rails, Sinatra, Django, Node).
Experience with Git and GitHub or similar.
A strong grasp and experience with relational databases; including PostgreSQL, MySQL & CockroachDB.
Experience with background job processing (Exq, Sidekiq, Celery, Beanstalk, RabbitMQ).
Comfortable working in the terminal.
Proficiency within an editor of your choice.
Experience with testing frameworks such as ExUnit, RSpec, Jest, pytest or equivalent.
Experience working with profiling tools.
Knowledge and familiarity with caching strategies and tools.
Consuming and integrating with third party APIs.

NICE TO HAVE: Familiarity with GraphQL APIs (Absinthe), GraphQL schema stitching & subscriptions, GCP, Kubernetes, JavaScript SSR, contribution to open source software, experience working at startups, passion for sports and/or esports.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,ThinkData Works,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Intermediate,12,

column8: ,4 month work term,About ThinkData

column1: ThinkData Works Inc. is a Toronto-based technology startup whose data catalog is used by some of the foremost organizations in the world to process and refine data into usable products. We host one of the largest repositories of publicly available data - including the world's largest repository of COVID-19 data - and enable our clients to discover, govern, and monetize that data that powers their business. We've raised more than $11 million in financing from world-class venture capital firms including First Ascent Ventures, Yaletown Partners, Extreme Venture Partners, and the BDC

Our tech, our growth, and our team have been acknowledged for their excellence through various industry awards including being recognized as one of Canada's Top Growing Companies by the Globe and Mail, one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures by Waterstone Human Capital, and the Overall Data Science Solution of the Year by Data Breakthrough Awards.
About the Role

We are looking for an energetic UX/UI Co-op to join our Engineering & Development Team. The Co-op will support the Design/Engineering & Development team with ux design processes and updating and maintaining the Namara Platform's design system. This position will report to the UX Designer, and will work closely with the Engineering and Development team.","Job Responsibilities
Work with the UX Design team to build and maintain the Namara Platform design system.
Participate and/ or conduct interviews with Data and Sales teams for research and discovery efforts to improve the platform's user experience.
Collaborate with Design, Product and Engineering to define and create user workflows, wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs.
Effectively communicate approved designs and create UI specifications that can be easily understood and executed on by developers.","Job requirements
You are currently enrolled in a UX or related field with an interest in and have completed courses in Computer Science studying at a university or college program in your 2nd, 3rd, or 4th year
You are familiar with a range of design tools - experience with Figma, or similar is a must (i.e. Sketch, Adobe XD,  InVision, Balsamiq etc.)
You have previous experience with HTML, CSS and Javascript
Previous co-op experience at a startup, a small company, or in a fast-paced environment is  a plus
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills
You are calm under pressure, can be decisive, and optimistic
Legally eligible to work in Canada","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term required,About ThinkData

column1: ThinkData Works Inc. is a Toronto-based technology startup whose data catalog is used by some of the foremost organizations in the world to process and refine data into usable products. We host one of the largest repositories of publicly available data - including the world's largest repository of COVID-19 data - and enable our clients to discover, govern, and monetize that data that powers their business. We've raised more than $11 million in financing from world-class venture capital firms including First Ascent Ventures, Yaletown Partners, Extreme Venture Partners, and the BDC

Our tech, our growth, and our team have been acknowledged for their excellence through various industry awards including being recognized as one of Canada's Top Growing Companies by the Globe and Mail, one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures by Waterstone Human Capital, and the Overall Data Science Solution of the Year by Data Breakthrough Awards.
About the Role

We're looking for a Field Data Scientist Co-op to join ThinkData Works at our Toronto HQ, and to work as a key member of our Data team. This role will involve hands-on data analytics as well as the development and monitoring of connectors. Our ideal candidate wants to be part of a team that solves real-world problems and enables clients to use better data and use data better.","Reporting to the VP of Data, the Field Data Scientist Co-op plays a key role in the delivery of data products and solutions by:
Conducting research to identify data sources and data products for specific client requirements
Building connectors to data sources, QA-ing and wrangling datasets to conform to ThinkData standards

Managing our large open and public data catalog by connecting to new sources as they become available and monitoring existing connections.","Design and build data products. You are currently enrolled in a relevant degree program such as Statistics or Mathematics or Data Science, and have working knowledge of Python, R and/or Ruby.
Wrangle data. You are familiar with data wrangling using scripts and a variety of tools, such as Pandas, OpenRefine or similar.
Visualize data. You are familiar with one or more visualization tools: Tableau, Excel, Power BI etc. and have the ability to quickly learn new tools

Collaborate. You can work as part of the team, or work autonomously. You are adaptable, flexible, and able to adjust to a dynamic startup environment. Previous experience working at a startup environment is an asset

Evolve with us. The landscape is being built under our feet as we move forward, so we need people who can channel their passion, learn quickly, and navigate the unknown at top speed.","Targeted Clusters

About the Role

We are looking to add a Frontend Developer to our Platform development team. You will be working side-by-side with other engineers, UX Designers and Product Owners to design and implement brand new features to help us scale our data catalog platform. This role will report to a Lead Developer on your team.","Day to Day Responsibilities
Contribute to team activities likes planning sprints, taking part in daily scrums and retros, and assisting with scheduled releases
Meeting with the Design team and product stakeholders to understand user expectations, build out workflows and QA strategies
Supporting your team through implementing new features, fixing bugs, and assisting with triaging incoming issues
Confidently making software design decisions and effectively communicating your choices and opinions to others","Required Skillset
Currently enrolled in an engineering program (or equivalent program) in your 2nd, 3rd or 4th year.
Strong problem solving skills and programming fundamentals
An understanding of web technologies and conventions
Experience developing with Javascript, and using state-based SPA frameworks such as ReactJS + Redux
Comfortable developing an application using a REST API or RPCs
Familiarity with using modern CSS, and tools such as SASS
Comfortable working with a version control system, such as Git","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Third Sector Publishing Inc,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Intermediate, Senior",11,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Third Sector Publishing is the creator of CharityCAN, a SaaS platform that helps Canadian charities find, qualify and connect with major donors.

column1: We want the organizations improving the world we live in to get the funding necessary to continue their work. We help them by bringing data from across the internet together into major donor profiles, connecting charities to funders in the process.
As a full stack web developer, you'll help us with that mission by designing, building and maintaining new features for CharityCAN.
You'll be a member of our small, agile team, making real contributions to our platform.

This will be a remote co-op position for the Winter 2022 term. You will be asked to work from a home office or other remote location. Computer equipment will be provided to students local to Waterloo Region.","As a full stack web developer, you'll be writing code across our entire web application to:
- Import and update the data in our database
- Connect CharityCAN to other 3rd party data sources
- Retrieve data from our database and serve it to the front end via a RESTful API
- Create new frontend UI and UX to present the data to our users in a useful way

Our web application has a React JS frontend powered by a .NET web API (and some legacy VB code) and a SQL database + Neo4j graph database backend. We sprinkle in other web technologies where applicable too (redis, node.js, npm).
Our backend data processing suite is written in python.","We're looking for someone who can get started relatively quickly. To that end, we're hoping you have experience with:
- Creating modern web applications (or some part of one)
- At least one of the following technologies from a previous work term: Javascript, C#, SQL, python
- Source control (e.g. Git)
Bonus points for experience with/interest in:
- React JS
- The .NET web stack
- Cloud infrastructure (Azure)
- Graphing databases (Neo4j)
- Database ORMs
- MVC web frameworks","Targeted Clusters

column5: MATH - Computer Science","University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report"

column1: ,Thomson Reuters,Toronto Office,11,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",37,"

column8: ,4 month work term,About Us

column1: Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we have been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world's most global news services - Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in a flexible work environment that celebrates diversity and inclusion. In today's time, where objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them.
What's in it for you?

Grow your career in software development by working on our market-leading technology solutions. Apply your skills and passion for technology to work with a team driving innovation throughout the entire software lifecycle, from defining specifications and architecting designs to writing efficient and maintainable code. Here's your chance to participate in enhancements of Thomson Reuters software utilized by professionals across the globe, while developing your expertise along the way.
Want to hear from our engineers on how it is like #WorkingatTR? Check out- Video 1, Video 2
Where are we located?

Our Technology Centre location is a short walk away from Union Station in downtown Toronto. The fresh new office space features a game room, open collaboration spaces, amazing views of the waterfront and the CN Tower, healthy snacks in our kitchen, and regularly scheduled fun team events.
But due to the given pandemic, we are working remotely till August 2021, which will be further reviewed based on the situation.
Awards
Thomson Reuters has been recognized by
- WayUp Top 100 Internship Programs 2020
- The Career Directory, as Canada's Best Employer for Recent Graduates
- 2021 Campus Forward Honoree
- Fairygodboss as Best Companies for Women
- Greater Toronto's Top 2020 Employers
- FORTUNE as a World's Most Admired Company

- Globe and Mail as a Top 100 Employers in Canada for nine consecutive years","You will work as part of a development team producing maintainable and high-quality software using modern agile methodologies. Whether solving today's challenges or tomorrow's ambitions, you're partnering with the industry's smartest thinkers, delivering powerful results both personally and professionally. We'll bring you the tools - you put them in motion.
You will gain:
Experience in a collaborative, agile work environment delivering consumer product
The tools you need to be successful, in a relaxed work environment
Sharpened technical skills with the opportunity to grow a career, not just a job","Qualifications:
You have a passion for technology
You are self-motivated with the ability to work effectively on a team
You also have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Your specific experience includes:
Solid academic record
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Having experience in one of the following areas:
C++, C#, or Java
Web application development, Web services, Mobile development or Cloud services (AWS, Azure)
Good understanding of object-oriented design, data structures and algorithms
Development and troubleshooting of customer-facing software applications
Software testing, performance tuning within large and complex software systems","Targeted Clusters

MATH - Computing and Financial Management","University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report"

- Fairygodboss as Best Companies for Women

- The Career Directory, as Canada's Best Employer for Recent Graduates","As a Machine Learning Intern, you will be part of a diverse and interdisciplinary global team of experts in the field of NLP, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, and User Experience, driving Digital and AI transformation for one of our company's blue-chip products Legal Tracker.

Legal Tracker is an industry-leading corporate legal solution with a focus on matter management, e-billing and analytics. As a SaaS offering, this product caters to over 1400 corporate legal departments in North America to streamline operations, control spend and get complete visibility into the legal landscape.
About the Role
In this opportunity as a Machine Learning Intern, you will:
Develop and Deliver: Applying modern software development practices, you will be involved in the entire software development lifecycle, building, testing and delivering enterprise software solutions
Be a Team Player: Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams
Be an Agile Person:  With a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines
Be Innovative: You are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries

Be an Effective Communicator: Through dynamic engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments","About You
You're a fit for the role of a Machine Learning Intern if you:
Have experience with NLP, creating machine learning models
Strong experience with programming languages like Python, Java, or Scala
Strong experience with data systems like DBMS, SQL, ElasticSearch
Understand API development and best practices
Demonstrate proficiency in automation, system monitoring, and cloud-native applications.
Experience in ML development with Azure is a plus
Have academic and/or industry experience in building machine learning models and/or systems with the ability to translate the latest research papers into implementations addressing our use cases
Are curious, adaptable learner, empathetic and can teach & lead others
Passion about technology and building enterprise software
A Ph.D. or Masters in a data-heavy technical field, such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or other data-heavy disciplines is a plus","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,We are looking for an energetic, creative and passionate individual wanting to work on a product that makes a difference. The Co-op Cloud Infrastructure Engineer will get to work across many different aspects of the stack: deployment, server-side programming, security, cloud architecture, distributed Linux systems, performance and monitoring. The start date for this position is January 3rd, 2022 and is a 4-month term.

column1: Our team keenly observes technology trends but strives to balance practical business concerns with technical requirements. Some of our core principles are: agreement culture, infrastructure as code and automating repeatable tasks. This is a technical role, but we are willing to mentor you if you are motivated to learn. We are an inclusive team where everyone treats each other with respect.
This role is remote.","Collaborating with team members to build infrastructure that will scale to handle our growing user base
Helping solve and debug performance problems
Designing and architecting new cloud solutions to support our expanding infrastructure
Working with a modern distributed web application architecture
Sharpening your abilities with Kubernetes, Linux and Python programming
Implementing creative solutions to various technical problems
Supporting technical design and other internal development teams","Willingness to work with a remote and distributed team
Ability to work independently and efficiently and you have the confidence to ask questions
Strong Computer Science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, Linux operating systems and relational databases
Passionate about building reliable distributed systems and you understand trade-offs made when engineering a feature
Knowledge of how the web works, comfortable diving deep into HTTP, TCP/IP and IPTables
Thoughtful about data architecture, data migration and database performance tuning
Strong communication skills, you're excited to explain complex technical concepts and share your knowledge with different audiences
Enrolled in a computer science program at an accredited Canadian university or college","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Are you interested in learning how to market cutting-edge software applications to healthcare, facility management, and IT professionals and c-suites? Would you describe yourself as a wordsmith? Design wizard? Social media maven? Are you curious about technology, startups, and high-tech marketing? Well, ThoughtWire's Marketing Internship may be right for you.

column1: Step into our world where only three things really matter: our customers, our message, and our channels. As our superstar marketing intern you'll get exposure to the entire marketing value chain, from strategy, to messaging, to content writing, social media strategy, events and all things digital.

We're a small collaborative team; you'll report to the Digital Marketing Manager and help drive multiple projects. This isn't a get-us-coffee-and-organize-our-files kind of internship. We want to help you learn by doing. This role is ideal for someone who wants first-hand experience in what it feels like to be a part of a fast-growing startup.","What you'll get to do:

Content Writing and Marketing Operations: Help us write compelling blog content for our thought leaders, publish this content on HubSpot with great images and copy to help convert readers to followers and eventually customers.
Design: Use various design programs (Adobe specifically) to create impactful content to share on social and help with the design of various gated assets.
Social Listening: Keep an ear to the ground for any ThoughtWire news that needs to be re-posted to our site, what our competitors are talking about, and our share of voice in the markets we serve.
Market Research: Help us stay on top with all the latest advances from the building tech world, as well as compiling competitive analysis reports.

Special Projects: Get in on exciting projects alongside our brilliant software engineering team, or with our designer, or in media relations, or any other initiative that may come our way from time to time.","Finally, this is your internship if you're interested in SEO, advertising, working with sponsored content, or marketing automation/operations in tools like HubSpot there is endless opportunity to get involved and help make TW's marketing team stronger.
We're looking for someone in their penultimate or final year of study in:
BCom or BBA
Marketing, communications, journalism, or related field
What would make you stand out (but not essential):
Experience with email marketing
Experience in video editing
Experience using HubSpot","Targeted Clusters

column1: You will help us to make great software, while we help you to acquire new skills.

About ThoughtWire

ThoughtWire delivers smarter, safer and more efficient built environments including hospitals, commercial buildings, and cities. Our innovative software applications put people first, whether for clinicians, patients, office workers, or first responders; ThoughtWire puts people in control. Powered by our Digital Twin technology, ThoughtWire's applications for smart hospitals, smart buildings, and smart cities unlock the value of data generated from built environments by combining it with context from people, processes and IoT devices.

We are a friendly team made up of people with diverse backgrounds, different levels of experience and a wide spectrum of knowledge and skills. We are committed to agile processes, touch many cutting edge technologies, and use a wide array of open source software.

ThoughtWire is located in the eclectic St. Lawrence neighbourhood in downtown Toronto, close to Union station, the subway and streetcar routes. Enjoy great restaurants, interesting parks, fabulous street life and a close knit team.","- Collaborate with teammates to explore, create and refine user stories
- Contribute to estimation and planning of the work required
- Design and implement, usable, supportable and valuable software components
- Participate in test-driven development, design and code reviews
- Collaborate with team members with a range of skills to produce well tested, working software","Required Skills
- Interest in software development experience building working software
- Ability to program in at least one OO programming language (e.g. Java, JavaScript C#, C++)
- Working knowledge of design and testing practices for software
- (In progress) B.S. in Computer Science or related field
Experience That Will Make You Stand Out
- Past internship experience, ideally in enterprise software companies","Targeted Clusters

About ThoughtWire

ThoughtWire's smart building and smart hospital software solutions empower its clients in commercial real estate and healthcare to optimize building operations and improve occupant experience by orchestrating data from people, processes, and the connected building in a smart digital asset - the Built Environment Digital Twin.

ThoughtWire's innovative applications that are deployed in the cloud and on-premise, are all powered by ThoughtWire's Built Environment Digital Twin, which breaks down silos of data to deliver the right information to the right people in context so they can take action. Whether it's creating a seamless experience for officer workers inside a building or streamlining clinical operations, ThoughtWire is determined to make built environments healthier, safer, and more efficient places to live, work and play.

We are a friendly team made up of people with diverse backgrounds, different levels of experience and a wide spectrum of knowledge and skills. We are committed to agile processes, touch many cutting edge technologies, and use a wide array of open-source software.

ThoughtWire has responded to COVID-19 by moving to entirely remote work. Our organization is very well adapted to virtual work; adopting modern video conferencing and collaborative tools (Zoom, GSuite, Asana, Miro, etc.) and business practices (daily standups).

Should we have the opportunity to safely return during your term, ThoughtWire is located in the eclectic St. Lawrence neighbourhood in downtown Toronto, close to Union Station, the subway and streetcar routes. Enjoy great restaurants, green space, fabulous street life and a close-knit team.","Strategic Initiatives is a small team with a wide range of responsibilities - if you consider yourself a Swiss Army knife, this is a role for you!

-Collect and analyze data, summarizing findings in a structured format

-Understand and interpret new trends in the industry","-Excellent written and oral communication skills

-Strong time management skills and the ability to multi-task","Targeted Clusters

column1: We are currently seeking a student interested in structural design for a co-op placement with our firm. The prospective candidate will be working directly under the guidance of our senior staff and will be involved in work related to custom house designs, industrial manufacturing, inspections, analysis of existing buildings, and structural drafting. If you have experience with structures and want to work with a youthful and growing firm this position is perfect for you!","Roles and Responsibilities
Conduct site visits to collect measurements, field surveys, and meet with clients.

Civil Engineering student with a specific knowledge of structures.
Design experience with projects such as custom houses, concrete foundations for steel structures and pre-engineered structures.
Experience in structural engineering related to wood, steel, and concrete an asset - especially wood framing experience.
Driven and self motivated.
Experience in field reports and site condition assessments an asset.
Knowledge and experience of Ontario Building Code Parts 4 and 9 considered an asset.

column8: ,4 month work term,Software Engineer, Co-op

column1: Engineering Department
Thumbtack
Toronto / Remote

We're the technology leader building the modern home management platform. Today, millions of people use Thumbtack to effortlessly manage their homes. We help them confidently know what to do, when to do it and who to hire.

Our goal is simple: to be the only platform homeowners need to fix, maintain and improve their homes. As a long-term partner for homeowners, our promise is to turn what was once confusing and intimidating into something straightforward - and a lot less stressful.

At Thumbtack, we're not just creating a new era of homeownership. We're supporting local economies and building stronger communities. Each day, we connect local professionals across America with busy homeowners so they can grow their businesses.

Thumbtack is for everyone. Our customers and pros come from all walks of life and every county in the country. We want our team to reflect that. If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply.
Our North Star is bright and our ambitions are big. We've been at this for over a decade, but the way we see it: we're just getting started.
Thumbtack by the Numbers
Available in all 3,143 U.S. counties.
Nearly 4.5 million customers in the last 12 months
Hundreds of thousands of local professionals on our platform
65 million projects started on Thumbtack
Over 7 million 5-star reviews left for stellar pros
About the Engineering Team

At Thumbtack, engineers at every level build products and systems that directly impact our customers and professionals. Our challenges span a wide variety of areas, ranging from building search and booking experiences to optimizing pricing systems, to building tools to help professionals grow their businesses. We believe in tackling these hard problems together as a team, with strong values around collaboration, ownership, and transparency. To read more about the hard problems that our team is taking on, visit our engineering blog.
About the Role

During this 16 week internship at Thumbtack, you will be paired with a mentor on the engineering team to work through exciting technical problems in your area of interest. We deeply value autonomy, so you will be given freedom to work with your mentor to find a project (or several) that interest you, while providing value to the larger team. We promise to make your time at Thumbtack fun, memorable, and unique as we work together to solve marketplace challenges. Please check out the blog post from one of the recent co-ops about her rewarding experience at Thumbtack.","Responsibilities
Driving your internship project(s) to completion, with a tenacious focus on the business impact of your project(s)
Prioritizing tasks to deliver on goals with a sense of urgency
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to plan and execute on your project and solve tough technical problems.
Meeting regularly with your mentor and proactively asking for help when needed--think of them as your cheerleader","Must-Have Qualifications
If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.
Pursuing a full-time BMath/BCS/BSE/BASc degree
Graduating in 2022 or 2023
Excellent coder-- code is both clean and concise
An appetite for learning and passion to help others
Nice-to-Have Qualifications
Relevant internship experience

You're fluent in at least one major programming language and would be able to switch between multiple languages. In our stack, we mainly use Go, PHP, React/Redux, Javascript/Typescript, and Scala, with Swift and Kotlin for our mobile apps.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Tilray Inc,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Leamington,Junior,3,

column8: ,4 month work term,About Tilray

column1: Tilray is a global pioneer in cannabis research, cultivation, processing and distribution currently serving tens of thousands of patients in ten countries spanning five continents.
Looking to develop your career at the forefront of a rapidly expanding industry.

The Internal Audit team's mission is to provide independent, objective assurance and support designed to add value and improve the operations of Tilray Inc. The team partners with all segments of the business, to understand how things work within the Company as well as effectively communicate recommendations or drive insights from your findings.

Reporting to Manager of Internal Audit for the four-month period, you will be involved with various projects that would allow you to gain a strong understanding of the cannabis industry, as well as strengthen your skillset as an aspiring CPA.

This position can be located at both our Toronto and Leamington offices.","In addition to being enrolled in a post-secondary education program and being available for a four month Co-op term commencing in January 2021, we believe that you will be successful if you are:

A critical thinker. What we are looking for are individuals who are curious to understand and learn the audit procedures and challenge the status quo in a constructive method. Having professional skepticism is key to the role.

A collaborator. Internal audit works with all departments to fully understand the business. This means that you will need to have a passion for collaborating with different people and excellent interpersonal skills. Having strong communication skills would be key to work effectively with different people from various departments.

A juggler. While the ability to actually juggle would be a cool skillset, this role would require you to figuratively juggle various projects on the go. With many projects underway and ever-changing priorities, it is critical for this person to have a positive attitude to changes as well as strong project management skills to reprioritize and communicate with stakeholders in order to meet tight deadlines.

An innovator. The internal audit team is consistently looking for ways to utilize the tools that are available to be more effective and efficient. A person who has proficiency in Microsoft Office tools such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is required. Experience in different project management, reporting, and auditing applications would also help in this role.","Key Responsibilities
Help lead the design and execution of audit/evaluation programs;
Assess new and existing processes to identify risks and recommend improvements including activities related to Sarbanes Oxley 404 internal control projects;
Interpret and conclude on audit findings and make practical recommendations;
Prepare reports documenting audit/evaluation scope, procedures, findings and recommendations;
Effectively communicate with and educate process owners, including non finance individuals, on the importance of controls, an effective control environment, and the role of Internal Audit
Work on special projects that arise based on the need of the business

Due to the nature of the business and working with controlled substances, all new employees will be required to complete a background check prior to starting work. This may include: verifying work references, validating all credentials and criminal record checks.
It is a requirement that the selected Candidate be legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer is presented.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Titanium Agency is a performance marketing agency located in the heart of Uptown Waterloo. column1: Students at Titanium are offered all the opportunities our full-time staff enjoy.  If you are intelligent, hard working and ambitious, the sky is the limit for you here.  Everyone here is given as much responsibility as they can manage.

You will be fully integrated with the team and will be the primary developer on these projects.","Engaged in all aspects of the software development lifecycle

column1: ,TMX Group Inc.,Head Office,2,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior,6,

column8: ,4 month work term,TMX Group is an integrated, multi-asset class exchange group. TMX Group's key subsidiaries operate cash and derivative markets and clearinghouses for multiple asset classes including equities, fixed income and energy. We also provide clearing facilities, data products and other services to the international financial community. TMX Markets consist of the Derivatives and Equities Trading businesses of the TMX Group.

column1: The Student Intern - Analyst, Market Strategy & Insights will be part data-scientist and part developer, with a keen interest in business. In this role, the Analyst will work at the intersection of business and technology, developing solutions for the business by leveraging the enterprise's considerable technology and data assets.

The Analyst will leverage Big Data tools and the Enterprise Data Platform to aid in the development of quantitative analytics that will guide and support strategic decision making, as well as provide pertinent data-driven insights to internal stakeholders and key clients.

The Analyst will also develop Web Applications, scripts and back-end services that will help our Sales, Operations and Product Development teams realize efficiencies through process automation and self-serve analytics.","* Leverage TMX data assets to provide quantitative and strategic support to internal and external stakeholders, namely:
* Product Design - identify opportunities for revenue optimization and new products
* Clients-  facilitate the optimization of client interactions with TMX Markets products to ensure they derive maximum value from our product suite
* Market Research - identify emerging trends and anomalies in market place behaviour
* Business Development - assess opportunities to attract new customer segments, diversify revenue sources and deliver new value-add services
* Develop tools, processes and analytics to deliver meaningful insights and automate processes for our internal partners in Sales, Operations and Product Development:
* Web Applications that provide an interactive front-end to allow users to run analytics and extract pertinent data
* Back-end services that interact with multiple data sources in order to compile and serve clean, high quality data for downstream processes
* Scripts to automate data extraction, cleaning and transformation

* Scripts to automate reporting processes and identification of relevant insights","* Currently working towards an undergraduate degree in a quantitative or technology focused field such as Computer Science, Engineering or Business with a joint degree/minor in an quantitative/analytical discipline
* Experience working with Big Data tools such as Presto, Hive, Apache Spark. Experience writing queries in SQL is also an asset.

* Experience/ interest in using a modern JavaScript framework (such as React, Angular or Vue) and writing code in JavaScript and Python. Experience with languages such as Java, C++ and Perl is also an asset.
* Experience using tools such as Docker, Git, JIRA. Experience working in an Agile environment is an asset
* An excellent communicator with strong interpersonal, analytical and research skill
* A self-starter who is hardworking, flexible and able to work independently as well as part of a dedicated team in a demanding environment.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Together Software Inc,Divisional Office,3,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",5,"

column8: ,4 month work term,About Together Software:

column1: Hi, I'm Nathan, cofounder at Together Software. Learning at work is broken, especially at large or remote companies, and we're enabling peer to peer learning between employees to fix it. Organizations like the United Nations, Disney and 7-11 are already using us to run mentoring programs to up-skill their employees. Our investors are the same ones that invested in Slack, Coinbase, and Instacart.

For example, the United Nations uses our product to connect employees from around the world to discuss how they should choose the next country to work in, how to get promoted faster, or what skills they need for their next job. We launched through Y Combinator in Summer 2019.
Here's a few things you might be tasked with solving:
- Can you engineer a product that will grow virally inside the organization (starts with 1 mentoring program and expands to all use-cases and all employees)?
- Can you work with the rest of the team to create a defensible brand?
- Can you help us hire the right team? We take hiring seriously and want to keep the dream team alive in engineering - we had only 2 engineers up until 50 customers!
Mission
Make learning at work social. Let's build the next ubiquitous software product together.","What you'll be doing:
As Together moves into the enterprise market, our customers expect smooth, painless experiences and measurable business value. You will own several projects including:
-Onboarding flows
-New product lines, such as new mentorship program formats
-New integrations and infrastructure management (Identity, Human Resource Info Systems and Task queues)
-End to end reliability engineering
-Reporting and reporting data pipelines
-Managing interns and junior engineers","Qualifications
You can build web back-ends with Node.js (v12) or Python (v3.7)
You have experience with single page web applications
You have experience with React, React hooks and ES6
You understand MVC patterns
You have previously worked with NoSQL databases","Targeted Clusters

column1: TOOLBX Software Engineer Intern Winter 2022

We are excited to be launching our Co-op Winter Cohort 2022. You will be joining other co-op students and dig into some pretty awesome work to help our fast growing company expand across Canada and into the United States. As a Software Engineer Co-op, you will be a contributor to the design and implementation of technology projects that will drive the growth of the company. You will have the responsibility to execute on projects end to end with the guidance of an experienced software engineer. You will work across the full technology stack at TOOLBX as our projects span across the full stack of technologies from databases to mobile and web applications and other third-party services.
Company Summary

TOOLBX is building a construction materials marketplace that connects top construction professionals with local retailers and suppliers. Our online platform makes it easy for builders to order and receive the materials they need to finish projects on-time and on-budget. With delivery as fast as two hours, TOOLBX has become a valuable tool for construction professionals that want to build faster, smarter and more efficiently.
Here's why it matters:

We see an opportunity for small businesses to play alongside the larger organizations. Our platform brings the big and the small of the supply chain for construction together. Over half of the world's solid waste comes from building and construction. We see an opportunity to drive planned orders and an on-demand supply chain to support buying only when you need it. Most construction projects are either over budget or over time because contractors can't optimize their material spending and are slow to compile invoices. The most significant purchase for any individual or family will likely be their home. TOOLBX helps make construction projects more efficient. We're focused on material procurement, and we're still in the first inning. You could be one of the early people that shape our strategy","About The Role:
Write clean, robust code that scales across platforms and devices
Lead the design and implementation of new features for our platforms
Provide technical feedback to engineers through code reviews, design reviews, and team problem solving sessions
Collaborate with other members of the team to ensure the best possible outcome
Be able to work in an Agile environment","You will have:

Familiarity integrating with REST APIs and third-party services

Seeking the chance to make an impact on a company and the end users
Experience working in a startup environment is a plus!","Targeted Clusters

GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITY

Reporting to the assigned Development / Permits and Approvals Coordinators, this position is accountable for assisting the Coordinators in various activities relating to tracking and coordination of development and technical reviews for development in proximity of TTC infrastructure, assisting with the identification and securement of permits and approvals relating to TTC's capital program, carrying out research to provide responses to various inquires received from the public or other departments and providing general administrative support, as assigned.","DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

reviews and comments on capital project design submissions relating to permits and approvals
coordinates, submits and tracks permits and approval submissions

column1: Location: Toronto (1138 Bathurst Street)
Major Subject: Electrical Engineering

Reporting to manager of Train Control Engineering, the Signals Engineering Assistant (Electrical) position will assist in the design and maintenance of the subway signalling system at the Toronto Transit Commission.  This includes TTC's computerized signalling equipment located on board passenger trains and on work cars, TTC's existing and new Automatic Train Control (ATC) signalling system, and the TTC's Central office Signalling system (CSS) that takes data from sites across the subway system and displays and archives it at Transit Control.","You will be part of a team of engineers and designers in Train Control Engineering. Your responsibilities may include assisting with:
Developing or modifying software tools used to analyze subway data to improve the performance of the subway signalling system,

column1: ,TorQuest Partners,Investments,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Intermediate, Senior",16,"

column8: ,4 month work term,About TorQuest Partners

column1: TorQuest is searching for a Co-op Analyst to join our investment team beginning in September 2021.

Founded in 2001 and based in Toronto, TorQuest is one of Canada's leading middle-market private equity investment firms, with over $3 billion of equity capital under management, 19 companies in our portfolio, and 49 platform investments made throughout our history (including add-on acquisitions, we have completed more than 126 acquisitions in total). We are currently investing from our fifth fund, TorQuest Partners V, a C$1.4 billion investment vehicle raised in 2020. More information on TorQuest can be found on our website at www.TorQuest.com.
About the Role

As a Co-op Analyst, you will work in a fast-paced environment to help evaluate and execute new acquisition opportunities across a wide number of industries throughout Canada and the United States. Additionally, you will support value creation initiatives at our existing portfolio companies, including analyzing M&A, new growth initiatives, and exit alternatives (i.e., when and how to sell our investments).","Your primary responsibilities will include financial statement and valuation analysis, industry and competitive research, assisting with transaction execution, coordinating with our third-party advisors (e.g., investment bankers, consultants, accountants, etc.), helping prepare memos and analyses for internal and external consumption, and maintaining important internal databases. No two days at TorQuest will be the same. As you prove yourself, you will have the opportunity to take on increasingly important roles with more responsibility.

You will work closely with our Associates who will provide you with mentorship and training to develop the skills required to succeed in this role.","In addition to strong academic standing and demonstrated leadership, we are looking for the following in our ideal Co-op Analyst candidate:
A self-starter with an excellent ""can-do"" attitude;
Intellectually curious and thinks independently;
Demonstrated interest in finance, investing, or business strategy;
Organized and meticulously detail-oriented;
Can manage multiple priorities under tight timelines;
Great written and oral communication skills;
A collaborative, team player who goes the extra mile;
Tremendous integrity, always doing the right thing.","Targeted Clusters

Quality Control Engineering (Q.C.E) is the largest Engineering group within TMMC. They are responsible for ensuring high levels of product quality by defining fit, function and performance standards as well as quality processes at TMMC and at our Suppliers. The Q.C.E role also includes performing risk analysis on Engineering Changes that may affect vehicle quality and perform technical problem solving to develop solid engineering solutions to potential quality concerns. The group is responsible to ensure that vehicles meet all design expectations and satisfy customers.  They achieve this by working with Suppliers, TMMC Shops (Assembly, Weld, Paint, etc) and the completed vehicle.
Co-op Role:

The Co-op student will be a part of our Q.C.E. group and participate in daily meetings and activities. The student will work with a lead mentor on various vehicle quality concerns. They will be exposed to Toyota's problem-solving methods and have the opportunity to experience hands on problem solving on the production floor.
Co-op Project:
Q.C.E. students will be given challenging problems to investigate and solve, some examples include:
Assembly fit issues: chronic installation struggles with assembly interior or exterior garnishes
Warranty investigations: study of high warranty issues and implementation of counter measures
Vehicle measurement studies: analyze body fit data to level up concern areas
Body CMM data trend setup, analysis and feedback system
PowerBI setup for regular management report","Required Skills:

QC Automation group is responsible to innovate and automate inspection processes through the use of various technologies
We manage >300 inspection points on every vehicle; ensuring that they meet or exceed stringent TMMC Quality KPI's
Some of the technologies that we utilize include Machine Learning applications for vision based inspection; Internal location technologies utilizing UWB RF communication

Our automated systems are deeply integrated into our quality systems and we utilize Toyota Business Practice and data driven problem solving to identify abnormalities and mitigate risks to our customers

We work in a high paced manufacturing environment that exposes us to a wide range of variation and challenges as we work to meet and exceed several requirements and specifications of the work environment as well as many different group's we interact with on a daily basis
Co-op Role:
Co-Ops have provided analysis into day to day operations and identified tools to improve our roles
Various tools created (KPI reporting tools using PowerBI; Automated Risk reporting tools using Excel; Web displays for critical inspection failures)
Students will have the oppertunity to learn our inspection automation processes and leverage newer business tools to innovate where possible.
Co-op Project:
Understand key quality requirements for a successful inspection process

The Innovation Laboratory connects the TMMC Business with the Manufacturing and High-Tech industry by executing projects with an innovation component, and by trialing potential solutions. It also develops hardware and software prototypes, makes them available and hands them out for implementation. The Innovation Laboratory is in the Catalyst 137 Internet of Things (IoT) Hub, downtown Kitchener. There will be occasional visits to TMMC, Cambridge depending on the business needs.
Innovation on Industry 4.0, IoT, & Machine Learning:

TMMC is looking for highly motivated and resourceful students interested in doing applied research on the Internet of Things and Machine Learning in the context of automation and data exchange in manufacturing technologies, as described in the Industry 4.0 and Smart Factory initiatives. We welcome candidates studying preferably, but not limited to, Systems Design Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering.
Co-op Student Role:

Co-op students join the team at Catalyst137. They connect with other TMMC production and administration groups, are open to go, see and work on the production floor when needed. They also help organize showcase events and expand the lab's network by connecting with organizations. They are proactive and resourceful.

At TMMC we want to give co-ops experience on the full software development life cycle. We offer what no other company can. We allow our students to work on the backend, frontend, database, etc. as a full stack developer. We don't restrict students in what they can contribute to. We provide mentorship and guidence and allow you to shine and show us what you can offer to the team. Your decisions and code can impact thousands of customers on a daily basis giving you the utmost job satisfaction in knowing you made a difference at Toyota.

Visit our website www.tmmc.ca - careers, to learn more about TMMC and why we have obtained numerous employer awards.

TMMC is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe in enabling people of different ages, sexes, sexual orientations, gender identities, gender expressions, colours, races, ancestries, citizenships, ethnic origins, places of origin, and creeds to work together and realize their full potential. TMMC is committed to compliance with all applicable legislation including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.
LOCATION: This role is based primarily out of Cambridge with occasional travel to Woodstock based on business need.","Production Control - General Stores Group:

The student will work with both Operations and Administration teams on site to analyze current information and material flow in order to develop/ implement robust systematic solutions to improve current process and ensure 100% data accuracy.

column8: ,4 month work term,Tradable Bits is an award-winning tech company that helps music and sports brands build better fan experiences. We are seeking a driven and detail-oriented Software Engineer (Co-op) to work alongside our development team. We are seeking a driven self-starter with a passion for all things technology; someone who likes to get under the hood and understand how things work. You must work well with others, have excellent communication skills and take pride in managing your own schedule and workload.

column1: Our work environment is creative, fast-paced and fun. We get to experiment with the latest and greatest technologies and are on the cutting edge of digital media marketing for businesses in Sports & Music industry. Our office is located in one of the most beautiful areas in Vancouver and has a seemingly endless supply of java and snacks. You have the opportunity to make a real difference and take ownership and pride in your projects because we work in uncharted territory; imagining and creating things that don't yet exist.","Why you want to work here:
- Make a tangible impact on projects that matter and see it being used by customers
- Pursue your own initiatives and be creative in your work
- Work with clients like the MLSE (Toronto Raptors, Maple Leafs), Live Nation, Lollapalooza, Osheaga and others
- We promise we won't make you wear a dorky uniform or starchy suit - unless you want to.

As an integral part of the development team, you will be responsible for creating code that will be seen by millions of people worldwide. Attention to detail and a passion for well-written code are paramount. You may not have a degree, yet, but you need to be able and excited to work in a fast-paced environment. We have a lot of fun here so you'll also need a sense of humour.","Requirements
- Knowledge of at least one of scripting languages: Python, Ruby, Perl, Php
- Experience working in Unix environment ( Linux, Solaris, Mac OS, etc. )
- Basic understanding of HTTP protocol options ( GET vs POST, headers, SSL )
- Ability to write hand-coded, clean and commented html and css that works cross-browser and cross-device
- Knowledge of Javascript and JS frameworks ( jQuery, Dojo, etc. )
- Excellent verbal and written communications
- Ability to work independently and take ownership of features
Bonus Points
- Experience with CSS grid frameworks (e.g. Bootstrap)

- Any form of native mobile development iOS or Android.
- Experience with Facebook Open Graph API
- Understanding of RDBMS concepts
- Experience developing mobile web apps
