column8: ,4 month work term,We are looking for amazing people who have a passion in coding and have a good head on their shoulders. We want web and app developers who are talented and smart people with a solid foundation of coding languages and problem solving.,TradeRev is an online automotive remarketing system where dealers can launch and participate in real-time vehicle auctions at any time from their mobile devices or desktop. It allows Sellers to obtain instant bids while the retail customer is sitting in the showroom by providing a private, customized network for Buyers and Sellers that quickly and efficiently move fresh trades.

column1: We believe when it comes to buying a car, everyone should come out a winner. That's why we've created the world's first transparent automotive exchange, where every transaction plays out in the open for all to see and where both buyers and sellers are equally set up to win. Because we believe,  people should  trust the automotive purchase process, and get excited about it.
Why Work with Us?

Whether your Fun is in working with new technology, learning skills, collaborating with awesomely talented people or growing into a Specialist, Team Lead or People Manager, we want to feed this fire in you. If you have the work ethic, skill and motivation, we will help you find a path that leads you where your passion wants to go. So come on; let's have Fun together.

With Great Skills comes Great Responsibilities.  We understand that in order to attain and maintain amazing coding skills, it needs to be continually up to date, so we make sure you're all covered when it comes to any professional development, conferences, and licenses. It's on us.
Take a look at our other benefits here: http://work.traderev.com/
Our Core Values:  Fun. Honest. Accountable. Brave.
Our Tech Stack
Node/React/Javascript, Kotlin, Swift, Go, AWS, Kubernetes, Kafka, Istio/Service Mesh, .NET Core, etc.

You'll be at the heart of TradeRev's engineering team, building products and services that will bring transparency and trust to automotive sales process.","Think you have what it takes? Here's what we're looking for:
- You are currently enrolled in a software engineering-related discipline, preferably in Computer Science.
- Experience developing web/ mobile application and you have amazing projects you can provide evidence
- You own a strong understanding of application development, including development and programming methodologies.
- You are constantly learning and looking for ways to improve yourself and the processes around you.
- You enjoy mentoring and supporting other team members by doing code reviews and applying your experience in process and technical leadership.
- You have experience working in a collaborative team environment and are a self-starter, conscientious member of the team.
- You are a communicator.
- You not only love to code, but also you're awesome at it!","Targeted Clusters

column1: You will assist in managing and coordinating the end-to-end project activities from initiation to implementation including project kick-off, requirements analysis, solution design, build, test, production release, post-implementation review, issue resolution, status reporting and retrospectives.

The Agile Delivery Coordinator may assist with coordinating cross-team initiatives and assisting with delivery-related documentation to ensure optimal project execution.","TradeRev has changed the automotive industry with its revolutionary product. Built as a multi-platform live auction app, TradeRev's online automotive remarketing system has made a huge impact in the industry and has acquired quick user adoption with a fast-growing client base. As a subsidiary of KAR Auction Services, Inc. and partnering with our sister company ADESA, we are continuing to expand TradeRev's footprint in the dealer-to-dealer online space in the Canadian markets.

Whether your Fun is in working with new technology, learning skills, collaborating with awesomely talented people or growing into a Specialist, Team Lead or People Manager, we want to feed this fire in you. Honest. Accountable. Brave.","TradeRev wants your help to deal with three problems:

column1: First, we have great data about the behaviour of its power users: what cars they look at, which they bid on, how much they're willing to spend, etc. But when someone new uses the app for the first time, they face the classic cold start problem: how can you recommend products to people whose preferences you don't yet know?
Second, in addition to this buyer-facing problem, we are interested in understanding how they can help sellers close more deals by determining the cause of failed sales.
Finally, we are also interested in figuring out how to optimize opening bid pricing, by answering the question, ""what opening bid will maximize the likelihood of a successful trade?"".
You'll be our go-to point person for each of these questions.","Qualifications & Education Requirements:
· Having or working towards Math, Stats or Computer Science degree
· Strong grasp of statistical concepts and techniques
· The ability to clearly and efficiently communicate ideas verbally and in writing
· The ability to understand and implement ideas described in published literature
· Experience building machine learning models
· Experience with Python based data science tools: pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, matplotlib
· Experience working with SQL-based databases
· Passionate about data and hacker's mindset","Targeted Clusters

column11: RideCo - Software Developer in Test & Automation

column1: ,Transit Labs Inc,RideCo,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Intermediate, Senior",7,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,You will join our growing Software Engineering team for Test & Automation, directly responsible for ensuring RideCo's on-demand transit platform is always running smoothly, and meeting our customers needs. The ideal candidate will have a deep interest in building cloud-based software that can operate at large scale, solving computationally intensive NP-hard problems, with real-time responsiveness, and while maintaining 99.99% uptime. You thrive in a small-team environment with fast-paced agile iterations, and where every developer contributes code that will make it to production and deliver meaningful impact to our customers and the company.

column1: Who we are
http://www.rideco.com

RideCo powers on-demand transit. Public transit agencies use RideCo's cloud-based software platform to provide on-demand shared rides in dynamically routed buses, vans, and cars. Our clients include some of the world's largest transportation operators such as Grab, San Antonio Metro, Los Angeles Metro, San Diego County, and Calgary Transit.

Have you experienced getting frustrated with transfers and waiting while taking a public bus? Have you seen buses drive around in low-density areas with very few passengers on-board and wondered how inefficient that seems to be? You're likely aware of the first & last mile access challenges faced by transit hubs. We are solving these problems by re-imagining shared mobility. Imagine a world where vehicles have dynamic routes responsive to real-time trip demand. This 'dynamic shuttle' (or van /sedan) would pick you up, on-demand, at or near your doorstep and take you to your destination or transit hub. Along the way, it may pick-up other passengers going in your direction. Your experience will be seamless: less waiting, less walking, fewer transfers, shorter travel time, and timely pickups and drop-offs. RideCo's 'dynamic shuttle' platform enables this seamless experience and low-cost shared rides for vehicle fleet operators and their passengers. By seamlessly moving more people in fewer vehicles we are catalyzing a generational shift in how people get around cities and towns. This means commuters spend less time in transit and more time doing what they enjoy.

RideCo powers a diverse range of use cases, including residential/ suburban travel; first-mile-last-mile connections for transit hubs; and corporate employee transportation. We are investing to scale up and capture the growing demand for on-demand shared rides solutions.
Note: Although we prefer 8-month work terms, we are still open to hiring for 4-month work terms.","Work closely with engineers to develop test automation strategies and frameworks.
Build, maintain, and enhance tools that streamline and automate all forms of testing.
Build and run automated functional, integration, stress, and performance tests.
Run large scale simulations based on custom or real-world data to find or reproduce issues, bottlenecks, and regressions.
Analyze and report the results of testing efforts in a clear and timely manner.
Manual testing of mobile, web, and backend applications, as necessary.

Your playground / what you'll learn:  At RideCo you'll get a chance to play, learn and build with the following tools and technologies, and as part of a cross-functional team that is the world's foremost innovator in on-demand transit software.
Languages: Python, JavaScript / Angular
Web Stack: Django, Flask, Gunicorn, Nginx
Mobile: Ionic, hybrid apps for Android and iOS
Logistics Engine: algorithms for real-time vehicle routing, optimization, dynamic partitioning, NP-hard problems
Mapping/Routing: OpenStreetMap, travel time/route estimation, traffic modeling
Infrastructure: AWS, Terraform, Redis, PostgreSQL, Celery, RabbitMQ
Health/Monitoring: AWS CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana
Development Processes: Agile, continuous integration, Jenkins, zero-downtime software updates","Working towards a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline.
Experience as a software developer or QA engineer.
Knowledge of testing mobile, web, and client/server applications.
Experience in automation and automated testing, including functional, integration, stress, and performance.
Scripting and experience building diverse, robust tooling (Python, Perl, Shell).
Analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communcation skills.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Transparent Kitchen,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Ottawa,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",13,"

column8: ,4 month work term,About Us

column1: Transparent Kitchen is the first intelligent food and beverage discovery platform, transforming the future of dining. Our restaurant partners leverage content and data to better understand their guests and offer them personalized experiences.

Our vision is to become the leaders in data analytics and experience curation within the food and beverage community, while championing sustainability and provenance for both restaurants and their customers.
About You

You will work closely with our team of passionate entrepreneurs, creatives, engineers, and foodies to consolidate our design system and refine the user experience on our platform. You will need to quickly grasp our big-picture ambitions while excelling at detail-oriented tasks. We are looking for someone who will join our team long-term in building the ""Spotify of food"". If you are a software engineer, developer, hacker, or wizard and web or mobile applications hold no secrets from you, you should talk to us!
About Us (Expanded)
We are the definition of a lean startup: a human institution designed to create a new product or service under conditions of extreme uncertainty.

As a team, we have gathered deep domain expertise of the independent food and beverage industry. Before COVID-19, we were hustling. Starting with just $18K of our tip money, we built a first of its kind platform and brand for the food and beverage industry that reached over 1.2M users, received $1M in funding and went live in 4 major markets with over 300 top chef partners.

In one day, COVID-19 shattered the second largest consumer sector, which showed record growth for 13 straight years, in addition to a multi-billion dollar restaurant software market that emerged during that time.  But in a crisis comes opportunity.

Transparent Kitchen has developed first of its kind technology and positioned itself as a respected brand, uniquely primed to benefit from this rebirth. We are on the cusp of launching an AI powered restaurant management system and discovery platform ""Spotify of Food""; including the first of it's kind 3D reservation system. A true end-to-end solution that will change the way restaurants learn about their customers, respond to their needs, and make money. We are re-imagining the future of dining.","You will be tasked with:
Building Vue.js components and pages;
Contributing to building our design system and component library;
Working as part of a Scrum team (we're a close-knit team and work together to develop the best solutions for our web apps);
Writing and improving our unit and integration tests and related documentation;
Opportunities to take part in hands-on development with the latest technologies.
Extras:
Worked in the restaurant industry.
Actively doing your part to protect the environment.
Get excited about big data.
Community oriented.","You should be familiar with:
Creating, Maintaining, consuming and interacting with Rest APIs or GraphQL Endpoints;
Working with a development workflow that involves continuous integration and continuous delivery, including unit testing and deployment;
Frontend Javascript frameworks, such as React and Vue;
Automated tests frameworks and tools such as Mocha, Jest, Lighthouse and Selenium;
Typescript and OOP;
Relative databases such as MySQL or PostgresSQL;
Knowledge of web frameworks such as ExpressJS and NestJS
Following and incorporating design guidelines with accuracy;
Build and deploying software in cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, GCP.
You should be able to:
Thrive in a startup environment;
Work efficiently in a remote, distributed, environment;
Work in English with ease (it's our company language);
Use your creative eye to discuss and resolve UI/UX problems;
Write high-quality Javascript/Typescript code;

Write unit and UI automated tests;
See projects through from beginning to end.","Targeted Clusters

You are a natural leader; we are looking for someone who will grow with our team and manage others in the near future.
You are self-motivated; we are a distributed team, each responsible for managing our time.
You have exceptional communication skills; every idea and suggestion is considered if you can effectively communicate it.
You have tremendous visual design skills and the ability to tell a story; we've been told we have a beautiful product, but we know you can make it better!
You know how to take complicated workflows and make them elegant; we're building the next billion dollar platform, but it has to remain easy to use.
You are able to rapidly ideate and produce UI/UX concepts; the faster we can test and validate ideas, the faster our dev team can put them into production.

column1: Transport Canada is responsible for federal transportation policies and programs. It ensures that air, marine, road and rail transportation are safe and secure, efficient and environmentally responsible.

The Transportation and Economic Analysis Directorate of Transport Canada provides operational and strategic support to senior management through research, analysis, advice and partnerships on trends, issues and challenges related to transportation.  Key functions related to economic analysis and research include:
Support the Chief Economist by monitoring key economic, environmental, socio-demographic and policy developments
Identify, monitor and analyze economic drivers of transportation demand (passenger, freight/domestic, international)
Provide economic analysis on system-wide transportation issues
Monitor and forecast passenger transportation demand to support policy analysis
Monitor and forecast key commodity transportation demand to support commodity supply chain analysis and overall freight policy analysis","Responsibilities
The successful candidate will:
Collect, clean and standardize data
Identify relationships across datasets and perform cross linking between datasets
Support data validation and preparation
Perform analysis and identify facts and trends in data
Design reports to present results
Provide innovative ideas to improve current approaches","Qualifications
Level of Education:

Field of study:

Knowledge:
Knowledge of programming languages such as SQL, R, Python
Knowledge of formulas, pivot tables and other advanced features of Microsoft Excel
Skills and Abilities:
Ability to work with large datasets (data manipulation, validation, research, analysis)
Ability to plan and organize workload
Ability to present data
Strong analytical skills
Strong problem solving and conceptual thinking skills
Assets:
Knowledge of transportation sector
Background in Economics","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The Actuarial Internship Program provides qualified students with an excellent opportunity to gain first-hand experience, receive valuable on-the-job training and learn more about the property & casualty insurance industry.

column1: This role is an exciting opportunity to work with one of the largest employers of P&C actuaries in North America. As an Actuarial Assistant, the successful candidate will be offered an opportunity to gain relevant property and casualty insurance and business experience in personal and/or commercial lines while working in a dynamic, team-focused environment.

As a member of the Actuarial Department, the candidate will act as an effective contributor to their team, and will interact with insurance professionals from underwriting, claims, finance and information systems as necessary.
There are four roles available -- one each for:
Analytics & Research (A&R)
Business Insurance Pricing
Personal Insurance Pricing
Corporate Actuarial

Candidates may be required to work for other teams on an ad-hoc basis however. The candidate will be responsible for a range of projects and tasks which will involve interaction with many areas of the business.

Each intern will be expected to complete challenging and meaningful project work over the course of this program. In addition, there are core assignments and a designated coach to further develop interns' insurance knowledge.","- Data preparation, validation, reconciliation and analysis of premium, claims and other data

- Determining estimates for catastrophic events

- Working with Finance on monthly IBNR booking","Because the Actuarial Internship Program itself is complex and dynamic, we welcome applicants that have a variety of majors, backgrounds and experiences.

For this internship opportunity, we are most interested in students who are serious about entering the insurance industry and who are excited about the prospect of making actuarial their future career choice.

column8: ,4 month work term,The Quantitative Analysis and Modelling Unit (QAMU) within the Ontario Treasury Board Secretariat (TBS) is looking to hire one (1) Policy Co-op interested in learning more about the public service to join a team of professionals engaged in conducting complex strategic analysis and coordinating activities in a deadline driven environment.

column1: QAMU is part of the Strategy and Continuous Improvement Branch within Office of the Treasury Board (OTB) in TBS. The core of our mandate is to work at the heart of government decision making to provide quantitative analysis and forecasting to inform policy and program development. The team also supports ministries in their data analysis needs and leads a transformational project to improve how government transfer payments work for all ministries.

The position is located at Queen's Park in downtown Toronto or remotely from anywhere in Ontario. The team has been working from home since March 2020. It is currently anticipated that the position will involve a mix of work from home and work at the downtown location. This may change as the COVID-19 public health response evolves.
Previous student testimonial:

Working in QAMU allowed me the opportunity to apply a wide range of skills that I learned in the classroom in meaningful ways, through tasks such as analyzing financial data, drafting decks, writing briefing notes and giving presentations. It was very rewarding to be involved in government wide initiatives, and to work on projects that directly supported decision making in the OPS, especially as a co-op student.""","In this role, you will:
·         Conduct research and analysis to inform policy development
·         Prepare briefing notes, presentations and other documents for management
·         Employ innovative approaches to policy development
·         Assist and support various projects, analyses and studies to help advance ministry priorities
·         Other duties as assigned","Oral and Written Communication Skills:
You have excellent writing skills to prepare various documents such as presentations, briefing notes, reports and summaries.
You can effectively present your work to management clearly and concisely.

You are proficient in Microsoft Office and other computer software in order to draft emails, documents and reports, prepare presentations, visualize data to help inform policy development and communications.
Research and Analysis Skills:
You have skills to conduct thorough research that contributes to policymaking.
You can analyse quantitative and qualitative data to support the development of evidence-based policy recommendations.
You can contribute to technical projects by leveraging general technical skills often developed through coursework such as economic or financial analysis, programming, math or statistics.
You have problem-solving skills to identify and compare possible solutions to problems.
You have or possess the ability to acquire knowledge of government decision-making processes.
Interpersonal and Teamwork Skills:
You can establish and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues and stakeholders at various levels.
You have a positive, proactive and energetic approach to your work that translates to taking initiative and being a team player.
You have sound judgment and can identify contentious issues and recommend solutions.
You have the political acuity to recognize complex issues that need to be referred to senior staff.
Project Management and Organization Skills:
You can plan, organize and structure projects of varying size with success.
You have well developed time management skills and the ability to prioritize and complete competing tasks with short deadlines

This position may be of interest to students in the academic disciplines of Economics, Public Policy / Public Administration, Finance, Political Science, Business Administration, and others.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Treasury Board Secretariat,Office of the Treasury Board,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Intermediate, Senior",9,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Behavioural Insights Unit within the Ontario Treasury Board Secretariat requires one (1) Research Analyst to join a team of professionals engaged in applying behavioural science research to solve some of the public sector's thorniest behaviour change challenges.

column1: What you'll be doing

Ontario's Behavioural Insights Unit is part of the Centre of Excellence for Evidence-Based Decision Making, in the Treasury Board Secretariat. The Centre of Excellence for Evidence-Based Decision Making works with ministries to assess how programs are performing, using evidence to accelerate improvements to critical public services. Within the Centre, the Behavioural Insights Unit (BIU) explores the behavioural context of programs and services and offers low-cost ways to redesign programs for better outcomes.

Modeled after the United Kingdom's Behavioural Insights Team, the BIU operates as an internal consultancy and works across a variety of exciting policy domains. Our behavioural scientists and policy advisors work collaboratively with ministries and the broader public sector to apply the knowledge and methodologies of behavioural science - from defining the problem, to testing and evaluating potential solutions.

As a research analyst, you will be directly involved in the design and prototyping of behaviourally informed solutions, as well as the quantitative and qualitative evaluations of these solutions in the field. On any given day, you may be supporting critical project meetings, participating in behavioural mapping workshops, helping to redesign a government form, letter or service in a solution brainstorm session, developing creative ways of pilot testing something in the field, or learning new data techniques to conduct exploratory or evaluative analysis.
Your impact

In 2021, the BIU will continue to focus on supporting initiatives that use behavioural science insights in key policy areas, such as health, social services, and increasing the efficiency of government services. Overall, you will be helping to ensure that the Ontario Public Service relies on the best possible evidence, and maintains a relentless focus on the needs and perspectives of users. You will be a champion for innovative, people-centred approaches across government.

Examples of the Behavioural Insights Unit's completed projects include increasing the number of Ontarians who register to become organ donors, increasing the number of people who renew their vehicle license registration online, increasing the number of students who report their vaccines online to avoid suspension from school, and improving recycling behaviour. You can read more about our work in our 2018 and 2020 Update Reports on Ontario.ca.
Why join this team

We help make government work better for people by making it easier to access and participate in available programs and services. We provide a safe learning environment, with constructive feedback to help foster career growth and opportunities to collaborate with talented people. In addition, our team maintains strong links to academia (e.g., our work is featured in academic publications and conferences), and collaborates with teams at various levels across the public sector (federal, provincial, municipal, agencies).
Job details
The position is located in downtown Toronto, however this role will be completed remotely pending OPS policies on safe return to work.
All applicants should include a resume and academic transcript, as well as a cover letter indicating why you are interested in the position / why this is your dream job.

This position may be of interest to students in the academic disciplines of Psychology, Economics, Computer Science, Political Science, Public Policy/Public Administration, Business Administration, and others.","The Research Analyst's responsibilities will include:
Supporting research projects aimed at improving government programs and services;
Using data to analyze effectiveness of government programs, and piloted behavioural insights solutions;
Tracking and analyzing media coverage and reporting on applied behavioural insights;
Monitoring the progress of projects underway, and supporting ongoing project management;
Supporting internal development and growth, including strategic planning and lessons learned evaluations;

Supporting the development of briefing materials for senior management including coordinating and consolidating information, producing charts, graphs and slides for use in documents and presentations; and
Other duties as assigned.","What you bring to the team
Strong research, analysis and communication (written and oral) skills.
An eagerness to learn new things, and take new approaches to problem solving.
Skills in relationship development and collaborating with partners.
The ability to work out in the open as part of a team, but also to execute tasks thoroughly and independently.
A strong sense of initiative, and a drive to step up to support the team; no task is too big or small.

Skills in design (e.g., Adobe CreativeSuite), and/or statistical software (e.g., SPSS, STATA), and/or programming (e.g., R) are an asset, but not required. Candidates should have experience with common office software (e.g., Excel, Powerpoint, Word).","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The Centre of Excellence (CoE) Unit within the Ontario Treasury Board Secretariat (TBS) is looking to hire one (1) Research Analyst to support its ongoing efforts to promote a culture of robust, evidence-based decision-making across government.

column1: The CoE Unit aims to support ministries achieve better accountability, transparency and value-for-money by using evidence to inform their decisions, enabling them to select, fund and operate public programs more effectively and efficiently. It provides enterprise-wide expert advice, develops tools and guidance, and builds capacity to assess how programs are performing, using evidence to inform choices and lead change in public services. Specifically the team:
Leads the strategic planning and overall governance of complex, enterprise-wide transformation efforts.
Supports capacity-building across ministries, specific to developing performance measurement and evaluation frameworks, tracking performance, and driving continuous improvement.
Supports government planning processes in the assessment of program effectiveness, efficiency, modernization opportunities, and sustainability.

Deliver training on using evidence-based decision making to increase capacity, to assess how programs are performing, and support the modernization of government by focusing on outcomes, evaluation, sustainability, and continuous improvement.

The position is located at Queen's Park in downtown Toronto. Job to be completed remotely for the foreseeable future. This is subject to change pending OPS policies on a safe return to work.","The Research Analyst's responsibilities could include:
Conduct research and analysis to assist with the development of evaluation-focused policies, tools, and guidelines;
Provide advice and guidance to senior executives, managers and staff across government on issues, performance management and standards;
Prepare briefing materials to provide advice and recommendations to senior management;
Support strategic planning / coordination of large, enterprise-wide transformation initiatives
Participate on a variety of committees and project teams;
Assist with the development of training modules and conduct training/education sessions for line ministries and other stakeholders.
Other duties as assigned","Applicants should have strong research, planning, coordination and communication (written and oral) as well as collaboration skills.
Candidates should also have experience with common office software including Microsoft Office 365.
An understanding or willingness to quickly acquire understanding of the government decision making process (e.g., the role of central agencies and Treasury Board/Management Board of Cabinet) and
Performance measurement and evaluation-related knowledge and/or experience would be an asset.

column8: ,4 month work term,The Resources and Economic Development Division within the Ontario Treasury Board Secretariat is looking for one (1) Research Analyst interested in learning more about the public service to join a team of professionals engaged in providing evidence-based analysis and recommendations to support public infrastructure investments and policy development in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

column1: The Resources and Economic Development Division provides financial and policy analysis to support the government in the development of the Province's fiscal plan and the 10-year infrastructure plan. The 10-year infrastructure plan includes investments in sectors such as health, education, justice, transportation and transit.

The Resources and Economic Development Division is responsible for supporting Treasury Board / Management Board including analyzing and recommending infrastructure investments through the Province's annual budget process; monitoring and reporting on outcomes and progress on the 10-year infrastructure plan; and analyzing and implementing appropriate infrastructure investment strategies.
The position is located at Queen's Park in downtown Toronto. This may change subject to OPS policies on a safe return to work.
Student Testimonials

My co-op experience at TBS allowed me to get involved in meaningful and rewarding public service work that directly impacts Ontarians. There is no better place than TBS to learn about how the Ontario government works.""

""As a co-op in the Office of the Treasury Board, I was given incredible opportunities to work alongside talented and driven professionals. Further, my position granted me ample opportunity to showcase my talent and engage in meaningful work at the highest levels of government.""
During my co-op term, I was given several opportunities to present my work to senior management.""

As a co-op student working for TBS, you are treated as a full team member and are given challenging tasks. I was tasked with conducting research, updating financial data, writing and editing briefing notes, and even presenting proposals to senior government executives.  Students in TBS are exposed to a broad range of policies and programs that Ontario is implementing, whether it be in health, transportation, education, Indigenous relations, or the environment. I was able to see which policy areas I'm interested in, and has propelled me to seek future co-op opportunities within these areas.""","The Research Analyst's responsibilities could include:

Conducting research projects related to capital policy and infrastructure investments, including reviewing academic and trade literature as well as policies, programs and practices in various jurisdictions;
Economic / financial data analysis of government investments in public infrastructure;
Tracking and analyzing media coverage of infrastructure issues;
Reviewing policy and program development across sectors to identify financial implications or risks;
Reviewing and monitoring the progress of infrastructure projects;
Supporting due diligence of business cases related to infrastructure investment proposals;

Supporting the development of briefing materials for senior management including coordinating and consolidating information, producing charts, graphs and slides for use in documents and presentations; and
Other duties as assigned.","Applicants should have strong research, financial analysis and communication (written and oral) skills.
Candidates should also have experience with common office software (e.g., spreadsheets).
An understanding of the government decision making process (e.g., the role of central agencies and Treasury Board/Management Board of Cabinet)
Basic project management skills would be an asset.

This position may be of interest to students in the academic disciplines of Economics, Public Policy/Public Administration, Accounting, Finance, Political Science, Environment and Business, Urban Planning, Business Administration, and others.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The Ontario Digital Service is improving the online experience for citizens by reinventing the most important government services for the digital age. As a Software Developer, you will help make online government services feel simple, seamless and intuitive.  You will on one major projects by researching technology solutions to utilize, or coding interactive and functional prototypes to help validate digital product ideas.

column1: Our co-op students are those who have the digital skills, mindset, and enthusiasm to support Ontario's Digital Government transformation. During your placement, you will have one-on-one mentorship from the lead who will provide advice and continuous guidance throughout your term.

Freedom in the workplace is a crucial part of how we conduct our day-to-day tasks. The expectation is that you will complete your work within the given timeframe; however, you will have the autonomy to do so without being limited to a 9-5 workday.

Join us and help make government work better for people by delivering simple and straightforward digital services and products. We provide employees with constructive feedback to foster their career growth, and opportunities to collaborate with talented people. We are not your typical government job.","Your impact
You will be at the forefront of new ideas and initiatives, having the freedom to choose which technologies to use.
You will work on new solutions for problems within the provincial government, that could bring significant change to how people access public services.

You will collaborate with a small multi-disciplinary team, iterating towards a demo-able prototype to help validate digital product ideas before they get the green light to be fully developed for production.","What you bring to the team
You think digital by default and embrace new ideas that put users first in order to find the best solutions.
You believe diversity and inclusion help create the best conditions for people to achieve the best results, knowing the best ideas come from everywhere and everyone.
You work in a team, but can execute tasks independently

You enjoy working in an agile work environment

column8: ,4 month work term,Trend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. column1: As a leader in cloud and enterprise cybersecurity, our platform delivers central visibility for better, faster detection and response and a powerful range of advanced threat defense techniques optimized for environments, like AWS, Microsoft, and Google.
Position Summary:

Within the Cloud One R&D team at Trend Micro, you will participate as part of a dynamic and talented team that develops the next generation of Trend Micro's security products. The Cloud One team is comprised of highly effective small teams that take ownership for various areas of our product and services. The teams work hard innovating to make the best darn software imaginable.

Your role will be to design, implement and test high quality software capabilities for data center and cloud based systems using your excellent coding abilities. This is a software development role requiring exceptional programming skills and a high degree of adaptability and creativity. If you love writing beautiful, efficient, and productive code, and have a desire to see your code deliver great value, we want to talk to you.

Will work on a variety of platforms at varying heights in the stack, and at any level of the software pipeline
Is quality focused, believes in unit testing and making their code easily debuggable in the field, and believes the best tests are coded and performed by a machine
Has a proactive, customer-oriented approach when troubleshooting problems and resolving issues related to product, process and tools

column1: ,Trexo Robotics,Head Office,1,Open for Applications,Mississauga,Intermediate, Senior",17,"

column8: ,4 month work term,About us

column1: Trexo Robotics (YC W19, Techstars) is enabling mobility by building powered wearable robots (https://youtu.be/3LW4LJIpa2o). Our first product is a robot for children with movement disorders such as Cerebral Palsy and it allows kids to walk, in many cases for the first time in their lives. The device is currently being used by families and the best hospitals across North America.

Our work doesn't stop here, we are constantly working towards building mobility solutions for all. At Trexo Robotics you will find a flat organization where you can work with highly optimistic, low ego and exceptionally talented individuals who look forward to solving hard problems.
About the Job

We currently have Trexos all over North America and an ever growing backlog of Trexos we need to ship! Each device has different electrical components from motor control boards to drive each motor to our custom battery pack which need constant design improvements, manufacturing, and testing. We are looking for an Exoskeleton Electrical Design intern to take ownership of all electrical subsystems and strive to make them extremely reliable and functional.
About You

You want to work in a small team solving a big problem while helping an underserved community. You love when products just work and can't believe how some bugs make it out in the wild. You are detail-oriented and love asking why many times till you understand something from first principles.","What you'll do
-Improve and test our PCBAs for motor control, power distribution, and LED display
-Create production files for manufactures including QC documents
-Create and run internal tests for electrical sub assemblies and full Trexo
-Build wire harnesses and PCBA assemblies
-Work with firmware engineer on developing firmware for PCBAs (arm cortex, avrs)
-Create testing scripts for ICT test jigs for different PCBAs","Required Skills
-Experience designing schematics and PCBAs in Altium.
-Hands on experience soldering.
-Hands on experience using tools like oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, multimeters etc.
-Experience writing software with C and C++ in an embedded system.
-Experience with a scripting language (preferably python).
-Previous experience working in a Linux.
-Strong critical thinking and analytical skills (able to piece together lots of information and condense it to something useful).
-Interest in exoskeletons
Nice to Have
-Previous experience with ROS.
-Previous experience with FreeRTOS
-Hands on experience using tools such as a mill, lathe, drill press.
-Hands on experience with 3D printers.
-Experience working with 60601 electrical standards","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,About us

column1: Trexo Robotics (YC W19) is enabling mobility by building powered wearable robots https://youtu.be/3LW4LJIpa2o). Our first product is a robot for children with movement disorders such as Cerebral Palsy and it allows kids to walk, in many cases for the first time in their lives. The device is currently being used by families and the best hospitals across North America.

Our work doesn't stop here, we are constantly working towards building mobility solutions for all. At Trexo Robotics you will find a flat organization where you can work with highly optimistic, low ego, and exceptionally talented individuals who look forward to solving hard problems. We love hiring interns (over 30 so far) and also have interns who eventually join us full-time.
About the Job

We currently have Trexos all over North America and an ever-growing backlog of Trexos we need to ship! As more and more devices are being used we need to strive to make sure they all work perfectly and reliably. We are looking for an exoskeleton mechanical design intern to continue development and maintenance on our current generation exoskeleton. You will work on designing and developing new features for our current exoskeleton with a focus on reliability, communicating with our manufacturers to get parts made, and assisting our production team to assemble robots. The ideal candidate will have experience working on projects which focus on mechanical design and prototyping of geared motor systems for mobile robots or exoskeletons.
About You

You want to work in a small team solving a big problem while helping an underserved community. You love when products just work and can't believe how some bugs make it out in the wild. You are detail-oriented and love asking why many times till you understand something from first principles.

Our work doesn't stop here, we are constantly working towards building mobility solutions for all. At Trexo Robotics you will find a flat organization where you can work with highly optimistic, low ego and exceptionally talented individuals who look forward to solving hard problems.","What you'll do
-Updating and improving our mechanical design for long term reliable use.
-Create drawings for manufactures including QC documents and functional tests.
-Design test and implement test rigs for sub assemblies and full Trexos to simulate long term use (3 years).
-Design and update accessories and new products (shipping cases, straps, treadmills).
-Participate in ECO meetings.
-Research new advances in robotics and how they may apply to our design.","Required Skills
-Extensive experience designing parts in Solidworks.
-Extensive experience making engineering drawings with correct GD&T which have been used by manufacturers/machine shops.
-Previous experience with FEA.
-Previous experience with mechanical failure analysis.
-Knowledge of electromechanical systems and brushless motors.
-Hands on experience using tools like milling machine, drill press for simple parts.
-Hands of experience with 3D printing.
-Strong critical thinking and analytical skills (able to piece together lots of information and condense it to something useful).
-Interest in exoskeletons.
Nice to Have
-Experience working with Linux.
-Experience with vacuum casting and injection molding
-Knowledge of QMS systems and ISO 13485","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,TribalScale Inc,Engineering Department ,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior,13,

column8: ,4 month work term,ABOUT US

column1: At TribalScale we like to think of ourselves as a global innovation company. But what does that mean? It means we don't just build digital products for our clients, we help them transform into the kinds of companies that will lead the world into the 21st Century, and we do it - globally.

TribalScale is an innovation firm that brings organizations - from the startup to the enterprise - into the future. We build digital products, transform teams, and grow startups. We're headquartered in Toronto and have offices around the world. The future is bright, and we're always looking for excited technologists to create with us.
Some of the platforms that we work with:
Mobile & Web (iOS, Android)
Voice User Interfaces (Amazon Alexa, Google Home)
Connected Cars and Homes
OTT (Roku, Fire TV, Android TV, tvOS)
WHY YOU WANT TO BE AT TRIBALSCALE
We are a collective of people and collaboration is key to our process.

Our skills: Our teams were at the front of the mobile revolution, are expert builders in Voice tech, and now, they're connecting the world. They've worked with brands including the NBA, Twitter, ABC, the CBC, Bell Media, and tons more.
You matter: Everyone sits at the table and brings value. We love to be challenged, are happy to go with the flow, and we trust our gut.
Our team led the mobile revolution and now, we're pushing the boundaries with emerging technology and we're transforming companies.
We live by our values, meritocracy, empowerment, and transparency, and we recognize that diversity is our strength.
Our mission is right the future and that's what we're doing, we're making a dent in how the world innovates.
ABOUT YOU

You are a driven and motivated individual willing to contribute and learn in a rapid work environment. You have a passion for selling innovative digital design and development services for web, mobile and emerging technologies. You know how to make connections with new businesses so that the Tribe can grow. You will have the opportunity to contribute to our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. You appreciate the sense of ownership and being recognized and rewarded properly for all the work that you have done. You also have the strong desire of working directly with the founders who have world class experience on developing products from the ground up and launching them into the market.","WHAT YOU'LL DO
Work Remotely (9:00am-5:00pm EST) to conduct prospecting and key account research on behalf of both Inside Sales and Account Executives
Work in close collaboration with Sales, Product Design, Product Managers, Engineering and Marketing
Upload contacts to Salesforce (our CRM) already prospected by Inside Sales and Account Executives
Support the creation of proposals and presentation decks for current and prospective clients
Provide background research and detailed note-taking for sales calls
Initiate, compile, and deploy smaller sales campaigns on behalf of TribalScale
Use social media to engage in social selling","REQUIREMENTS
Passion for sales and an interest in exploring emerging technologies and their impact on the world around us
Ability to understand needs of clients
Capable of taking initiative and working under minimal supervision
Strongly organized and detail-oriented
Ability to multitask, prioritize and manage competing deadlines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to craft written email  communications at different levels of the sales funnel
Genuine desire to learn new skills and implement learnings into practice
BONUS POINTS FOR
Previous experience creating pitches, presentations or other submissions
Prior sales experience
Proficiency with Google Suite, HubSpot, Trello, and Pivotal Tracker
Experience working with a CRM (we use Salesforce)
Experience with Excel, Google Slides and Keynote","Targeted Clusters

Our mission is right the future and that's what we're doing, we're making a dent in how the world innovates.","ABOUT YOU

You are excited about connecting the world and want to join a small team of ambitious technologists. You have a strong passion about building cool products and want to work somewhere where you're trusted from Day 1.

You appreciate the sense of ownership and being recognized and rewarded properly for all the work that you have done. You also have the strong desire of working directly with the founders who have world class experience on developing products from the ground up and launching them into the market.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will test products by performing story verification and exploratory testing, exposing bugs and suggesting ways to improve UI/UX from our software engineering teams.

Test engineers are successful when they're good at exposing flaws, while understanding how users interact within apps, websites, and other digital products, and can anticipate their responses to prompts. Our test engineers ensure that TribalScale is truly consumer-first, and that our products remain intuitive, lean, and beautiful.
Some of the tasks you will be working on a daily basis are:
Perform story verification in an Agile development environment.
Discover bugs, crashes, and detail there reproduction for both web and mobile (iOS & Android) applications.
Multitask between multiple projects while working closely with both the project team and client stakeholders.","REQUIREMENTS
Passion for the tech industry, particularly for innovation on mobile platforms.
Deep mobile knowledge, you understand the eccentricities of mobile platforms and are curious about learning about new ones.
Strong communication, analytical, debugging, problem-solving and root-cause analysis skills.
Skilled at collaborating between technical and non-technical teams.
A interest in automated testing best practices, the latest trends in automated testing, and design patterns
Detail-oriented and specific, especially when it comes to providing technical feedback.
Programming experience is a huge bonus, but not required.","Targeted Clusters

We live by our values, meritocracy, empowerment, and transparency, and we recognize that diversity is our strength.
Our mission is right the future and that's what we're doing, we're making a dent in how the world innovates.","ABOUT YOU

Our Product Design team is growing, and we are looking to bring on a Product Designer Co-op to support our team of designers as they build meaningful design experiences for our clients. We're looking for someone who is incredibly curious: Do you always need to know ""why"" or ""how""? Does wondering how something works keep you up at night? This could be an amazing opportunity for you to help answer some of these questions for our users. You will help us enhance the user experience and investigate the 'why' in order to learn more about our users and how they interact with technology and applications. The goal of our Product Design team is to improve the user experience by incorporating research, insights and content strategy into the product cycle. As a UX Researcher Co-op, you will work closely with our design and product teams throughout our process to identify opportunities for research, choose the appropriate methods, conduct research and analyze and present results to clients.

You should be interested, and show understanding, in both qualitative and quantitative methods, such as expert reviews, user tests, and journal studies, as well as experiments, surveys and A/B testing. As a partner to the product design team, you should have strong communication skills, drawing on your experience with design to describe and sometimes mock-up suggestions in research reports.
While you're at TribalScale, we'll make sure you get to:
Understand our clients' users, frame and define their key problems
Work in cross-disciplinary teams to design, implement, and track new features for our current client projects
Work closely with our Product Designers to build and grow your research skills in practice","REQUIREMENTS:
Loves asking questions, seeking understanding, and is good at listening and working with others to solve difficult problems
Has experience with some qualitative research methods (e.g. interviewing, usability testing, ethnography, etc.)
Has experience applying a range of research methods with both creativity and critical thinking
Can summarize and communicate research findings while working alongside team members
Self-motivated to take initiative and ownership of your work
Immaculate attention to detail, typography, and interactivity
Have a user-centric mindset throughout your design process
Collaborate well with Product Managers, Engineers, and other teams
BONUS POINTS FOR:
Worked on a digital product, feature, or service
Collaborated with designers, developers, product managers, and/or other multidisciplinary teammates
Experimented with different methods for doing research","Targeted Clusters

You are a driven and motivated individual willing to contribute and learn in a rapid work environment. column8: ,4 month work term,About Us

column1: At TritonWear we are developing advanced wearable technology for performance athletes. Our flagship product, the Triton, is a small wearable unit for competitive swimmers which automatically calculates a dozen key performance metrics. It is based on advanced signal processing and employs the latest machine learning methodology to drive high accuracy. With TritonWear, coaches are able to focus on coaching their athletes rather than doing manual data collection and analysis. TritonWear is backed by VC firm Real Ventures and MaRS IAF Fund Our passionate and highly experienced team of competitive athletes and product experts is currently based around the GTA and Ontario.
About You

You like to have an impact with your work.  You have a high attention to detail and are a stickler for quality. You are able to work independently and remotely, organizing your day's priorities, staying in contact with the TritonWear team, and getting your work done with minimal supervision.  You love how data can drive performance improvements in sports. Ideally, you have swum competitively in the past or are currently swimming recreationally or competitively.
About The Position

You will help TritonWear produce ground truth details of recorded swimming sessions that are used to make our algorithms better through machine learning and algorithm improvements. This requires watching videos and annotating specific swimming events using a TritonWear annotation tool. In the second part of the term, you will undertake a term project where you can apply your professional skills to TritonWear and gain industry experience related to your program of study. Recent project examples by our co-ops have included contributing to video UI development in Python, machine learning (also Python) to model a swimming metric, and writing / publishing an e-book about strength training for swimming.","Analyze video-recordings (both of club swimmers and elite competitions) to annotate the events that occurred in swimming session videos
Catalogue, store, and organize video and annotation files into TritonWear's data collection
Work closely with our Data Engineering team to support the analysis of the collected data
Participate in team meetings to brainstorm ideas on how to improve TritonWear's data management processes to increase accuracy and drive greater efficiency and effectiveness
Work on term projects that cater your personal/professional interests and integrate to company goals","Currently attending University in pursuit of a Bachelor's degree
Proficient in using spreadsheets, e.g. Google Spreadsheets, and remote work communication apps such as Slack, Google Meet, and Zoom
Can adapt quickly to learn new software applications
Organized and disciplined in conducting tests and recording results with meticulous documentation
Good verbal and written communication skills
Excellent attention to detail and the ability to learn and adapt quickly in dynamic scenarios

Additional helpful skills that could be applied to a work term project: coding skills (Python, Javascript), stats modelling, familiarity with exercise physiology, sport training, marketing, or any other skills applicable to TritonWear teams
To get noticed by our team, tell us what swimming or sports experience you have!","Targeted Clusters

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Fall 2021 job posting Job number TR22-1-1
Student job title:
REMOTE Junior Data Scientist
Name of project:
Deep Learning for Event Reconstruction in Water Cherenkov Detectors
Overview:
Neutrino oscillations are the only experimentally verified observation
of a process not described by the Standard Model of particle physics.
Since their discovery in 1998 we have learnt a lot about the
parameters that govern these oscillations, but there are still many
questions remaining. Perhaps the most exciting of these is to
determine whether neutrino oscillations violate charge-parity (CP)
symmetry, and so could potentially explain why we live in a
matter-dominated universe.
The T2K experiment and Nobel prize-winning Super-Kamiokande experiment
are powerful tools for exploring neutrino oscillations. The next
generation Hyper-Kamiokande experiment, coming online in the middle of
the decade, has significant discovery potential for CP violation, as
well as other phenomena such as proton decay, supernovae and other
multi-messenger astronomical events, and dark matter. The Canadian
group is working on a number of interesting R&D efforts aimed towards
maximizing the potential of Hyper-K.
A background and a source of major systematic uncertainty in the CP
violation analysis is caused by events where a gamma ray or two are
produced in a neutrino interaction instead of the usual charged lepton
(signal electron). Supervised deep learning techniques such as
Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) and PointNets have been developed
in-house for classification, and we are incorporating these methods in
a statistical analysis to estimate to what precision these backgrounds
could be measured and demonstrate improved background rejection.
These supervised algorithms are somewhat a blackbox and we wish to
develop panoptic segmentation to extract physical features (e.g. two
overlapping gamma rays) that can provide logical support to the CNN
predictions (i.e. opening the black box). Furthermore, the
segmentation of multiple particles can serve as an
auxiliary/intermediate task towards biasing classification and
regression for potentially improved performance.
Time permitting, generative deep learning methods can be applied to
limit the impact of systematic effects or to improve the classifier
training process. Such methods will include Generative Adversarial
Networks (GANs) and their variants such as CycleGANs. The successful
completion of the project will have a substantial impact on key
scientific goals of both the Super-K and Hyper-K experiment, such as
the CP violation measurement and other areas of particle physics and
astronomy.","Duties:
Major duties include:
- Development and tuning of deep learning models for analysis of water
Cherenkov data.
- Development and deployment of statistical data analysis tools.
Skills learned during this work experience:
- Experience in many aspects of a complicated physics problem. This
will range from low level understanding of photosensors to the
description of the high level capabilities of a next-generation
neutrino experiment.
- Machine learning concepts and experience with deep learning
libraries such as PyTorch
- Experience with generative deep learning methods
- Critical thinking and problem solving
- Presentation skills from reports in regular meetings at national and
international levels","Qualifications:
We are looking for a motivated physics student to work on an exciting
high-energy physics project. The core skills that we are looking for
include:
- Strong competence in the use of computational methods for data
analysis.
- Ability to quickly learn new software tools and software packages.
- Experience with using Linux OS.
- Python programming experience.
- Experience with numerical libraries numpy, matplotlib
- Understanding of machine learning and deep learning concepts.
- Experience with deep learning and machine learning frameworks e.g.
pytorch, scikit-learn
- Senior undergraduate level knowledge of Quantum Mechanics and
electromagnetism
- Ability to independently solve problems and investigate
alternatives.
Beneficial skills would include:
- Understanding of the basics of a particle physics detector.
- Understanding of concepts in probability theory and statistics.
- C++ programming experience
- Experience with batch processing systems (slurm, torque)
- Experience with versioning tools (git)
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Jan - Apr 2022, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column11: Atom Trap for Beta Decay Research Assistant (ON-SITE)

column1: ,Triumf,Head Office,1,Open for Applications,Vancouver,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",1,"

column8: ,4 month work term,TRIUMF

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-3
Student job title:
ON-SITE: Atom trap for beta decay Research Assistant
Name of project:
Particle physics with atom traps
Overview:
We want to improve our atomic physics probes of the location and spin
direction of our trapped radioactive atoms. We've had success in the
past measuring accurately the average neutrino direction emitted with
respect to the electron direction in beta decay. We can also
spin-polarize the nuclei, measuring the average direction of all
particles emitted. All our tabletop-sized measurements, just like
high-energy physics, have been annoyingly consistent with our present
understanding of particle physics, so we interpret our results as
constraints on the existence of possible extra new particles. To keep
pace with the LHC upgrade, we want to improve our experimental
precision.
Most of our particle detection development is done by postdocs and
grad students, while the undergrads have well-defined projects using
optics and atomic physics techniques to improve the atom trapping and
spin polarization. These atomic physics projects are on stable
potassium atoms readily available to us, allowing us to mimic the
behavior of the radioactive isotopes of potassium we trap with
dedicated beamtime from TRIUMF's accelerator complex.
https://trinat.triumf.ca  has some details
These experiments would be about 2-3 days/week in the atom trap optics
lab at TRIUMF, with design and non-immediate analysis taking place on
or off-site depending on pandemic status. The on-site research will
likely continue to use pandemic protocols following the ALARA
(exposure As Low as Reasonably Achievable) principle borrowed from
radiation safety.","Duties:
Tasks include:
improving fast timing and duty cycle of CMOS cameras imaging the
atomic cloud;
developing better laser cooling of the atoms using a different atomic
transition of our potassium atoms;
optimizing our upgraded circularly polarized laser system on potassium
atom observables.
Skills learned during this work experience:
Optics characterization and alignment. Control programming. Atomic
physics data acquisition and analysis.","Qualifications:
Physics or Engineering Physics student preferred. Optics course and/or
lab would be an asset. Electronics lab with equivalent of Horowitz and
Hill would be an asset. Some quantum mechanics would be helpful to
understand the atom trapping. C++ programming would be an asset.
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: January-April 2022, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column11: Intern, Data Analysis of Measurements with Exotic Nuclei (REMOTE & ON-SITE)

column1: ,Triumf,Head Office,1,Open for Applications,Vancouver,Intermediate, Senior",0,"

column8: ,4 month work term,TRIUMF

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-5
Student job title:
REMOTE & ON-SITE
Data analysis of measurements with exotic nuclei. Hands on with
neutron detectors.
Name of project:
Beta-delayed neutron emission studies
Overview:
The beta-delayed neutron emission is a dominant decay mechanism in the
neutron-rich region. The study of this phenomena has implications and
applications in fields such as nuclear structure, power fission
reactors, and astrophysics, where is especially important in the
understanding the creation of elements heavier than iron.
Since 2017, an experimental campaign carried out at the RIKEN facility
in Japan is providing data for hundreds of isotopes. The analysis of
these data will provide new values for nuclei species and lots of new
inputs for simulations and theoretical models.
At TRIUMF, experiments with the DESCANT detector coupled with the
GRIFFIN gamma-ray spectroscopy detector, will allow to access
information of decays where neutrons are involved that are not
possible to determine with other experimental setups.
The aim of the project is to contribute with new experimental data of
exotic nuclei in the neutron-rich region.","Duties:
Data analysis of experimental measurements:
- Data mining of the features involved in experimental data sets,
using ROOT (C++ framework).
- Support in data correlation techniques.
- Implement known mathematical models to the data and determine
nuclear properties of analysed nuclei.
- Provide basic reports.
Hands on with experimental detector setups:
- Support to the maintenance and performance checking of the DESCANT
array detectors.
Skills learned during this work experience:
Working with this project the student will learn how these
experimental campaigns are performed, the detection systems involved
and how the measurements are taken in the laboratory.
They will practice and skills of data analysis using the ROOT
framework, broadly used in the nuclear field. They will also manage
large sets of data and mining techniques will be acquired.
They will establish relations between features and extracting relevant
information from data throughout predetermined models.
They will also learn procedures of maintenance of experimental
detectors, the safety protocols, the use of Personal Protective
Equipment (PPE) etc.","Qualifications:
The candidate should be enrolled in a Physics or Computer Science
program with 2nd year completed.
No work experience outside academia required.
Minimum skills required:
- Intermediate programming skills in C/C++ or other relevant language
(Python, JAVA...).
- Knowledge of basic statistical models.
- Basic electronic concepts
Other desired abilities:
- Good communication skills.
- Personal interest with the nuclear field, astrophysics.
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Sep - Dec 2021, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column11: Particle Physics with Ultracold Neutrons - Student Project (ONSITE)

column1: ,Triumf,Head Office,1,Open for Applications,Vancouver,Intermediate, Senior",0,"

column8: ,4 month work term,TRIUMF

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Winter 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-7
Student job title:
ONSITE - Particle physics with ultracold neutrons student project
Name of project:
Development work for the neutron EDM experiment
Overview:
Knowledge of fundamental properties of the neutron helps us understand
many aspects of the universe; it all starts right after the Big Bang:
the energy available at the time of the Big Bang created a large
number of particle and antiparticle pairs, which in turn, annihilated
and transformed back to energy, but in the end matter won over
antimatter in the universe, making our existence possible. The main
ingredient to that, matter anti-matter asymmetry, requires another
fundamental asymmetry, called CP violation. This, in turn might show
up in a non-zero electric dipole moment (EDM) of the neutron, making
EDM measurements the flagship of fundamental neutron physics.
As tools to achieve this, we use ultracold neutrons (UCN), which are
neutrons of such remarkably low energies that they are totally
reflected from the surfaces of a variety of materials. Hence, they can
be confined in material bottles for long periods of time. Typically,
UCN have kinetic energies less than 300 neV (and velocities of order 8
m/s). Since neutrons are a fundamental constituent of the universe,
confined neutrons can be used in experiments to study many interesting
questions - like the search for the neutron EDM.
The UCN facility is currently being commissioned, and the neutron EDM
experiment is in the conceptual design phase. Exciting times lie ahead
of the UCN project since we perfomed the first production ever of
ultracold neutrons in Canada just in 2017!
Various opportunities exist for an undergrad student to contribute in
a significant way to the success and future design of the neutron EDM
experiment.","Duties:
We are looking for a student to stay with our project for one or two
terms.
The student will work on developing equipment for the neutron edm
experiment.
Thus the student's duties will be well balanced between hands-on tasks
in the laboratory or the experimental area, and office work such as:
development of 3D computer models as well as analytical investigations
using tools like CAD software, finite element analysis, computing
software, or simulation packages (solidworks, opera, ansys, matlab,
mathematica, Monte Carlo, GEANT4, and similar).
The hands-on tasks will be related to the design and/or commissioning
of test-setups geared towards the nEDM apparatus. Actively
participating in the conceptual design, installation work and
measurement campaigns of both, the nEDM and the UCN source will be
crucial to the students activities.
This might require a moderate amount of shift work, if the
collaboration performs a beam time with the UCN source, or other
resource intensive test and measurement campaigns.
This entire work will be carried out in an international team
environment with physicists and graduate students from the different
institutes (KEK, U of Osaka, RCNP, UBC, UNCB, U Manitoba, U Winnipeg,
SFU, and TRIUMF) who are part of the Japanese-Canadian UCN-nEDM
collaboration. The student will communicate to other collaboration
members and give updates about his or her work regularly during oral
presentations and written reports.","Skills learned during this work experience:
The student will be familiarized with fundamental neutron physics
topics, high precision measurement applications, and particle physics
techniques. Their analytical skills will be enhanced and experience
from course/lab training or previous work terms will be applied to
fundamental research. The student will have the possibility to take
part in the daily life of an experimental physics collaboration and
contribute to the advancement of the project.
Additionally, participation in our weekly international status
meetings for the UCN source and EDM experiment will introduce the
student into the world international collaboration. This will enhance
the students communication skills and train clear presentation of
technical and scientific concepts to peers.
We are providing a stimulating environment for students to learn new
things while contributing significantly to the overall progress of the
UCN/nEDM project. Last but not least, the TRIUMF coop program offers
education about other scientific projects related to the Canadian
subatomic physics community via student lectures throughout the work
term!
Qualifications:
Third or Fourth year physics or engineering physics (Eng.Phys.)
students with some experimental experience.
Affinity for experimental techniques and development is what we are
looking for in an ideal candidate.
We expect the student to work independently on given tasks - after
proper introduction to the topic and support by other team members
when problems come across. Experience gathered in previous coop terms
is appreciated.
Basic knowledge in programming in any common language/application will
be an asset (Python, C/C++, Matlab, Labview, LaTex, etc).
Experience using CAD software (ideally SolidWorks) is recommended.
Some experience using FEA software (e.g. ANSYS, Opera, FEMM) and C++
(or equivalent) and working in a linux-based environment would also be
advantageous.
Please fill the coop student google questionnaire provided by our
program coordinator!
Shiftwork required: Yes
Period of Work: 4-8 months, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,TRIUMF

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-9
Student job title:
Gamma-Ray Spectroscopy Undergraduate Research Assistant
Name of project:
Gamma-Ray Spectroscopy at ISAC
Overview:
Our group studies the behaviour of exotic, short-lived, artificially
produced isotopes.  For these experiments, we maintain
state-of-the-art gamma-ray detector arrays, GRIFFIN (Gamma-Ray
Infrastructure for Fundamental Investigations of Nuclei) and TIGRESS
(TRIUMF-ISAC Gamma-Ray Escape Suppressed Spectrometer).  They consist
of custom-built semiconductor and inorganic scintillator gamma-ray
detectors.  This equipment requires frequent reconfiguration,
preventative maintenance and repair for efficient operation.","Duties:
The first general duty of the candidate shall be to assist in the
refurbishment of high-purity germanium detectors.  These detectors
operate in a vacuum, which needs to be regenerated every two years,
then cooled to liquid nitrogen temperatures and tested before being
re-installed in the experimental setup.
The second general duty shall be to redesign, build and test a
RaspberryPi-Arudino-based data logger with a web user interface to
monitor and display the detector temperature and pressure, and
optionally other process variables.  The existing prototype system
performs basically as expected, but there is room for improvement in
the layout and packaging to improve reliability, accuracy and
customizability, and in the user interface to increase functionality
and code maintainability.
Skills learned during this work experience:
Fundamentals of nuclear radiation; radiation measurement;
electromechanical interfaces; use of vacuum systems; application of
RPi/Arduino; signal conditioning","Qualifications:
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENT:  The successful candidate shall have a
minimum of 2 terms of physical science (physics. chemistry,  etc.) or
relevant engineering disciplines (engineering physics, electrical
engineering, computer engineering, etc.)
EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENT: Through coursework, extracurricular activity,
or work or life experience, the candidate shall demonstrate an ability
to work with Raspberry Pi and Arduino systems for monitoring
environments or processes.
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  In addition to the requirement above, it is
desired that the candidate has experience in one or more of:  working
with delicate equipment; designing and troubleshooting simple
electrical and electronic systems; developing simple web applications;
writing code in C++ or python; developing code in a collaborative
environment; soldering and electrical assembly; designing printed
circuit boards; designing enclosures for electrical or electronic
equipment; cryogenics;  vacuum or turbine systems; light mechanical
assembly.
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Jan - Apr 2022, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters
