column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Fall 2021 job posting Job number TR21-3-7
Student job title:
ON-SITE Hyper-Kamiokande Photosensor Undergrad Student Researcher
Name of project:
Development of a High-resolution Photon Detector for the
Hyper-Kamiokande experiment.
Overview:
Neutrino oscillations are the only experimentally verified observation
of a process not described by the Standard Model (SM) of particle
physics. Since their discovery in 1998 we have learned a lot about the
parameters that govern these oscillations, but there are still many
questions remaining. Perhaps the most exciting of these is to
determine whether neutrino oscillations violate charge-parity (CP)
symmetry, and so could potentially explain why we live in a
matter-dominated universe.
The Intermediate Water Cherenkov Detector (IWCD) is a part of the next
generation of Hyper-Kamiokande (Hyper-K) neutrino experiment in Japan.
Hyper-K will be a successor to the successful Super-Kamiokande and T2K
experiments. The Hyper-K experiment is now approved and moving towards
the construction phase with an expected start in 2028.  It will be a
powerful tool for exploring neutrino oscillations, as well as other
phenomenon such as proton decay. The Canadian group is working on a
number of interesting R&D efforts aimed towards the NuPRISM detector
and Hyper-K projects.
The goal of this particular project is to assist in the development of
a new type of photosensor for the IWCD. This is the multi-PMT: a
series of 3"" PMTs are placed inside a transparent pressure vessel with
the digitizing electronics. For this project you will be helping to
complete the mechanical design of the multi-PMT, design and implement
tools and procedures for the multi-PMT mass production, and construct
and operate an electronically controlled light source movement system
for optical testing of the multi-PMTs.
The work will include optimization of the mechanical design for the
multi-PMT using CAD tools, overseeing the production of parts from
TRIUMF or commercial partners, quality control of parts, and assembly
of parts into the multi-PMT module. The multi-PMT assembly work will
be carried out with the goal of developing procedures to optimize the
eventual mass production of the multi-PMTs. The work may also
including testing of the multi-PMTs to characterize their mechanical,
electrical and photon detection performance.","Duties:
Duties on this project will include one or more of the following:
- Competing optimization of the mechanical design for multi-PMTs based
on the experience gained from the construction and testing of
prototypes
- Overseeing the production of multi-PMT prototype parts using 3D
printing, the TRIUMF machine shop and commercial partners.
- Assembly of the multi-PMT prototypes and development of optimized
assembly procedures and equipment to maximize the efficiency and
quality of multi-PMT assembly.
- Completing assembly and programming of an automated multi-PMT
optical test stand
- Testing of multi-PMT prototype modules to characterize their
mechanical, electrical and photon detection properties.
Skills learned during this work experience:
- Experience in design and construction of mechanical systems.
- Experience with computer aided design tools and stress analysis.
- Experience in parts fabrication methods, including 3D printing.
- Experience in quality control for parts production.
- Experience in mechatronics systems.
- Critical thinking and problem solving.
- Presentation skills from reports in regular meetings at national and
international levels.","Qualifications:
We are looking for a motivated mechanical engineering or physics
engineering student to work on an exciting high-energy physics
project. The core skills that we are looking for include:
- Strong competence in the design, simulation, assembly and testing of
mechanical systems.
- Ability to quickly learn several new computer tools and software
packages.
- Ability to independently solve problems and investigate
alternatives.
Beneficial skills would include:
- Experience with standard CAD software tools, particularly SolidWorks
- Experience on mechatronics projects
- Experience with using Linux OS would be very beneficial.
- Experience with standard CAD software tools.
- Understanding of the basics of a particle physics detector,
particularly of photo-multiplier tubes.
- Familiarity with modern fabrication techniques and materials.
- Basic programming skills, particularly with C++ or Python
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Sep - Dec 2021, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2021 job posting Job number TR21-2-8
Student job title:
REMOTE - Researcher in theoretical/computational subatomic physics
Name of project:
First principles theory for exotic nuclei with connections to neutrino
and dark-matter physics
Overview:
This project will focus on the development and application of powerful
theoretical methods to explore fundamental questions on the structure
of exotic nuclei, or more far-reaching connections to neutrino and
dark-matter physics. The student will first gain familiarity and build
confidence working with the basic ingredients of such calculations:
nuclear forces and their connection to the underlying theory of strong
interactions (quantum chromodynamics), and nuclear many-body methods
to predict properties of medium-mass nuclei.  Depending on particular
interests, the student will have the exciting opportunity either to
design and implement an extension to the existing computational
infrastructure, work on computationally optimizing existing codes, or
perform a series of calculations which will confront directly with
experiments being performed at TRIUMF or other prominent experimental
facilities across the world.","Duties:
The student will perform calculations, organize and interpret results,
and work on implementing or testing extensions to existing codes. The
student will also be encouraged to take part in group and lab-wide
activities, such as colloquia, seminars, and journal clubs, and to
interact with experimental colleagues, with whom they will have daily
contact on-site at TRIUMF.","Skills learned during this work experience:
The student will learn to run and interpret leading-edge nuclear
theory calculation, where emphasis will be placed on organizing and
effectively communicating scientific results. With the latest advances
in high-performance computing and optimization algorithms at her/his
disposal, the student will gain experience with parallel-computing
techniques such as OpenMP and MPI and work on some of the world's
largest supercomputers.  Finally, there will be ample opportunities to
further hone scientific writing and presentation skills.
Qualifications:
The ideal applicant will have mastered material encountered in
introductory quantum mechanics courses and be familiar with concepts
such as eigenvalues, wavefunctions, operators, unitary
transformations, and angular-momentum algebra. Furthermore, some
computing experience is required, with fluency in either C++
(preferred) or Fortran highly desirable.
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: May to August (or December) - 4 or 8 month term, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2021 job posting Job number TR21-1-16
Student job title:
ON-SITE - PMT Test Facility Researcher
Name of project:
Photosensor Test Facility for the Hyper-Kamiokande Project
Overview:
Neutrino oscillations are the only experimentally verified observation
of a process not described by the Standard Model (SM) of particle
physics. Since their discovery in 1998 we have learnt a lot about the
parameters that govern these oscillations, but there are still many
questions remaining. Perhaps the most exciting of these is to
determine whether neutrino oscillations violate charge-parity (CP)
symmetry, and so could potentially explain why we live in a
matter-dominated universe.
The next generation Hyper-Kamiokande experiment in Japan will be a
powerful tool for exploring neutrino oscillations, as well as other
phenomena such as proton decay. It will succeed the currently
operating Super-Kamiokande and T2K experiments, and come online around
2027. The Canadian group is working on a number of interesting R&D
efforts aimed towards the Hyper-K project, including a new prototype
detector aiming to run in a CERN beam line by 2022.
The goal of this particular project is to assist in the assembly,
commissioning, and operation of a specialized Photosensor Test
Facility (PTF) located at TRIUMF. The PTF is designed to allow
detailed characterization of photomultiplier tubes (PMTs) that are
capable of detecting single photons. The key features of the PTF are
the ability to fire laser light at a PMT submerged in water from
arbitrary angles and directions and measure the reflected laser light
at various points. We do this using a pair of optical heads that are
translated/rotated using a motor-controlled gantry system. These
measurements are crucial for completely understanding the PMT
response, in order to simulate the Super-K, Hyper-K and prototype
detectors to the precision necessary for a CP violation discovery.","Duties:
- Assist with assembly of PTF components, such as gantry system,
optical boxes, Helmholtz coils, PMT mounts and cabling
- Develop detailed PTF measurement procedures, including position,
angle, polarization, and magnetic field dependence.
- Assist with many elements of operation, including motor-controllers,
magnetic field measurements, and electrical pulse digitizers.
- Development and debugging of the modeling of the system with
simulation code (COMSOL, GEANT4).
- Detailed analysis of the PTF data for various types of PMTs (ROOT,
Python).
- Improvement of the PTF setup for reduced uncertainties, increased
flexibility and faster turn-around.","Skills learned during this work experience:
- Experience in many aspects of a complicated physics problem. This
will range from low level work on lab measurement systems and
electronics, to the description of the high level capabilities of a
next-generation neutrino experiment.
- Operation of PMTs
- Operation of a complicated precision calibration system
- Critical thinking and problem solving
- Analysis of critical detector data and assessment of statistical and
systematic uncertainties
- Presentation skills from reports in regular meetings at national and
international levels
Qualifications:
We are looking for a motivated physics student to work on an exciting
high-energy physics project. The core skills that we are looking for
include:
- Demonstrated hands-on experience with careful attention to detail
- Strong competence in the use of computers for serious analysis.
- Ability to quickly learn several new computer tools and software
packages.
- C++ programming experience.
- Basic programming skills.
- Experience in rapid and thorough data analysis.
- Ability to independently solve problems and investigate
alternatives.
Beneficial skills would include:
- Experience with using Linux OS would be very beneficial.
- Experience with standard HEP software packages, in particular GEANT4
and ROOT.
- Understanding of the basics of a particle physics detector,
particularly of photo-multiplier tubes.
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Jan - Apr 2021 with possible 4-month extension, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-15
Student job title:
ON-SITE - TITAN Coop Student
Name of project:
Single-ion manipulation to study nuclear structure and astrophysics
Overview:
The atomic mass plays a critical role in furthering our understanding
in many disciplines, from forensics to metrology. In nuclear physics
where short-lived, synthesized nuclides are studied, masses indicate
the energetically allowed pathways for stellar-burning processes for
nuclear astrophysics, the strength of the strong interaction and with
that the limits of nuclear existence, and physics beyond the Standard
Model, complementarily to experiments at the LHC-CERN.
Among the premier mass spectrometers at radioactive beam facilities is
TRIUMF's Ion Trap for Atomic and Nuclear Science (TITAN). Its
multi-reflection time-of-flight (MR-TOF) mass separator and
spectrometer permits manipulation of a single ion and therefore to
determine its mass with high precision and accuracy despite enormous
contamination. These measurements require calibration, preferably from
a controlled off-line ion source. For this purpose, a new electrospray
ion source will be installed on the MR-TOF system.","Duties:
The project is to prepare the source following TITAN's
ultra-high-vacuum protocol, to install it, and to test it. Once
successfully commissioned, different calibration techniques can be
explored. The student Will assist the MR-TOF team in other regular
maintenance, operation, and repair of the MR-TOF
Skills learned during this work experience:
- the physics motivation for atomic mass measurements
- the physics and operation of a MR-TOF mass spectrometer
- ion sources
- low-energy beam transport
- the operation and control of a complex research facility
- charged-particle detection systems
- control systems & data acquisition systems
- data analysis","Qualifications:
The candidate should
- have completed one semester of upper-division electromagnetism
- be familiar with a programming language
- possess strong communication and organizational skills
- value team work
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Jan - Apr 2022, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Fall 2021 job posting Job number TR21-3-11
Student job title:
ON-SITE Cryomodule engineering student
Name of project:
Design of the CERN Hi-Lumi Cryomodule Assembly Fixtures
Overview:
TRIUMF is commissioned to build five crab cavity cryomodules for the
High Luminosity upgrade project at CERN. In preparation for the
assembly several jigs and fixtures will have to be designed and
fabricated. In addition a cryomodule will be in the process of
assembly.","Duties:

designer and technical staff with input from a TRIUMF mechanical
engineer to support the design of the fixtures with the aim of
completing final design and fabrication drawings for release to the
machine shop. In addition, if COVID protocols allow, the student may
assist in the assembly of a cryomodule that TRIUMF is building for
VECC in Kolkata to gain first hand experience in cryomodule design.
Skills learned during this work experience:
The Student will gain knowledge on RF, superconductivity, and
cryogenics, master CAD and FEA tools to conduct mechanical
simulations, and gain hands-on experience on mechanical engineering,
and vacuum technology.  The training would strengthen student's
capability for his/her future career in mechanical engineering.","Qualifications:
3-4 year Mechanical engineer or Engineering Physics student
Shiftwork required: No

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-25
Student job title:
Light sensor developer
Name of project:
Back-side illuminated single photon detector development
Overview:
Backside illuminated single photon sensor are expected to achieve
close to 100% efficiency from vacuum ultra-violet to near infra-red
while being directly compatible to 3D integrated electronics. This
latter advantage will enable achieving single photon time resolution
on the order of 10ps. High efficiency at 128nm, the liquid Argon
scintillation wavelength coupled to high timing resolution would
enable the design of a new experiment configuration with very high
potential for discovering Dark Matter interactions. Used in liquid
Xenon, BSI single photon sensors could also be used for dark matter
search, probing neutrino properties but also in positron emission
tomography (medical imaging).  The goal of the project is to identify
a BSI solution that meets Astro-particle physics experiment
requirements, and in particular ARGO, a liquid Argon dark matter
search experiment.","Duties:
The back side illuminated single photon sensors that have been built
so far, suffer from their high sensitivity to the production of
photons in silicon avalanches. Such avalanches are necessary for the
detection of single photons producing single electron-hole pair in
silicon. But the production of photons can lead to additional
avalanches if they are reabsorbed in the sensor. The sensor then
become inaccurate or even unstable. The project duties are to
characterize photon production in avalanches in detail using the
TRIUMF Microscope for injection and emission of light (MIEL), and to
assess the performances of various sensor configuration using
simulations tuned to reproduced the MIEL data. The end goal is the
identification of solution for mitigating the impact of light
production in avalanches in BSI sensor configuration towards the
fabrication of a state-of-the-art sensor.
Skills learned during this work experience:
Microscopy, luminescence, finite element simulations, silicon
detector, optics linear and non-linear","Qualifications:
Experience with lab system operation. Some programming experiment in
C++ or Python and with the Linux operating. Experience with finite
element simulation is an asset.
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Jan - Apr 2022, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-31
Student job title:
REMOTE - Junior Programmer Analyst
Name of project:
IS&T
Overview:
TRIUMF has developed a number of applications used by the laboratory.
These are written in multiple languages and require maintenance and
enhancements.
The Information Systems & Technology team requires support for the
documentation of these systems and integrations and the development of
databases and reporting tools to allow easy access to system
configuration and process mappings.
The position could be done remotely, with some on-site work possible.","Duties:
The student will be involved in working with IS&T team members to
identify gaps in the documentation of systems and processes and to
recommend and/or develop solutions to address those gaps.
This will require the use of modern data management tools and software
which may include SharePoint, One Drive, SQL Server, Java programs or
other tools. The student may be assigned software development tasks
and other daily tasks using Java, PHP or Python.
Skills learned during this work experience:
The student will gain an appreciation of how a complex Information
Technology environment is constructed and maintained and will become
familiar with documentation and data management tools, both
off-the-shelf and custom built. The student will also be exposed to
cyber security threat detection and analysis.","Qualifications:
• The incumbent must have strong problem-solving and analytical
skills, as well as initiative, creativity and the ability to work with
abstract concepts.
• Expertise in applicable development technologies including J2EE,PHP
and/or Python, Restful, Kubernetes, SOAP, micro-web service,
Javascript, Jquery, Git/GitLab, Spring boots, Maven, Jira issue and
project tracker, and cloud.

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-29
Student job title:
Life Sciences Division Chemistry Research Assistant
Name of project:
Isotope separation and chelator synthesis for targeted radionuclide
therapy
Overview:
TRIUMF Life Sciences Division maintains a strong medical isotope and
radiopharmaceutical production and development capability enabled by
the unique infra structures including four cyclotrons and deep
expertise. The program supports local and international users
conducting high-impact research including the production of novel
clinically relevant isotopes, radiopharmaceutical development for
cancer diagnose and treatment, imaging of neurodegeneration diseases
and cutting-edge new technologies in nuclear medicine.  One of our
major research efforts is to develop and test novel chelates to
harness the powerful radionuclides for cancer diagnose and treatment,
i.e. targeted radionuclide therapy. The chelates under development in
our labs have been successfully used to chelate next generation
therapeutical isotopes including Ac-225, Tb-161, Lu-177 and others.
When conjugated with targeting vector, the radiopharmaceuticals
demonstrated tumour specific accumulation and treatment efficacy in
several preclinical studies. With the recent surge of global interests
in targeted radionuclide therapy and novel medical isotopes, trainees
from this program will be well-positioned in this field where highly
qualified personnel are in high demand.","Duties:
The successful candidate will join the effort of developing the next
generation radiopharmaceuticals for targeted radionuclide therapy.
She/He will take part in the organic synthesis and characterization,
isotope production and purification, and also participate in the in
vitro and in vivo evaluation.
Skills learned during this work experience:
Hands-on knowledge and experience with organic synthesis, analysis,
radioisotope production, characterization, and radiopharmaceutical
preparation will be learned.  Basic knowledge in radiopharmaceutical
sciences and radiotracer development will be acquired.  Documentation
and presentation skills will be practised.","Qualifications:
The successful candidate will be a chemistry student with lab
experience. Experience with organic synthesis and characterization
(NMR, MS) is required. Experience with other analytical methods (HPLC,
UV) and communication skills will be considered an asset.
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Jan - Apr 2022, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-30
Student job title:
Cryomodule Design Student
Name of project:
Energy Booster Cryomodule Design for Superconducting Linac
Overview:
ISAC facility was a world leading ISOL system to produce rare isotope
beams for researches. In the high energy section, ISAC-II heavy ion
superconducting linac provides 40MV for accelerating isotopes above
the Coulomb barrier. TRIUMF proposed to develop a high performing
booster cryomodule, which consists of 8 superconducting RF resonators
and is capable of producing >16MV of accelerating voltage to add to
the existing ISAC-II. The addition of the booster module will restore
ISAC-II final energy to the world leading values.","Duties:
The student will model the cryomodule and vault layout based on beam
dynamics and rf cavity design inputs. The student will study
mechanical engineering aspects of the cavity, the cryomodule and the
installation and prepare a costing of the effort. Depending on the
student, aspects of the beam dynamics or rf design would also be
modeled at some level.
Skills learned during this work experience:
The student will gain experience in linac design, SRF technology,
cryomodule design and FEA analysis. This will be an invaluable
experience for a student of Mechanical Engineering or Engineering
Physics.","Qualifications:
Mechanical Engineering or Engineering Physics. The job will require
experience with mechanical design and 3D modeling. Experience with FEA
or knowledge of RF/beam dynamics would be an asset.
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Jan - Apr 2022, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

TRIUMF is Canada's particle accelerator centre. We are an

TRIUMF's Strategic Communications Team is a vibrant group committed to

We are seeking a motivated and dynamic individual to take on the role

(print and digital) spaces, and UX and UI support.","Duties:

relations, communications design, resourcefulness, and project
management. In particular, the Communications Designer will learn

public relations or marketing. Strong project management skills and

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-4
Student job title:
PIF & NIF student contributor
Name of project:
2D translation stage for beam characterization at the TRIUMF
Irradiation Facilities PIF & NIF
Overview:
Electronic components exposed to a radiation environment can
experience loss of function due both to the accumulation of radiation
damage over time or because of a single high-energy interaction with a
subatomic particle, called a single-event effect.  In applications
with more intense radiation environments, such as space or air flight,
or in low-error-tolerance application such as the automotive industry,
testing of the radiation sensitivity of electronic components is a
standard part of the qualification process for new components.
TRIUMF's PIF & NIF facility provide low-intensity, energetic proton
and neutron beams to simulate radiation exposures either in space or
terrestrial environments. Even at low intensity, several minutes of
exposure in these beams can simulate years of operation in space, air,
or ground, effectively allowing users to perform accelerated testing
of electronics components in the radiation conditions present in those
environments.  Precise characterization of the beam profile is crucial
for the proton and neutron beam lines of the PIF & NIF facility, as
high beam uniformity is needed for most of the radiation tests done at
PIF & NIF.  Over the past year, a 2D translation stage with optical
fibre holder was designed and assembled for use in the beam lines
operated by PIF & NIF.  This stage will allow precise characterization
of the 2D cross section of the beams at the operating position in both
neutrons and proton beams. The main goal of the project is to take the
newly assembled 2D stage, complete its commissioning and develop the
software tools needed to be able to use it routinely at PIF & NIF.","Duties:
With the mechanical assembly now done, the student would take over
responsibility for the commissioning of the 2D stage for beam
characterization with optical fibres, including improvements to
resolve issues brought up during the early commissioning such as
cross-direction position jitter and motor-induced noise. They will be
responsible for the development of the software interface to run the
2D stage with the optical fibre detector, including the graphical user
interface.
Furthermore, the stage is envisioned to also be used with another type
of beam mapping sensor, based on SRAM memory.  The student will be
responsible to design, coordinate the manufacturing of, and assemble a
dedicated mechanical holder for the SRAM detector to be used with the
2D stage.  They will also write the software package enabling
synchronized use of the SRAM detector and the 2D stage, and
accompanying graphical user interface.  The work will be documented
for use by TRIUMF teams and is expected to contribute to one or more
scientific publications.
Skills learned during this work experience:
Python programming (possibly also C++ if desired), Arduino
programming, knowledge of radiation sensors, mechanical and software
design and implementation, using and controlling stepping motors,
working in a multidisciplinary R&D team, writing scientific reports,
articles and documentation.","Qualifications:
The candidate should be a student in a relevant engineering specialty
(physics, electrical, electronic, software), comp sci  or  physics
with interest in multidisciplinary projects.  Knowledge of Python
programming is necessary.  Experience with Arduino programming,
SolidWorks and 3D printing are assets.  The student should be in 3rd
or 4th year and have work experience overlapping some of the tools and
tasks in the project description.  They should be enthusiastic about
picking up new skills and learning new tools and will be expected to
seek out the resources needed to self-teach these skills during the
project term.
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Jan - Apr 2022","Targeted Clusters

column1: Canada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Spring 2022 job posting Job number TR22-1-13
Student job title:
Neural Net Machine Learning Beam Tuning Programmer/Simulator or Junior
Engineer
Name of project:
Development of a ML NN environment to tune Muon Beamlines
Overview:
Well designed Muon beam lines at facilities like TRIUMF can deliver
10-20 times the particle flux that can be used in an experiment.
Learning how to ""throw away"" the excess flux to deliver the highest
quality beam to a small (1mm^2) sample is a non-intuitive task, even
for an experienced beam-line physicist. G4beamline is a simulation
environment in which we have well developed Muon beamline models. The
project will set-up and utilize a ML NN to ""understand"" the simulation
dynamics with the goal of optimizing the beam luminosity into a small
target.","Duties:
-Learn to understand and operate the G4beamline simulation
environment.
-Set up a ML NN environment (on a 64 thread/GPU equipped computer)
using the G4beamline simulation as the data/reward source vs the
beamline settings inputs for a relatively simple surface muon
beamline.
-Model performance evaluation
-If time permits, extend the work to a decay muon beamline.
-The student will draw on the experience of a similar project
currently underway at TRIUMF for low energy charged nuclei.
-Write a report.
Skills learned during this work experience:
-Insight into (muon) beam-line dynamics and accelerator physics
-Concepts in deep learning and reinforcement learning.
-Concepts in control theory (e.g. PID)
-Experience with deep learning libraries in python (pytorch,
tensorflow)
-C++ programming experience
-Experience with batch processing systems (slurm, torque)
-Experience with versioning tools (git)
-Development of a complete Simulation/ML NN environment.","Qualifications:
Required:
-Strong background in python programming.
-Experience with numerical libraries in python: numpy, matplotlib,
scikit-learn
-Basic knowledge of statistics and machine learning concepts.
-Strong knowledge of physics curriculum at senior undergraduate level.
Beneficial:
-Concepts in accelerator physics
-Concepts in deep learning and reinforcement learning.
-Concepts in control theory (e.g. PID)
-Experience with deep learning libraries in python (pytorch,
tensorflow)
-C++ programming experience
-Experience with batch processing systems (slurm, torque)
-Experience with versioning tools (git)
Shiftwork required: No
Period of Work: Jan - Apr 2022, with possible 4-month extension","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Trustwave helps businesses fight cybercrime, protect data and reduce security risk. With cloud and managed security services, integrated technologies and a team of security experts, ethical hackers and researchers, Trustwave enables businesses to transform the way they manage their information security and compliance programs. Trustwave delivers automated, efficient and cost-effective threat, vulnerability and compliance management. Trustwave is a privately held company, headquartered in Chicago, with customers in 96 countries. For more information about Trustwave, visit https://www.trustwave.com .  You are also encouraged to check out our company blog at https://www.trustwave.com/en-us/resources/blogs/trustwave-blog/ .

column1: The Trustwave Waterloo engineering team is responsible for developing the Trustwave SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) line of products.  SIEM systems provide identification, analysis and recovery of enterprise network security events.  SIEMs collect event data from security devices such as firewalls, IDS, IPS, etc. and correlate this information to produce threat scenarios which can then by analyzed and acted upon.

Our Waterloo office offers a comfortable workspace, great learning environment, and an opportunity to work with some of the best in the industry! Our office is currently closed due to COVID-19 and our employees are all working from home.  We will revisit a reopening plan when we are able.","The successful candidate will be a member of the SIEM Engineering team and be assigned various hands-on tasks from all areas of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).  With the software development team, work will include developing, debugging, unit testing and documentation for the current SIEM project(s). With the QA team, work may involve functionality verification, tooling and automated test script development and test planning. Developing automated test for our Machine Learning based analytical engine is one such project area that recent co-op students have worked on.  Additional duties may be assigned as they present themselves and specific allotment of tasks will depend on current projects and the specific aptitudes and interests of the successful candidate.","Essential Skills:

column1: We are on a mission to help large enterprise teams deliver projects securely and at light speed with TRIYO, our enterprise project collaboration platform. TRIYO optimizes how collaboration and work gets done on documents, presentations, and spreadsheets with a suite of easy to use but insanely powerful features. We've been referred to by our clients as the 'Google Docs' of the banking world.
Why join our team?
·       A Rockstar founding team with global experience assembled from Fortune 100, top management consulting firms, investment banks and Silicon Valley software firms
·       An opportunity to be an early founding engineering team member helping build the foundation of the company's future
·       Backed by veteran industry investors from Deutsche Bank, JP Morgan & LinkedIn
·       We are an Entrepreneur Roundtable Accelerator '18 alumni, the top FinTech accelerator in NYC. (165 alumni start-ups with $2 billion combined market capitalization)
·       A MaRS backed FinTech company (Canada's largest accelerator)
·       Winner of AWS's start-up pitch competition at the largest N. American technology, data, and innovation conference (2018 Waters Technology)

An early stage collaboration software company would like to bring on a Marketing Intern for next spring/summer work term. The successful candidate will be enrolled full-time in a major university or college and studying marketing or communications. We're looking for a driven, ambitious individual who wants to create a career in social media and content marketing. We're offering a flexible schedule if you continue to take classes in the summer or you wish to pursue other opportunities simultaneously. We provide extensive training, guidance and support, as well as the opportunity to experience the industry from the inside and gain valuable work experience.","Roles and Responsibilities:

Assist with creating and managing funding proposals","Required Skills:

column1: ,Tucows Inc,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",1,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Tucows (NASDAQ:TCX, TSX:TC) is on a mission to make the Internet better by providing people everywhere with online access to be empowered to make individual contributions. As a company, we embrace a people-first philosophy that is rooted in respect, trust, and understanding to encourage freedom, inspire innovation, and promote inclusivity; creating an environment for everyone to thrive!

column1: Tucows has been working on the Internet since the days when people ironically called it the Information Superhighway. We are a 25-year-old global start-up embracing agility and creativity in order to continually seize opportunity for growth. We have evolved from a start-up domain service provider to becoming the second-largest domain wholesaler in the world while expanding our business with Ting, an Internet services company partnering with towns and cities to change what customers expect from their Internet Service Provider. We are building fiber networks across the US and have already launched Gigabit speed service in Maryland, Virginia, North Carolina, Colorado, Idaho and California, laying the groundwork for rapid scale.

Our growth has been incredible, smart, and measured, built on a solid technical and financial foundation. We have doubled our workforce in the last 4 years and continue in rapid expansion mode, providing services to millions of customers around the world.
Who are we?

We've given some serious thought to who we are as a company, what our goals are and how we're going to achieve them. We have made a commitment to the principles that guide our everyday decisions: We work as a team to exceed our customers' expectations. We protect the Tucows brand by delivering the highest quality standards in every aspect of our business. Our platforms provide 24x7 availability and a high degree of scalability and manage millions of email messages, over 6 million API calls, and tens of thousands of revenue-stream transactions, every day.","What you'll be doing

As a Jr. DevOps & Database Engineer you'll be part of the Tucows group of Companies Technical Operations team that manages a number of private computing cloud solutions and a fast-growing fiber to the home ISP network infrastructure.

You'll have the opportunity to work collaboratively with our team of battle-hardened adventure seeking DBAs as well as Systems & Network engineers in charge of deployment our cloud and network systems. There will be significant engagement in building an end-to-end database performance test harness. The role will also involve automation, deployment, monitoring, and operations of those systems. You will also get to help exercise your keen observation and imagination to resolve issues in our dev, test and production environments.","What skills and experience you can bring
-Passion to learn, teach and build solutions.
-Experience with automation/configuration management using tools like Terraform, Ansible, Salt, Puppet and/or Chef.
-Experience with databases, SQL and NoSQL, performance testing, Linux administration and security
-Understanding of security and encryption (HTTP, SSL/TLS, SSH etc.), symmetric & asymmetric encryption.
-Flair for applying math/stats concepts in assessing and comparing various performance test scenario results.
-Programming background especially with scripting languages: Python, Ruby, PHP, Perl and/or Python is strongly preferred.
-Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies (including PostgreSQL, MariaDB, MySQL etc.)
-Some knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always available environment.
-Eagerness to learn & experiment, enjoy sharing your knowledge, pair-programming and make learning fun & adventurous.
Want to know more about what we stand for? At Tucows we care about protecting the open Internet, narrowing the digital divide, and supporting fairness and equality.

We also know that diversity drives innovation. We are committed to inclusion across race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We celebrate multiple approaches and diverse points of view.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
Learn more about Tucows, our culture and employee benefits on our site here.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Tuq,Divisional Office,4,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Junior,6,

column8: ,4 month work term,We are Tuq. If you need an App built that you care about then you've come to the right place. We don't take on projects that we aren't passionate about and we're passionate about every project we take on! That means we pass on a lot of what other companies call ""lucrative"" work, and that commitment to quality and dedication to the products we create is the reason that we're willing to put in our time, energy, and lifesblood into everything we build. The name's not just a catchy one-syllable word, it's an affirmation of who we are and what we stand for: Trustworthy Uncompromising Quality!

column1: Do you want to work on REAL projects for REAL clients and make valuable contributions that make a REAL difference?","Come work for Tuq! Here are some of the things you can look forward to:
- Work with companies BIG and small, and work with multiple teams, with different styles.
- Company dinners.
- No Mornings!
- Difficult, real-world challenges to tackle.
- Work on a variety of projects - from Text and Video Chat, to GPS, Gaming, and Internet of Things-connected devices.
Still not convinced? Just listen to these glowing testimonials:
It's a fast-paced, self-driven workplace where you get the opportunity to work alongside some of the best developers in the industry."" - Ernst Rullmann

I got to work on a variety of real projects with a range of technologies and languages that I never would have expected. One co-op term at Tuq will teach you more than you could have thought possible in 4 months."" - Daniel Mackenzie
It's great, and Mike has a sword!"" - Areal C. Oop","What we're looking for:

Someone who's smart, self-motivated, independent, and always looking to learn. Must be willing and able to pick up new languages and technology, and not be afraid to fail early and often. No specific previous experience necessary, but a familiarity with basic programming principles is a must. Being able to work from home is also a plus!
Want to get a head-start? Answer one of the following questions and submit the answer with your resume.
QUESTIONS:
1. Code TicTacToe with a usable interface in a language of your choice.
2. Create an database diagram (along with all required joins and model details) for a simple messaging app capable of sending messages, attaching files (images and text), and having group chats.

3. You've been hired to build an image-sharing app where people can recommend products to each other. Describe and defend the technology you would use, including a front-end app and a back-end server system.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Software Developer Role at Tweepsmap

column1: Are you naturally curious and love learning new things? Are you passionate about building things and finding solutions?

We are a technology startup, looking for smart software engineers who would enjoy working and growing in a fun and innovative environment. If we've sparked your interest, you may be the one we are looking for!

We are a team of thinkers and makers, serial entrepreneurs with experience building multiple startups. We approach work with a passion to do things the right way. Our clients don't think of us as vendors but as partners throughout their digital journey.  Tweepsmap is based in Toronto and serve 2 million users worldwide.

This role is remote which is ideal for self-starters who want some flexibility in their work schedule...no 9-5 for you!  Of course, there are some core hours to be available, but you can work at your preferred time...early riser? Not a morning person?","Position Overview:
In this role, you will get hands on experience working alongside our senior engineers to build important components of our software, and you will get to see your work used by millions of people.

You will get exposure to a very wide range of technologies including cloud computing, algorithms, AI, front end (HTML, JavaScript, CSS, AJAX, MVC, ASP.Net), backend (web services, SOA, Queues, API integrations, Load balancers), different database technologies including SQL Server, Redis, Elastic Search, Azure Storage, Cosmos DB. We use all the major cloud computing infrastructures: Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud and IBM Watson.","Skill Requirements:
Ability to work independently, learn quickly and not be afraid to ask for help
Knowledge of C# or other object-oriented languages
Creative and eager to solve problems
Nice-to-have:
Experience or knowledge in web development
Algorithms and predictive analytic experience","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,TY Peak Excel Accounting & Tax Inc,Divisional Office,2,Open for Applications,North York,Junior, Intermediate",20,"

column8: ,4 month work term,A Tax Preparer is hired by both businesses and individuals to assist in preparing and filing tax returns and financial documents. A Tax Preparer is generally well-educated about the current legal requirements for various forms and understands the steps necessary to submit the information correctly the first time.

column1: A Bookkeeper is responsible for recording and maintaining a business' financial transactions, such as purchases, expenses, sales revenue, invoices, and payments. The bookkeeper will record financial data into general ledgers, which are used to produce the balance sheet and income statement.","A Bookkeeper's responsibilities:
Processing accounts payable and accounts receivable
Managing bank and general ledger reconciliations, as well as payroll processing
Performing month-end closings
Tracking fixed assets and preparing depreciation schedules
Supervising accounting clerks and junior bookkeepers
Preparing the trial balance
Tax Preparer Responsibilities:
Setting up meetings with clients.
Advising clients about the tax preparation process.
Preparing and submitting tax returns for clients.
Handling communication from clients and tax authorities.
Auditing all tax forms for completeness and accuracy.
Providing future tax planning to clients.
Securing repeat business and expanding the client base.
Analyzing tax data submitted by the client to maximize the outcome for the client.
Signing income tax returns on behalf of individual and business clients.","Required skills and qualifications:
Being attentive and detail-oriented to ensure accurate calculations and to avoid errors
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to use deductive reasoning to identify or determine if the client qualifies for credits or deductions
Excellent analytical skills for solving mathematical problems
Good customer service skills
Proficiency in related software including Microsoft Excel and Word
Ability to use tax preparation software
Excellent decision-making skills and sound judgment capabilities","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world.","About the Role

column1: As a software engineer intern, you'll have a direct impact on the customer experience for riders, drivers, eaters, restaurant and business owners, and cities alike. Do you like our services and want to bring them to the next level? Do you enjoy working in a team-based environment that executes at a fast pace? Are you interested in working on products that impact millions of people around the globe?
Then you should apply to join our team. We are passionate, engaged, and excited about cracking the code on urban mobility.","Basic Qualifications
Actively pursuing a Bachelor's, or Master's in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline with at least one remaining semester of school left after completion of the internship
Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated software engineering experience through previous internships, work experience, coding competitions, and/or publications
Programming experience one or more application or systems languages (Go, Python, Ruby, Java, C/C++, etc)
Experience building tools/infrastructure
A desire to be part of a team that delivers impactful results every day
A commitment to writing understandable, maintainable, and reusable software
An innate desire to deliver and a strong sense of accountability for your work
Willingness to learn new languages and methodologies

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,Our Mission

column1: Ubisoft is committed to enriching players' lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. We create worlds where people can express themselves, explore, and discover new possibilities.

Ubisoft Toronto was founded in 2010 and has contributed to many award-winning Ubisoft brands including Assassin's Creed®, Far Cry®, For HonorTM, Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell®, and Watch Dogs®. In 2018, the team at Ubisoft Toronto developed its first new IP, Starlink: Battle for Atlas, and is leading the development of Watch Dogs: Legion. Ubisoft Toronto is one of Canada's Top Employers for Young People in 2020.

Are you looking to work with enthusiastic experts who are tackling game-changing challenges in entertainment and beyond? At Ubisoft, we offer an open environment where bright ideas have a chance to shine and everyone is eager to share knowledge.

Challenge accepted? Join us and Create the Unknown.","The position of performance capture intern/co-op (systems engineering) is an opportunity to learn about and develop the skills needed to work in the growing field of performance capture and virtual production. As part of the stage team, you will work closely with our motion capture technicians to support performance capture shoots and 3D scanning sessions. Between shoots, you will be assisting the team in the development of new tools and hardware as well as maintaining the existing technology required to make shoot days go smoothly.
Type of Position: Full time, paid internship
Length of Internship: 8 to 12 months
Start: Jan 2022
Day in the life:

Design, maintain and use complex computer systems, motion capture hardware, facial capture systems, video cameras, broadcast electronics, timing devices, and audio equipment to capture human/animal/object performances.
Tasks surrounding the day-to-day maintenance of a busy production studio.
Assist with ongoing R&D projects.

Setup, maintain and capture using our DSLR 3d scanning systems.","Working toward a degree/diploma/certification in: Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering Technology, Broadcast Engineering, Electronics System Engineering, Systems Design Engineering, Film and Television Production, New Media, Cinematography, Computer Science, VFX or 3D Animation/Modelling.
Understanding of digital video, networking, audio, video streaming, timecode and/or genlock.
Troubleshooting skills.
Competency with Windows operating systems and familiarity with Linux
Some experience in a production environment.
Some knowledge of the following programming languages: Python, C++ or C#
A passion for lifelong learning.
Working Knowledge of Game Engines, specifically Virtual Cinematography and/or willingness to learn.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Autonomous and resourceful.
Ability to take initiative.
Attention to detail.
Flexibility in work organization.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work as part of a team.
Ability to adapt to change.
Results-oriented.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,UBS,Toronto,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate",23,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Your team You'll be working as part of our Wealth Management Team in Toronto, Canada. We tailor custom wealth management and investment solutions based on our client's monetary requirements. We seek to understand our client's objectives and make suggestions on how best to achieve their money management goals. We produce world-class research to help make recommendations on how to maintain our client's current financial success, and ideas for future wealth creation strategies.","Your role

column1: ?Are you a detail-oriented multitasker? Do you know how to make sure things run smoothly? We're looking for someone like that who can provide administrative support to the Wealth Management team. In this role you'll:

prepare and enter data into wealth plans and track their progress take care of settlement of accounts, processing invoices and expenses, printing and mailing cheques to employees and vendors, conducting cheque runs twice a month and preparing cheque log for sign off
assist with compliance reports, including daily trade reports and consolidation on a quarterly basis
provide organizational support for Finance and Product departments, including preparing boxes for offsite storage and ordering cheques
administer filing systems, including the filing of invoices and journal entries

coordinate various internal communications material, such as preparing daily and quarterly reports and minutes for weekly Finance meetings and tracking action items, training material on T&E claim form, quarterly expense accrual message

column8: ,4 month work term,Uken has an opportunity for an Associate Product Manager placement for the upcoming coop session. The Associate Product Manager will help support the creative vision and quality of the game as set by the Product Manager and game team. This role may work from home or in the office pending Covid-19 guidelines.

column1: About Uken

We build fun social and mobile games that make people stare, smile, jump, and feel awesome inside. We have a quirky nerdy culture that fosters creativity, collaboration, quality ideas, and a data driven mindset. We believe in moving quickly and improving constantly and that mantra is reflected in the weekly updates we make to our games and internal technologies. We have an appetite for pushing technical boundaries and we've done exactly that with Unity. We work on products that are used by millions of people everywhere and we're just getting started.

Uken welcomes applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups, and others who would contribute to the further diversification of our team.

Uken is committed to offering reasonable accommodation to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at jobs@uken.com","You will be working on:
-Assisting the PM to generate and prioritize ideas that create amazing player experiences
-Collaborating with team members to implement and iterate on game features and game vision
-Gathering player feedback and analytics to be used in product decisions
-Monitoring key game metrics to be used in product/design decisions","Your background should include:
-Strong data analysis skills using Excel, SQL
-Outstanding written/oral, organizational and time management skills
-Previous startup experience is desirable, and comfort in an agile environment
-Passion for games, up to date on tech and trends in the games industry
-An appetite to learn, grow, and take on increasingly more responsibility
-A strong desire to build something that players will enjoy for years","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The TechStar Internship Program is a hands-on software engineering program that offers you the opportunity to jump start your career at a top-ranked technology company. Our TechStar program is not your average internship experience - you will be working alongside some of the most talented engineers in the industry doing the same work they do, with daily mentoring and code reviews. Our interns write and test production-level code and are critical in helping our engineering organization achieve their deliverables.

column1: Here at UKG (Previously Ultimate Software), Our Purpose Is People. UKG combines the strength and innovation of Ultimate Software and Kronos, uniting two award-winning, employee-centered cultures. Our employees are an extraordinary group of talented, energetic, and innovative people who care about more than just work. We strive to create a culture of belonging and an employee experience that empowers our people. UKG has more than 13,000 employees around the globe and is known for its inclusive workplace culture. Ready to be inspired?","As a TechStar Software Engineer Intern you will be expected to :
Help develop cutting-edge solutions to maximize performance, scalability, and distributed processing capabilities of our cloud-based products
Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software applications at the enterprise level
Use a variety of tools including industry standard Big Data platforms and Web Frameworks such as Java, Python, JavaScript, SQL, etc.

Use cutting edge agile software development methodologies such as Kanban, Test Driven Development, Pair Programming, Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment","Proven knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming, Data Structures, and Algorithms
Ability to code in a functional or object-oriented programming language
Additional Qualifications
Strong candidates must also possess :
Strong problem-solving skills
A team player mentality
Passion for technology
Drive to learn and grow

This job description has been written to provide an accurate reflection of the current job and to include the general nature of work performed. It is not designed to contain a comprehensive detailed inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employees assigned to the job. Management reserves the right to revise the job or require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,We are looking for a DevOps Intern Engineer to contribute to development of our pipelines, tools and services that support our public cloud offering. Use tools such as Concourse and Spinnaker to deliver applications to multiple environments including local and cloud deployed platforms.

Monitor pipelines for optimal operation and performance
Review and approve PR's for submitted code
Strive to reduce complex environments and designs to clean and simple implementations
Communicate with team members to clarify requirements and overcome obstacles to meet the team goals

column1: ,University Health Network,Centre for Global eHealth Innovation,2,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate",16,"

column8: ,4 month work term,eHealth Innovation is a group of biomedical engineers, computer scientists and hardware designers dedicated to developing technology that connect patients with healthcare providers and improve their lives. As a part of University Health Network, we are a part of one of the largest medical research centres in North America. We have good results. For example, our applications have been shown to significantly improve heart failure outcomes in patients with Congestive Heart Failure. In another we've demonstrated a 10 point drop in blood pressure for hypertensive patients. We also develop products in the areas of diabetes, asthma, chronic pain, juvenile arthritis, and prostate cancer.

column1: Our team is smart, ambitious and passionate, and our work is driven by the desire to improve patients lives. Being in a research environment, we are able to concentrate on this goal without being distracted by short term profit motives, or keeping investors happy. Every member of our tightly knit development team has full input into every stage of project architecture, design and implementation. We own our projects and build apps that have real, meaningful and measurable impact on sick people's lives.

We are looking for a software development QA tester to join the team, with a passion and thoroughness for the work. The QA tester will work with our software development teams and perform manual and automated testing to check for product quality. You will be responsible for reporting any bugs and helping the team troubleshoot and debug any issues to ensure that our products meet requirements and work as expected.","Key job responsibilities include:
- Implementing and executing test plans.
- Tracking quality assurance metrics and ensuring the products run as they should
- Fully appreciating and understanding the context of use (persons who live with complex chronic conditions or clinicians during a packed clinic day) and anticipate issues in flows.
- Being familiar with the product design and its objectives.
- Generating reports and logging bugs in detail
- Reporting any problems or issues with the performance of the product to the Project Manager.
- Following the QMS system in place for medical devices","The ideal candidate for this position would:
- Have knowledge in software/technology related field
- Have strong familiarity with web and mobile device technologies, browsers and operating systems
- Have strong attention to detail and documentation practice
- Be goal-oriented and focused
- Possess good judgment and decision-making skills.
- Think outside the box and come up with use cases that may not be as obvious
- Have ability to communicate to individuals with technical and non-technical knowledge
- Experience working in healthcare system is an asset, but not required","Targeted Clusters

column1: The DevOps Engineer Assistant will work under the supervision of the IT manager and software developers and will focus on maximizing efficiency of developers, implementing new Continous Integration and Continous Deployment features and minimizing downtime for our end users.","The DevOps Engineer Assistant will work under the supervision of the IT manager. Key responsibilities include:

column1: ,University Health Network,Digital,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",3,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The DATA team is a research lab located within the University Health Network, the largest health research organization in North America. The DATA team aims to enable better and faster medicine through use of smarter computer tools. We create cutting-edge web and mobile applications, programs and databases for large-scale data collection and analytics.

column1: Headquartered within the DATA team, CanDIG (Canada's Distributed Infrastructure for Genomics) is a team building a national federated platform for connecting private health research data. We have team members across Canada building the platform and working with physicians and data custodians assembling the health data it supports.

UHN CanDIG co-op trainees work on real code that ships and becomes part of or supports the national platform and data analysis efforts.  Trainees will be active members of the team, participating in standups, having weekly one-on-ones with their mentor, will have an onboarding buddy and one or more well-defined projects.  It's not unusual for co-op students to attend local or virtual conferences (we are members of the GA4GH international standards organization, and part of the CINECA international health data federation project) and co-op students occasionally get their names on research papers.  Previous co-op students have worked on back-end data services in Python or go, front-end services in React, data analysis, data warehouse/ETL pipelines, devops work in deployment or automation, and authentication and authorization services. Co-op students are encouraged to learn new technologies, and work independently but with the support of an entire team.

A quote from our most recent co-op: ""From the various projects that I worked on I was able to learn about building ETL and CI/CD pipelines, working with various APIs, as well as backend development with Linux. The entire team was extremely welcoming and helpful, and offered me great support throughout the term.""","We are seeking a highly motivated trainee to help us expand the CanDIG platform and assemble the health research data we are connecting with the platform.
The successful candidate will work closely with scientists, researchers and software developers to develop and customize software, and be an active part of our development or deployment teams.
Because the CanDIG project is broad, there are a number of areas that a trainee joining us could work in. They could involve:
Development of backend services, supporting ReST and/or GraphQL APIs, in Python or Go
Data modelling or database work, typically with relational databases (although there's some MongoDB and ElasticSearch)
Work on our authentication and authorization and security infrastructure, particularly around monitoring and analysis of logs
Development of rich frontend visualization for complex data
Work on our deployment infrastructure - docker, docker swarm, ansible, terraform, and automation thereof
We don't expect deep knowledge in those areas for incoming trainees; only some related experience. Most importantly,  a willingness to learn independently with support.

We will continue to be hiring remotely within Canada during the pandemic. To optimize remote learning, we have greatly improved our co-op onboarding process.","Co-ops who have been most successful with us have been those who have some existing software development or deployment skills in a related area, are excited about quickly adapting to new skills, and are willing to contact team members with questions once they've tried answering the question themselves. We value having a very diverse team in a number of different respects, and are looking for co-ops who value all dimensions of that diversity.

We don't require deep expertise in particular technical skills, but in our experience we'll have a better opportunity matching you with projects you'll be able to succeed at during a co-op term if you have experience with a couple of the following:
Implementing client or server for an API, either REST or GraphQL
Data modelling or improving performance of database queries (any database)
Transforming or analyzing tabular data
Automation and orchestration of workflows
Can write simple bash (or other linux shell) scripts for automation of collections of tasks

Currently fluent enough with at least one of Python, JS, or Go to be able to propose a simple change for a simple functionality improvement to some code, and to offer a respectful code review of such a change
Any of the following would be bonuses but are not necessary:
Using OAuth2/OIDC authentication, or any kind of security work
Experience with docker or docker-compose
Previous work with bioinformatics tools or health research data
More advanced bash, python, JS, Go, or bash/linux skills
More advanced database experience

Effective Sept 2021, new UHN employees will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 before starting their job.  The only exemption is on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.","Targeted Clusters

Our work focuses on the capture of data from clinical encounters, using both advanced User Interfaces and mining of unstructured data ( using machine learning), the analysis of omics data (genome, transcriptome, epigenome), and the development of clinician and patient portals to ease the discovery and analysis of large-scale data.","We are seeking a highly motivated trainee to work on the cutting edge of software development including areas of web development, scripting, statistics, data science and more.

column1: ,University Health Network,Digital,20,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",10,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,University Health Network (UHN) is Canada's largest academic health sciences center and is affiliated with the University of Toronto. Building on the strengths and successes of our four remarkable hospitals, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Hospital and Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, UHN brings together new tools, technologies and talent to make us an international leader in healthcare and the ideal place to build your career. For more information on UHN, visit www.uhn.ca.

column1: Brief Description of Practicum Project:

UHN is embarking on a digital clinical transformation with the implementation of a new HIS (Epic). The project, termed Synapse, will require support in a number of work streams. The successful candidate will provide support to the project team in areas of technical walkthrough, administrative tasks, training, and general project support.
Brief Description of the Project: https://www.uhn.ca/corporate/AboutUHN/Digital/Synapse
Worksite Location and Conditions:

A mix of onsite (if appropriate) at Atrium on Bay alongside the UHN Synapse Project team, clinical areas, and virtual remote. Standard office conditions - most work will be conducted on a laptop and requires engagement with project management, project leadership, clinical and administrative stakeholders.
We adhere to COVID protocols, everyone must wear a mask, all students must be double vaccinated prior to starting work with us.","Responsibilities:
The main activities involved in the co-op work term can include, but are not limited to:
• Participate in physical walkthroughs of various clinical sites to ensure hardware resources are ready for launch
• Provide 'elbow support' to end users during the training and go-live phases of the project
• Support basic system troubleshooting in clinical settings
• Support project analyst with planning and project management activities
• Attend meetings with clinical and administrative stakeholders
• Attend project meetings on a weekly basis and create minutes and agenda items
• Coordinate follow-ups with cross-functional teams
• Develop presentation materials for various teams
Learning Outcomes/Goals:
• Experience working in a fast pace healthcare setting, implementing innovative technology
• Increase knowledge of project management and coordination
• Increase experience working with cross-functional teams
• Increase experience with specific healthcare technology software
• Increase experience in audience-appropriate communication to cross-functional teams with range of learning styles","Qualifications/Competencies Required:

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term required,THE OPPORTUNITY

column1: The CAD/Space Project Co-Op Student will have the opportunity to learn about how space planning and project management takes place in dynamic research environments within the healthcare industry.
BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION:

As a teaching hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto, University Health Network (UHN) engages in the full spectrum of healthcare, teaching and research. UHN is comprised of 3 hospitals, Toronto Western Hospital, Toronto General Hospital, and Princess Margaret Cancer Centre; 2 Research Facilities, Krembil Discovery Tower and Princess Margaret Cancer Research Tower; 4 Toronto Rehab Institute locations, and the Michener Institute of Education. These are large, multi-use, energy intensive buildings. Over 16,000 people work at UHN, including physicians, nurses, researchers, allied health professionals, administration, support services, educators, and IT staff.","YOUR ROLE

Provide support to the department on research infrastructure-related projects (includes space planning, furniture and equipment layouts, feasibility initiatives, client consultations, site evaluations, spatial data extraction, etc.)
New Project Opportunities (includes creating various types of spatial report packages such as fire and life safety, operations and security, and biosafety containment allocations.)

Maintain and improve upon existing standards and processes within the Department (includes organizing department's CAD drawings, updating floor plans to reflect spatial changes, integrating as-built drawings from new construction and renovation projects into the master database, etc.)
Participate in physical walkthroughs and audits of research spaces.","WHAT YOU BRING
Proficient in computer software tools such as AutoCAD, Microsoft Office and Adobe Creative Suite (specifically Illustrator and InDesign)
Highly organized
Strong communication skills (verbal and written)
Good understanding of project management","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term required,WHO WE ARE:

column1: The Familial Cancer Clinic at Princess Margaret Cancer Centre provides genetic counselling and risk assessment services to families who have an increased risk of cancer due to hereditary factors.
Visit our website: genetics.theprincessmargaret.ca
THE OPPORTUNITY:

We are seeking a highly motivated Genetic Counselling Assistant to work with our team of genetic counsellors, administrative assistants, and geneticist.  The successful candidate will interact with patients, learn the day-to-day duties of a cancer genetic counsellor and assist in administrative and technical duties.

Specifically, the genetic counselling assistant will aid clinic staff by creating and updating family pedigrees, preparing patient files, running risk assessment software, liaising with other clinics and laboratories, coordinating the work of clinic volunteers, and assisting with other projects.

Learning opportunities include the ability to attend weekly educational lectures and meetings addressing topics such as genetics, genetic counselling and cancer genetics, as well as the opportunity to observe genetics consultations.
The genetic counselling assistant may also have the opportunity to participate in patient recruitment, data analysis or manuscript preparation for ongoing research studies.","YOUR ROLE:
1. Elicit, update and create patient pedigrees for genetic counsellors.
2. Prepare patient charts, collect relevant medical records for accurate assessment of a patient's family members, schedule appointments and perform essential administrative tasks.
3. Learn how to use risk model software systems to accurately generate risk profiles for patients.
4. Observe genetic counselling sessions and genetics consultations for hereditary cancer syndromes.
5. Liaise with other clinics and laboratories to coordinate patient care.","WHAT YOU BRING:
1. Excellent communication skills and confidence to communicate with patients.
2. Excellent time management and prioritization skills with the ability to manage and follow-up on multiple tasks.
3. Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.
4. Interest in pursuing a career in human genetics.
5. Completed or currently taking a course in genetics with a minimum grade of 75% (i.e. BIOL 239).","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University Health Network,Toronto Rehabilitation Institute,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",18,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Safe Independent Mobility Lab at the Toronto Rehabilitation Institute invites applications to the position of Research Assistant.  The successful candidate will join a research team led by Dr Avril Mansfield (Toronto Rehabilitation Institute & University of Toronto).  Funding support comes from a variety of sources, such as the Canadian Institutes of Health Research, the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada, and the Heart and Stroke Foundation.

column1: The Safe Independent Mobility Lab develops therapeutic techniques to improve people's mobility and reduce the risk of falling.  Researchers are devising new training programs to improve health among those with neurological injury.  They are developing new technology to assess and diagnose mobility challenges outside the lab in the 'real world'.  Another area of activity involves creating improved and standardized tools for clinicians to assess patients' mobility.

For more information on our current research, please visit simbl-to.org.","The Research Assistant will be primarily responsible for assisting staff, post-doctoral fellows, and graduate students with the conduct of ongoing studies aimed and understanding control and adaptation of balance and mobility healthy and patient populations. Specific duties include assisting with data collection and processing, data entry, and assisting with literature reviews. Other duties may include assisting with administrative tasks, including literature searches and grant applications. There is an opportunity for motivated students to conduct an independent research project.","Candidates for this position should be enthusiastic, eager to learn, flexible, and comfortable working with human research participants. This position would be ideally suited to a student interested in pursuing a career in health research, healthcare, rehabilitation sciences, or physiotherapy.  We are looking for someone who is both a team player and who is also self-directed to work independently. Current CPR is required, and some knowledge of exercise and sensorimotor physiology, statistics and research design would be an asset. Basic skills in exercise testing and understanding of electromyography, kinematics and motion analysis would also be beneficial. The successful candidate will be required to complete a Criminal Reference Check and Occupational Health screening prior to the start date.","Targeted Clusters
