column1: ,University of British Columbia,Department of Surgery,1,Open for Applications,Vancouver,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",14,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Breast Reconstruction Program in the Division of Plastic Surgery at UBC focusses on research that aims to improve the health and quality of care for women undergoing breast reconstruction in British Columbia.

column1: Breast cancer is one of the most common disease cancers affecting Canadian women. The Canadian Cancer Society estimates that 1 in 8 Canadian women will develop breast cancer in their lifetime. Treatment for breast cancer necessitates a partial or total mastectomy and about 30% of women choose to have immediate breast reconstruction. Implant-based (alloplastic) breast reconstruction is the most common form of breast restoration in North America. The Breast Reconstruction Program at UBC is conducting a prospective cohort study seeking to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of alloplastic breast reconstruction. In addition to this prospective database, the Breast Reconstruction program is coordinating several other research studies, including randomized controlled trials, survey studies and retrospective reviews of medical charts, that are centered around investigating ways to improve the health and quality of care for patients undergoing breast reconstruction. Some of these studies are focussed on health policy and public health, specifically on cost utility and effectiveness. Other studies are focussed on the development of new health technologies, integrating health management with technology between patients, providers and hospitals.

The research assistant will work in a multidisciplinary team of surgeons, clinical researchers and medical students. They will be directly supervised by a plastic surgeon and a clinical research coordinator. This will give the student opportunities to meet with leaders in scientific research and healthcare clinicians, supporting a future professional network and potential references for graduate school applications or career opportunities.

The research assistant will receive a one-on-one orientation from their supervisor including an overview of the UBC Breast Reconstruction Program and role specific training on the project and job specific roles/ responsibilities. In addition, the student will complete mandatory formal online trainings on privacy and confidentiality and clinical research ethics (VCH/PHC Privacy and Confidentiality and TCPS2).

The student will have ongoing opportunities for communication and feedback with their supervisor and team members. The student will meet weekly with their supervisor where they will have the opportunity to present an update on their work and ask questions. In between meetings, students will have access to their supervisor and team members via email and instant messaging platform (Slack).

The student will have the opportunity to formally and informally present to team members and other stake holders on the progress of their work; this will help them develop presentation and communications skills and complement classroom learning about research communication.

This co-op position will provide the student the opportunity to work and collaborate within a multidisciplinary team, expand their knowledge of clinical research methods and insight into the field of medical and health research.","The research student will contribute to data collection, data monitoring and coordinating participant recruitment for our prospective database on alloplastic breast reconstruction. In addition, the research student may assist with other projects in the scope of the UBC Breast Reconstruction Program. Some tasks include contacting study participants, obtaining informed consent, chart review, preparing study packages. This position requires communications skills, attention to detail, accuracy, confidentiality, organization and the ability to work on several projects concurrently.","SKILLS/ KNOWLEDGE:
Computer literacy (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Experience using REDCap data management software is an asset
Familiarity with literature database searching (Pubmed, Ovid, Ebscohost) is an asset
Familiarity with reference management (Mendeley or similar) is an asset
Experience in clinical research and working with clinical populations is an asset
Experience writing research ethics board (REB) applications is an asset
Excellent communication (oral and written), and interpersonal skills
Superior organization, time-management, initiative and multitasking
Ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment
Experience in working in a research environment is an asset
Familiarity with medical terminology is an asset","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Positions are available in the Micro Engineering Dynamics Automation Lab (MEDAL) at the University of Calgary for co-op students to join an interdisciplinary team developing and testing novel sensors, nano materials, magnetic sensors, wearable devices, MEMS, nanocomposites, etc. Specifically, the researcher will be responsible for development of wearable devices, flexible batteries and novel sensors for monitoring applications.  The researchers would work in following topics (combination of one or more):

column1: a.  Wearable Devices - programming in Java and C for Android and IOS platforms for communicating with sensors and smart devices, sensor & circuit developments, electronics, fabrication, and testing
b.  Magnetic Sensor and Defect Detections -  developing new magnetic devices, prototyping, testing, programming (Matlab), reporting
c.  Nano Sensors and Material testing -  experimental tests, fabrication, use of characterization devices.  Gas chromatography, Raman spectroscopy, Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy, etc.

Looking for chemical or nano engineering students.","The work will also involve with development, design, fabrication, programming, electronic circuits, testing, and micro/nano engineering aspects and possibly collaborating with a company and other researchers.","The successful candidates must have a proven track record of success and be able to conduct research independently as well as part of a team. Good oral and written communication skills are essential. Electronics and programming skills are assets.

column1: ,University of Calgary,McCaig Institute for Bone and Joint Health,1,Open for Applications,Calgary,Junior, Intermediate",12,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic autoimmune disease that primarily affects the small joints of the hands, wrists, and feet. Swelling and bone damage can be significant and affect a person's ability to perform daily activities. Our lab aims to better understand the development and progression of bone damage in arthritis. We use multi-modal imaging, including high resolution computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and ultrasound to quantify the changes that occur in an individual over time. One feature that changes rapidly are erosions that occur in the joint, and can be observed with CT. We have existing image processing tools to register and align images, as well as sensitively quantify changes and erosive damage. However, currently, these tools are only available in a variety of software packages and require frequent file type conversion.

column1: The aim of this project is to add modules to software platform previously developed in an open-source image processing (3D Slicer) that includes tools for image registration, segmentation and feature extraction/quantification such as erosions in multi-modal imaging in rheumatoid arthritis applications. Development will be done using 3D Slicer and Python (ITK, VTK) toolkits in the underlying framework.

The student will work in a research lab environment (https://cumming.ucalgary.ca/labs/manske/) and have the opportunity to interact with graduate students and post-doctoral fellows, and take part in trainee activities within the McCaig Institute for Bone and Joint Health (including weekly seminar series, career development opportunities). The student may have the opportunity to contribute to scientific publications (e.g., conference abstracts, manuscripts). In addition, the quantitative tools developed here will be shared with an international collaboration (SPECTRA - Study group for xtReme-Computed Tomography in RA; https://www.spectra-collab.org/home).","Work alongside a PhD student (Biomedical Engineering; BSc Electrical Engineering) to carry-out the day to day tasks, supervised by the Principal Investigator (Image Science, Department of Radiology) and Co-Investigator (Software Engineering, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering).
Develop Python-based image processing tools in 3D Slicer.
Assist with image analysis, including validity and reproducibility analysis.
Communicate results through good written documentation and oral presentation.","Experience with software development preferably using Python.
Familiarity with git, github and good documentation practices.
Previous experience with image processing is an asset.
Creativity and willingness to exchange ideas with others.
Ability to work independently with little supervision, as well as in a team.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University of Guelph,Department of Physics,1,Open for Applications,Guelph,Intermediate,7,

column8: ,4 month work term,The project is part of a collaboration between the Dutcher Lab at the University of Guelph and PexCor, a Calgary-based company. In this project, the objective is to understand changes that occur in cross-linked polyethylene (PEX-a) pipes when they are used in domestic and industrial plumbing and heating applications. To do so, we use infrared microscopy and machine learning approaches to understand changes to the pipe properties with in-service use.

column1: Dutcher Lab: https://www.physics.uoguelph.ca/dutcher-lab","The student will perform accelerated ageing experiments on PEX-a pipes by circulating water at elevated temperature and pressure through the pipes. At periodic intervals, the student will remove part of the pipe and use infrared (IR) microscopy to monitor molecular vibrations associated with different chemical groups present in the pipes. The student will also be directly involved with the analysis of the IR data, using principal component analysis (PCA) and machine learning techniques to analyze and track ageing pathways.","The following skills are required:
1) excellent lab skills with experience in using sophisticated instrumentation
2) experience in Python programming
3) critical thought and problem solving skills","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University of Ottawa,Department of Physics,1,Open for Applications,Ottawa,Intermediate, Senior",3,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,The Department of Physics at the University of Ottawa has recently commissioned a state-of-the-art Nonlinear Optical Microscopy Laser Laboratory. We are seeking a talented and ambitious Coop Student to work on a project in Machine Learning applied to nonlinear optical microscopy/imaging based on ultrafast (femtosecond) lasers. In a world-wide first, we aim to develop a ""smart"" microscope which can self-optimize for a given sample.

column1: Our multimodal imaging techniques focus on nonlinear optical microscopies, specifically Coherent Raman Microscopy. Importantly, this ultrafast laser-based technique allows for label-free yet material-specific imaging with high spatial and temporal resolution. We apply these to a range of imaging problems in Materials Science, Biomedicine, and Geology/Earth Sciences. The varied and potentially complex nature of the samples and their nonlinear optical response provides an exciting test bed for the development of new AI tools for real-time label-free imaging of materials and the correlated design of novel optical imaging techniques guided by these AI tools.","In this Co-op position you will work on developing an automated ""smart"" optical microscope which can self-optimize for different samples. This necessitates systems which are flexible, robust and optimize use of limited data bandwidth. By automating processes and using Machine Learning to enhance process flow, we aim to improve system performance and increase the range of applications that can be addressed with advanced optical imaging techniques.
In this role, you will:
Design feedback control systems which incorporate image processing and feedback from Deep Learning control algorithms
Develop tools for integrating diverse components using hardware and/or software control
Work with advanced scientific equipment including ultrafast lasers, nonlinear optical microscopes, and devices for manipulating light
Work with researchers in Ultrafast Lasers, Machine Learning, Material Science and Biomedical Imaging.","Essential (required) Experience:
Coding experience in Python (intermediate to advanced level)
Experience working in a Linux environment (intermediate level)
Desirable Experience:
Experience using Deep Learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Pytorch)
Ideal Experience:
Experience implementing and working with active learning and reinforcement learning algorithms
Experience with automation, electronic control, feedback, embedded systems, or digital processing","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University of Ottawa,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Ottawa,Senior,0,

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,C++ Developer for the Open-Source OpenSim Biomechanics Simulator

column1: OpenSim (https://opensim.stanford.edu/) is an open-source software platform for modelling musculoskeletal systems and generating simulations of human and animal movement. The first version of OpenSim was developed at Stanford University; it is now an open-source project that is used by thousands of researchers, clinicians, and roboticists worldwide. Your contributions to this project will benefit nearly every user of the software. This work is a high priority for the OpenSim team and it will have a large positive impact on the field.

The objective of this project is to automate model calibration, the procedure by which a musculoskeletal model is adjusted to match the dimensions of a human subject---a notoriously difficult process for new OpenSim users. The ideal candidate will have expertise in designing and developing well-organized, well-documented C++ code; familiarity with biomechanics and optimization would be assets but are not essential. You will work closely with Prof. Uchida at uOttawa (https://www.thomasuchida.com/) and coordinate with others on the OpenSim Development Team at Stanford University and Delft University of Technology. You will design, develop, test, and document a new optimization strategy to produce better OpenSim models in less time than the current outdated tools, making OpenSim's capabilities available to a broader community of users. Prototype code has been developed and will be provided as a starting point.

This project is funded by the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative's Essential Open Source Software for Science Program (https://chanzuckerberg.com/eoss/proposals/automated-optimal-model-calibration-for-the-opensim-biomechanics-simulator/). You will have the opportunity to engage with the other teams funded by this program, as well as the researchers working on Prof. Uchida's team. Some additional information about the project can be found here: https://engineering.uottawa.ca/professor-uchida-and-czi-funding-open-source-software-moving-toward-success.","You will first learn about the objectives of the project, the OpenSim API (https://simtk.org/api_docs/opensim/api_docs/), and the prototype code that has been developed. You will then design and implement a model calibration tool in C++ that adheres to the OpenSim coding standards, build test cases to verify the implementation, write doxygen documentation for programmers and scripting users, and integrate the implementation into the OpenSim codebase on GitHub (https://github.com/opensim-org/opensim-core). You will work with the developers at Stanford to design the interface and plan a series of design reviews accompanied by GitHub Pull Requests to ensure a smooth integration process.

You will lead and manage the project, meeting with Prof. Uchida at least once per week. You will also attend and provide updates at Prof. Uchida's Research Team meetings (once per month) and OpenSim Developer Team meetings hosted by the team at Stanford (approx. every 2 months).","Required:
C++ design and development
Doxygen documentation
Project management
Self-directed learning
Comfortable working in a research environment
Familiarity with or interest in learning:
Biomechanics (kinematics, motion capture, etc.)
Optimization
Git and GitHub","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,ABOUT THE OFFICE OF ADVANCEMENT

column1: The Office of Advancement's mission is to inspire and engage people in philanthropy to advance the University of Waterloo in becoming one of the world's top innovation universities.

Led by the Vice-President, Advancement, the Office of Advancement is organized across six functional areas: Development & Alumni Relations, Faculty Advancement teams, Advancement Strategy, and Advancement Services. In addition, the Office of Advancement operates in close partnership with the advancement functions in each of its affiliated and federated Institutions (university colleges).
For more information about the Office of Advancement, please visit www.uwaterloo.ca/support
IS THIS JOB RIGHT FOR YOU?

Would learning the fundamentals of fundraising and donor communications benefit your academic and career goals?  Do you plan to pursue a career in fund raising or not-for-profit work?  Are you comfortable working within a team setting?  Would you feel confident in being responsible for managing your own tasks and projects?
If the skills required, job tasks and key accountabilities suit your interests and abilities, we would love to have you apply.","WHAT ARE THE JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES?
Below is a list of your accountabilities, the areas you will be responsible for managing and ensuring are carried out the best way you can.
Responsibilities

Is responsible for conducting telephone calls to secure charitable gifts from University of Waterloo alumni, parents, and friends to support university priority projects/funds
Is responsible for maintaining confidentiality and data security in compliance with all regulations
Is responsible for correctly understanding and inputting constituent and gift data
Is responsible for clearly and accurately communicating information about the University of Waterloo and its programs
Must represent the university in a courteous and professional manner","WHAT SKILLS ARE REQUIRED?

Interpersonal skills; ability to interact professionally and respectfully with colleagues, ability to work effectively and efficiently within a team setting, comfort in communicating to a variety of audiences

Led by the Vice-President, Advancement, the Office of Advancement is organized across six functional areas: Office of the Vice-President, Advancement Strategy, Alumni Relations, Advancement Services, Central Development, and Advancement Communications. In addition, the Office of Advancement operates in close partnership with the advancement functions in each of its affiliated and federated Institutions (university colleges). This role will work with the Annual Giving Team, which is part of the broader Central Development Team.
For more information about the Office of Advancement, please visit www.uwaterloo.ca/support
IS THIS JOB RIGHT FOR YOU?

Would learning the fundamentals of working within a professional office environment benefit your academic and career goals?  Do you plan to pursue a career in fund raising or business administration?  Do you want to be part of a supportive and engaging team environment?  Would you feel confident in being responsible for managing your own tasks and projects?
If the skills required, job tasks and key accountabilities suit your interests and abilities, we would love to have you apply.","WHAT ARE THE JOB RESPONSIBILITIES?
Below is a list of your job responsibilities, the areas you will be responsible for managing and ensuring are carried out the best way you can.
General Administration
Prepare for, attend, and contribute to team meetings and team projects
Assist in maintaining databases, electronic and hard copy filing systems
Maintain monthly reporting, including gathering and analyzing information from various sources and distributing reports in a timely manner
Use project management software to plan, implement and report on ongoing tasks and special projects
Provide back-up assistance to the Office of Advancement reception desk
Assist with other duties, tasks and events that support the functioning of the Annual Giving Team, and the Office of Advancement
Communication & Fundraising
Assist in drafting and finalizing communications to various internal and external stakeholders
Respond promptly and professionally to queries from colleagues, donors, alumni and friends of the university
Maintain consistent and open communication with supervisor and other colleagues
Create and send cards, post cards and letters to donors as part of a broader stewardship strategy
Communicate directly with donors through thank you phone calls
Produce, edit and deliver PowerPoint presentations
Create, edit and distribute post-event surveys
Technical Responsibilities
Maintain up-to-date information in centralized databases
Pull and analyze reports from multiple databases
Use Excel to combine and analyze data from multiple sources
Use Outlook to calendar and maintain schedules
Special Projects
Work on special projects as needed. Project areas include:
Events
Project Management
Data analysis
Administration
Co-op Student Processes
Update the student co-op handbook with new procedures, improved workflow and updated responsibilities
Help to build training resources for future co-op students","WHAT SKILLS ARE REQUIRED?
The following is a carefully designed list of skills required to successfully carry out the Development Assistant job duties:
Strong organizational skills; ability to prioritize, organize and manage multiple tasks and special projects
Self-motivation; the ability to complete tasks efficiently and remain focused
Exceptional attention to detail; proof-reading, editing, data sorting and identifying gaps in processes
Proven problem solving and critical thinking skills
Ability to write communication pieces with a professional tone, business perspective and understanding of the audience
Adaptability; ability to adjust, organize and maintain rapidly changing work priorities

Interpersonal skills; ability to interact professionally and respectfully with colleagues, ability to work effectively and efficiently within a team setting, comfort in communicating to a variety of audiences

Communication skills; professional in-person, telephone and email manner, ability to maintain open communication with supervisor and colleagues to ensure task completion and effective project management

Technical skills; experience and comfort using Microsoft Office applications, databases and other software applications, familiarity with basic office equipment (photocopier, printers, fax machine) is an asset","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Athletics and Recreation Services,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Intermediate, Senior",22,"

column8: ,4 month work term,This position is a 4 month (with a possible extension to 8 months,) 35 hour per week position, responsible to the Sr. Manager, Wellness and Active Living within the department of Athletics and Recreation.

column1: Move Your Mind is a wellness-focused service provided by Athletics and Recreation, whereby students who are struggling with their mental health are referred for physical activity. Typically, treatment for mood disorders such as anxiety and depression consists of medication and/or counselling. The purpose of this initiative is to introduce physical activity as a complementary option.  The role of the Move Your Mind Cooordinator is to meet with students who have been referred to the program, identify potential physical activities the student is interested in, and facilitate their participation by removing barriers and providing support.
The goals of this program include:
- Encourage physical activity and increase students' understanding of its importance
- Improve academic performance, social relationships, and quality of life by promoting a balanced, healthy, active lifestyle
- Use physical activity to complement existing mood disorder treatments

- To expand campus awareness of the benefits of physical activity on mental health by engaging with different wellness stakeholders (Counselling Services, Student Success Office, AccessAbility, Housing and Residence, etc)

COVID-19 Considerations: For the Winter 2022 Term, this program may consist of a combination of virtual and in person work. As the COVID-19 situation evolves, the Move Your Mind Coordinator will work with their manager to identify how Move Your Mind is facilitated, participants are best supported, and everyone's safety is put first.","Responsibilities of the Move Your Mind Coordinator include:
Program Facilitator
- primary point of contact for students being referred from physicians, counsellors, and other support staff
- receive and manage referrals
- schedule and conduct consultations
- communicate available options offered by Warrior Recreation
- support student integration into regular programming
- assist in finding an activity suitable to participants' individual interests, needs and goals
- connect referred students with the necessary information and tools to participate in chosen activities
- volunteer recruitment, training, and management
- give referred participants the option of attending activities with a peer-volunteer to help ease integration into the activity
- recruit peer-volunteers for the program, manage applications, and conduct interviews
- facilitate peer-volunteer training in collaboration Peer Mentorship Training with the Student Success Office
- coordinate volunteers and pair-up with participants based on activity interest, availability, and personality matches
- check in regularly with both participants and peer-volunteers
- adjust programming needs as necessary
- facilitate integration into regular programming and support participation in upcoming terms
- monitor past participants' participation, and follow up accordingly
- evaluate and evolve program
- maintain notes on prescribed activities and participants status in the program
- relay information on activities prescribed, progress, and experience back to Health Services when necessary
- prepare end-of-term report documenting participation metrics, observations of the program, and suggestions moving forward
Program Liaison
- advocate for the program
- communicate the purpose, philosophy, and logistics of the program with physicians, counsellors, and other stakeholders to ensure awareness and continuing referrals
- explore potential to expand the program to other areas on campus (i.e. Counselling Services prescribing, including other campus clubs and activities, et cetera)","Skills & Knowledge Required:
-familiarity with Warrior Recreation programs and facilities
-drive to facilitate a positive experience for all participants
-passion for enhancing the student experience
-understanding of the benefits of participation and physical activity
-comfortable in one-on-one communication
-self-motivated and self-directed learner
-strong administrative, organizational, and time management skills
-flexible schedule including some weekend and evening work","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Do you love social media? Do you have a knack for video editing? Do you think about what makes you stop when you're scrolling through Instagram? Campus Housing is looking for a Digital Communications Assistant to support and enhance our social media efforts, create student resources, and help promote and support the Campus Housing community.

column1: About Campus Housing:

Campus Housing is home to over 5,500 students and is the second leading housing operation in Canada. We support our incoming first-year students with guaranteed residence to help with their transition to university, while continuing to offer upper year, graduate, exchange, transfer, and family housing.","In this role, you will get to:
Write content and help create an editorial calendar for the @UWHousing Social Media accounts (Instagram and Facebook)
Be in front of the camera creating content through Instagram Stories, Reels and IGTVs and covering live events while they take place (if on-campus activities resume)
Brainstorm and help develop communication plans for the above channels
Monitor social media channels by replying to direct messages and comments
Provide email inbox support to our housing advisors by responding to inquiries
Support social media analytics reporting on a monthly basis
Provide support with website content development for student engagement
Create and edit instructional videos
Collaborate on website, photography, videography, and print communication needs
Coordinate any special projects as assigned
Work with a team of communications and marketing experts who are eager to support your professional development and help you hone your skills","You will need to:
Have a strong understanding of social media platforms and experience creating engaging social media content for Instagram and Facebook.  Bonus points if you're an Instagram story/reel master!
Have experience and a strong comfort level being in front of the camera and acting as one of the faces of our social media accounts for the term
Demonstrate writing and editing skills
Have experience or show a strong interest in photography, video filming or editing
Have experience with graphic design or visual content creation (Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, etc.)
Have excellent communication and organization skills
Have strong Microsoft Office experience
Be able to manage several projects concurrently, prioritize tasks and meet deadlines
Be self-motivated with the ability to work without regular supervision
It will be a bonus if you have:
Experience with content calendars and social campaign development
Experience with content management systems (Wordpress, Blogger, Waterloo CMS, etc.)
Experience with social influencers and understanding why/how they become influential","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Campus Wellness,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",14,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Technical Support Assistant is accountable to the IT Manager to assist with the use of technology within Campus Wellness, to facilitate implementation of new technologies to improve efficiency, connectivity, and communication in all areas of Campus Wellness. The Technical Support Assistant is responsible for a broad range of computing support in the following areas: end-user support and training, enterprise systems, desktop computing environment, computer hardware, and web applications.

column1: Level of Responsibility: Responsibility for active participation in Campus Wellness Tech Team, focusing on day-to-day smooth operation of all areas of Campus Wellness dependent on technology

Decision-Making Authority: Triage and determine the optimal course of action to solve day-to-day problems, including hardware and software issues; make decisions related to long-term issues in collaboration with IT Manager

Contacts: Internal Campus Wellness contacts: All clinical and administrative staff. External contacts: IST and enterprise systems technical personnel, faculty technical teams, software/hardware vendors

Physical and Sensory Demands: Possibility for multiple interruptions and competing priorities on a daily basis, with multiple inputs (phone, email, virtual platforms, etc.). Flexibility and responsiveness to a variety of administrative and clinical staff regarding day-to-day are required. Ample opportunity for movement within various areas in at least two on-campus buildings where Campus Wellness services are delivered, as well as online and virtual environments. Requires moderate physical demands, including frequent access to equipment, under desks, lifting and moving equipment and materials between / within buildings.

Working Environment: Exposure to conditions typical of a troubleshooting support position. Stress and pressure associated with this level of position, including the ongoing pressure of ensuring that all systems are functional at all times. Located indoors in comfortable, fast-paced office environments populated by clinical, administrative staff, as well as clients (University of Waterloo students, staff and faculty and their families). There may be unusual hours or schedules, multiple and/or tight deadlines beyond one's control and constant interruptions (e.g., phone calls, emails, unplanned but urgent support requests, etc.)","First-Tier Technology Support

Actively collaborate with Campus Wellness' Tech Team (IT Manager and Electronic Health Records Coordinator) to ensure ongoing function of 200+ computers, including associated peripherals (scanners, printers, related web applications, etc.)

Immediately assess, troubleshoot, and solve users' computer-related issues in all Campus Wellness venues, including liaising with computer support personnel in satellite venues, escalating issues to IST Client Services reps and/or IT Manager
Immediately assess and solve users' remote/virtual-related issues, using remote access tools (e.g., Bomgar) where needed, escalating issues to IST Client Services reps and/or IT Manager

Provide support for other systems (e.g., Windows, MS Office, MS Teams, Skype for Business, Google Chrome and other web browsers, Dragon NaturallySpeaking, Cisco AnyConnect, Internet/Wi-Fi connectivity, SharePoint, etc.)
Consistently contribute to Tech Team ticketing system, tracking all issues, resolutions, and feedback under direction of IT Manager
Contribute to Tech Team technology recommendations which creatively solve business issues and support client-focused service, given anticipated growth
Provide technical support for Campus Wellness events
With the goal of consistency, support Campus Wellness in standard uses of email, phones, and peripherals
Training
Provide training to Campus Wellness staff members where appropriate
Assist Tech Team in providing overall tech orientation for new Campus Wellness staff members
Assist Electronic Health Records Coordinator in limited training and maintenance tasks related to Electronic Health Records system and its associated systems (e.g., Medeo, Healthmail, Ocean)
Update online training materials in Campus Wellness' Knowledge Base for clinical and administrative staff, creating new material when necessary
Provide orientation to incoming Technical Support Assistant as needed","Experience
Previous experience in a health-related environment would be beneficial, ideally in a post-secondary context:
General technical environment knowledge, i.e., desktop computing, MS Windows, MS Office, computer hardware including printers, scanners, monitors, webcams, etc.
As this is a multi-disciplinary environment, experience training others, especially a diverse group of learners and professions is beneficial
Experience with implementation, integration, and update of enterprise systems an asset
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, including:
Exceptional customer service
Demonstrated ability to work independently, with self-motivation and minimal supervision
Demonstrated level of maturity, competence, and professionalism appropriate for interacting with interdisciplinary levels of the organization
Demonstrated ability to thrive in and contribute to an integrated and collaborative team environment and to apply a positive team approach to working with colleagues
Excellent organizational skills, including ability to handle multiple tasks, meet deadlines
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including proficiency in public/promotional speaking and the ability to write effectively in a manner consistent with university-level communications
Experience with online/virtual tools beneficial (e.g., MS Teams)
Intermediate level of proficiency in MS Windows, MS Office, Chrome and other web browsers","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Campus Wellness,3,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Junior,45,

column8: ,4 month work term,Job Summary:

column1: The Patient Flow Facilitator (PFF) is accountable to the Health Services Associate Director. The PFF is responsible for the safe and efficient movement of students within the Health Services building. The layout of the Health Services complex requires dedicated personnel to help students from the reception desk, to the waiting room(s), and into the appropriate clinical assessment rooms. The PFF must be conscientious, courteous, and respectful of student privacy pertaining to personal information and personal health information. The PFF will interact with administrative staff, nurses, nurse practitioners, physicians, mental health practitioners, other allied health providers as well as staff, students, and faculty. There are three (3) PFF positions required for each of the fall and winter terms and two for the spring term each year. These positions share responsibilities and function as an integrated team.","I.   System Navigation: Enables the smooth flow of students (walk-in or booked clients from the front desk to the waiting room and into the correct assessment room according to established procedures.

2.  Schedule Management: In collaboration with the front desk and nursing staff, PFFs will make monitor the schedules to ensure flow is maintained despite late arrivals, cancellations, or other schedule changes.

3.  Team Collaboration: As a member of the PFF team, each person is responsible to ensure appropriate coverage during the opening hours of the Clinic (8am to 8pm in the Fall and Winter Terms, and 8am to 5pm in the Spring term).  This includes team-based scheduling and equal distribution of shifts as well as absence coverage.  As part of the larger health care team, the role of the PFF is to support the clinical staff to provide timely and efficient services to students.

4.  Operational Process Review: Within the scope of the role, consults within the PFF team to bring forward recommendations to the Associate Director for improvements to operational processes.  Specifically, opportunities to improve flow, way finding, and access should be explored.

5.  Other Activities: At the request of the Associate Director, the PFF may be required to perform other activities within Health Services to enable the safe and efficient movement of students within the building.  This includes but is not limited to escorting students to other programs/buildings/faculties on campus or assisting nurses/physicians/paramedics/other staff during urgent/emergent situations.
6. Preparation of displays, resources, and information packages as well as maintain and update teaching materials/equipment and other inventory.
Level of Responsibility:
This position is responsible and accountable for the safe and efficient movement of students throughout the Health Services complex and elsewhere on campus as required.
This position has collaborative relationships with peers, staff and managers.  There are no direct reporting relationships to the PFF.","Level of Responsibility:
This position is responsible and accountable for the safe and efficient movement of students throughout the Health Services complex and elsewhere on campus as required.
This position has collaborative relationships with peers, staff and managers.  There are no direct reporting relationships to the PFF.
Decision-Making Authority:

The PFF will have some decision-making authority on operational issues that arise in the course of completing the required duties.  This may include schedule monitoring from time to time in consultation with the Associate Director.  The PFF has no direct authority over operational activity within the Campus Wellness Programs including financial or human resource decisions.
Physical and Sensory Demands:

The PFF position requires significant walking for the majority of the shift.  There is negligible computer work.  The majority of the work involves direct interaction with staff and students.  Fluency in a second language would be an asset.
Working Environment:

Exposed to stress and pressure associated with operational responsibilities.  Involves moderate psychological risk resulting from unavoidable exposure to hazardous, disagreeable or uncomfortable environmental conditions. Early morning and evening work required.  There may be unusual hours or schedules, multiple and/or tight deadlines beyond one's control, and interruptions (e.g. unplanned but urgent support requests, varying student volumes at different times of year).

Health Services opened a Covid-19 Testing and Assessment Center October 1, 2020 in response to the pandemic. If students are receptive to providing support in the protected, limited access area of this center, this will be another area that they may be able to work as desired.","Targeted Clusters

InDesign - intermediate
Illustrator - intermediate
Photoshop - basic
Camtasia - basic
Presentation software - intermediate
MS Word - intermediate

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Centre for Extended Learning,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",1,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Primary Purpose

column1: The Systems team at the Centre for Extended Learning (CEL), designs, develops, tests, implements, supports and maintains web-based enterprise business systems driving online learning at the University of Waterloo. These are functionally and technically complex systems which integrate with University-wide ERP systems such as the student information system (SIS) and the LMS. This complexity encompasses all aspects of the technical infrastructure supporting these applications' life cycles including network and operating systems layer, database layer, programming languages, delivery methods, as well as implementation and support methodologies. Reporting to a Learning Technologies Analyst (LTA) and working in conjunction with each unit in CEL as necessary, the Junior Learning Technologies Analyst will be accountable for the following:
Manage in-term technical support for students and faculty in fully online/technology-enabled courses across all departments.
Support technical operations of the online learning environments including the UW Learning Management System (LMS) and the CEL Content Management System (CMS).
Investigate suitable educational technologies during the fully online/technology-enabled course development activities.
Manages, monitors, plans and reports on hardware/software asset inventory to support management decisions and budgetary planning.

Document user manuals, training manuals and FAQ for new technologies/services and proactively update existing to ensure integrity, accuracy and relevance.","Manage in-term technical support for students and faculty in fully online/technology-enabled courses across all departments.
Support technical operations of the online learning environments including the UW Learning Management System (LMS) and the CEL Content Management System (CMS).
Investigate suitable educational technologies during the fully online/technology-enabled course development activities.
Manages, monitors, plans and reports on hardware/software asset inventory to support management decisions and budgetary planning.
Document user manuals, training manuals and FAQ for new technologies/services and proactively update existing to ensure integrity, accuracy and relevance.","Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Skills in managing course delivery using LMS/CMS.
Skills in using helpdesk software such as Request Tracker (RT), JIRA etc.
Skills in using Wiki, Confluence, Office 365 for documentation.
Experience in supporting collaboration tools (e.g. Adobe connect, Bongo), identity management tools, CRM systems and e-portfolios (e.g., PebblePad) will be highly sought after.
Experience with hardware/software setup/installation on Mac/PC will be highly sought after.
Willingness to proactively and independently learn and master new technologies in response to needs.
Awareness of the practical effectiveness and viability of educational technologies currently in the market.
Experience in using browser testing tools (e.g. BrowserStack, Cross Browser Testing, Selenium) will be a plus.
Must be a team player with superior work ethic, initiative, and the ability to work independently with minimum supervision.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, organization skills and time management. Good 'people skills' for building relationships with colleagues at all levels. Familiarity with SharePoint is an asset.
Awareness of the software development life cycle will be an asset.
Experience in front end technologies including HTML, Javascript and CSS is a plus.
Experience in server-side programming languages such as PHP, C# and Ruby will be a plus.
Nature and Scope
Contacts: CEL's course development teams, systems team, ITMS LMS Support Team, Registrar's Office, Institutional Analysis and Planning, SIS team, faculties, departments, vendors.

Level of Responsibility: Ensure that exceptional service is provided at all times in a timely manner to all internal and external stakeholders of CEL; must be able to work independently with minimum supervision while collaborating effectively in a team environment.

Physical and Sensory Demands: Much of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position with frequent opportunity to move about.  There is a frequent need to give close attention to various communications such as email and chats on MS Teams.

Working Environment: Must be able to effectively work from home (if needed) and have all the necessary equipment such as a Windows computer capable of application development, high-speed internet access and video conferencing facilities. There are deadline pressures, while at the same time there is a demand for thoroughness and accuracy.  As we work in a production environment that thousands of users depend on hourly, occasional ""crisis"" events which require immediate attention and action are not unheard of.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Conrad Grebel University College,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Intermediate,1,

column8: ,4 month work term,General Scope of Role

column1: In our digital world, it is important for Conrad Grebel University College to create engaging and relevant videos. With a diverse audience in mind, the Digital Communications Assistant creates digital video assets intended to attract new students and donors, and to raise the College's profile. As we emerge from the pandemic, Grebel will aim to offer a recorded or streamed option to live events.
Impact

As Grebel's Digital Communications Assistant, you'll have the chance to put your stamp on the way we tell Grebel's story. You'll get to meet students, alumni, and donors, plus you'll attend a variety of interesting events and concerts. As part of the communications department, you'll get a unique perspective into all of Grebel's departments and programs. You can expect to create around 20-30 videos of varying length over the term. These videos will become part of the College's YouTube channel and will used in Grebel's recruitment and community engagement efforts.

During your co-op term, you'll gain skills in storytelling, videography, video editing, sound editing, live-streaming, audio-visual technology, interviewing, YouTube analytics, and website editing- excellent skills for a career in communications in any industry.","Responsibilities and Tasks

As the Digital Communications Assistant, you'll primarily create videos and monitor Grebel's YouTube channel. By the end of the term, you'll have produced several 3- to 5-minute promotional videos, numerous short clips for use on the website and in social media, and will have recorded and/or live-streamed a few evening events in their entirety. Depending on the pandemic situation, you might also record weekly music concerts to be aired regularly on YouTube.
You'll produce video projects for use in promotion on Grebel's website and in presentations. Projects may include:
In-depth story-telling, featuring specific programs or people
A high-energy recruitment video
Short informational and persuasive videos featuring students
Captivating videos for social media
Recording of concerts and special lectures
You'll use digital video cameras and microphones, sound equipment, lighting, plus Adobe Premiere, After Effects, and Audition.
By maintaining Grebel's YouTube account, you'll discover ways to increase viewership, track analytics, SEO, and ensure accessibility.
In all your work you'll keep on brand to ensure that Grebel's visual identity, messaging, and style guidelines are consistent.
You'll communicate effectively with staff, faculty, and students to manage and realize projects within deadlines.
You might work on other communication and public relations projects coordinated with the Marketing and Communications Manager.","Characteristics, Qualifications and Expectations
Creativity, good judgment, and insight.
Experience in digital media. Proficiency using video and DSLR cameras, Adobe Premiere, After Effects, Audition
Experience in and a demonstrated aptitude for:
video production;
live-streaming and
sound design an asset.
Ability to create web graphics using Photoshop or Illustrator is an asset.
Excellent organizational skills. Familiarity with Microsoft Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to work productively and collegially with the College's faculty, staff, and students and with other University departments.
Ability to take direction as well as show initiative.
Workflow and prioritization skills to manage multiple deadlines and shifting priorities and circumstances.
Support for the mission and programs of Conrad Grebel University College
Accountability and Reporting

This role is accountable to the Marketing and Communications Manager. The HR Manager and Director of Operations are responsible for matters related to contract, benefits, workspace, and equipment.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,General Scope of Role

column1: The successful candidate will work with both the Centre for Peace Advancement and the Indigenous-Mennonite Encounters conference planning committee. Time will be divided between the two roles equally with a schedule that will be developed between both departments and the student.
Context

Conrad Grebel University College is affiliated with, and is situated on the campus of the University of Waterloo and is home to academic programs in Peace and Conflict Studies, Music, Mennonite Studies, and Theological Studies. Grebel also has a residence which houses 142 Waterloo students a term in a dynamic community.

The Kindred Credit Union Centre for Peace Advancement is home to a variety of participants involved in the work of advancing peace. Centre for Peace Advancement participants include peace-oriented entrepreneurs and established organizations from the region's vibrant peacebuilding field as well as Grebel faculty. Co-op students work closely with the core Centre staff along with a large group of researchers, practitioners, social enterprises, and other co-op students at the Centre and Grebel. Past co-op students in this role have gone on to high-impact positions with related agencies (e.g., Mennonite Central Committee's Ottawa Office, the University of Waterloo's Entrepreneurship at Environment team, and Waterloo's Council for Responsible Innovation & Technology).

Indigenous-Mennonite Encounters in Time and Place"" is an academic conference and community education event which will offer stories and analyses of encounters and relationships between Indigenous peoples and Mennonite settlers from point of contact through to the present. The intent of this event is to advance understanding on the part of Mennonites and other interested participants of their colonial histories, and is an effort to advance reconciliation and bring justice to Indigenous-settler relations.","To support the Centre for Peace Advancement Director and Coordinator by:
Executing the Centre's communications strategies;
Contributing to student and community engagement projects for the Centre;
Community-building support and
Other support as needed for major events or projects.
To support the Conference Coordinators by:
Assisting with conference logistics such as managing registrations and arranging meals, accommodations and room setups;
Promoting the conference, updating the conference website, and communicating with presenters and participants and
Additional tasks may be assigned as time, interest and skill levels permit.","Characteristics, Qualifications, and Expectations
Support for and understanding of the vision and mission of the Kindred Credit Union Centre for Peace Advancement and Conrad Grebel University College is a highly desired asset.
Demonstrated ability to take initiative, recognizing and acting on opportunities as they arise.
Demonstrated attention to detail.
Strong customer service orientation.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills.
Experience using, and a demonstrated aptitude for:
Microsoft Outlook, Excel, and Word;
Social media platforms, including Twitter, LinkedIn and
Website content management systems and MailChimp would be an asset
Creativity, good judgment, and critical thinking skills.

Excellent interpersonal and public relations skills, including the ability to work productively and collegially with the diverse range of participants and partners, as well as the College's faculty, staff, and students.
Undergraduate courses in Peace and Conflict Studies or another peace-related field are an asset.
Previous event planning experience is an asset.
A demonstrated interest in the subject matter of the Indigenous-Mennonite Encounters conference would be an asset.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The Conrad School of Entrepreneurship and Business (Conrad School) was created to support, build on, and expand the entrepreneurial initiatives at the University of Waterloo. Conrad School offers a full-time and part-time, on-campus Master of Business, Entrepreneurship and Technology (MBET) degree, a part time Graduate Diploma (GDip) in Business and Entrepreneurship as well as an undergraduate Option and Minor in Entrepreneurship.

column1: An opportunity exists with Conrad School for a Marketing and Administrative Assistant, which will be responsible for executing the tactical elements of our marketing plan and administrative duties with the supervision of a manager.","Reporting to the Marketing and Communications Manager, the Marketing and Administrative Assistant is responsible for:

Other tasks as needed to support the Conrad School with day to day operations","High level understanding of grammar, language usage and punctuation; must have excellent proofreading and promotional writing abilities

column8: ,4 month work term,ITC Project Organization:

column1: The ITC Project is an international collaboration of over 150 tobacco control researchers across 29 countries whose mission is to evaluate the behavioural and psychological impact of national-level tobacco control policies of the World Health Organization Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (FCTC), the first-ever international treaty on health. The ITC Project consists of a set of parallel annual cohort surveys of large, probability samples of tobacco users and non-users of tobacco in 29 countries: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Australia, Ireland, Thailand, Malaysia, South Korea, China, Mexico, Uruguay, Brazil, France, Germany, the Netherlands, New Zealand, India, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Kenya, Zambia, Mauritius, Greece, Poland, Romania, Hungary, Spain, Abu Dhabi (UAE), and Japan.

Our funding sources include the Canadian Institutes of Health Research, the National Cancer Institute/National Institute of Health (US), and the Ontario Institute of Cancer Research, as well as other governmental and foundation sources throughout the 29 ITC countries.

The ITC Project at UW is directed by Dr. Geoffrey T. Fong (Department of Psychology), who is also the Chief Principal Investigator of the overall ITC Project. The Data Management Centre is directed by Dr. Mary E. Thompson (Department of Statistics and Actuarial Science). Additional leadership and support is provided by other faculty members and staff, including the ITC Administrative Manager, Country Management Group (Research Scientist and Research Associates), Data Management Centre (Survey Management Group, Data Analyst Group, Statistics Group), Administrative Assistant, and graduate and undergraduate student Research Assistants.

Research Assistant - Co-ops will be asked to complete a variety of tasks which support the research project and administrative needs of ITC including literature reviews, creation and maintenance of spreadsheets and databases, assisting with survey development reviews, minute-taking, preparing drafts of various types of reports, preparing a monthly newsletter, drafting written documents.","ITC Research Assistant Co-ops will be responsible for the following:
- Conducting literature reviews
- Researching tobacco control policy updates within countries
- Survey Development support including minute-taking, survey checking, and formatting
- If possible, translation checking of surveys in various languages
- Transcription of recorded international meetings
- Supporting compilation of grant reporting and application information
- Updating and maintaining the ITC Administrative Database including publication and presentation tracking

- Assisting ITC Project Managers with project meetings, documentation, and ethics submissions.","This position requires a high degree of reliability, organization, and attention to detail. Good written communication skills are essential. Research experience and foreign language skills are assets for this position. Applicants should have strong computer skills such as MS Office (Access, Publisher, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc.), ability to multitask, excellent problem solving skills, a creative and positive approach, and ability to work independently as well as part of a team in a busy environment.
Skills and attributes:
·         Ability to multi-task and to work quickly and efficiently
·         Excellent problem solving skills
·         Creative and positive approach
·         Ability to work independently (in a busy environment) as well as part of a team
·         Exceptional interpersonal skills
·         Proven ability to exercise diplomacy, tact, good judgement, and respect for confidentiality
·         Understanding of international and cultural considerations related to communication protocols
·         Impeccable grammar, spelling, and business writing skills
·         Proven ability to prepare professional correspondence and reports
·         Ability to initiate tasks without direct supervision
·         Advanced Microsoft Office skills
·         Flexibility and resilience to accommodate occasions requirements outside of regular office hours
·         Language translation skills are not required but are an asset.","Targeted Clusters

column1: The successful candidate will work in a team environment within an innovative and exciting professional school at the University of Waterloo.  The School of Accounting and Finance (SAF) offers 4 distinct undergraduate programs to lead students to the professional business career they've always wanted: Accounting and Financial Management, Computing and Financial Management, Math/CPA, Biotech/CPA.

The Marketing and Recruitment Associate (the Associate) will use his/her marketing, event management, customer service, and communication skills to assist with the development, implementation, and management of the various student outreach, recruitment, and conversion events and initiatives. The Associate will use appropriate analytical and research skills to conduct research and provide reports to the SAF Marketing and Recruitment team to help enhance and drive strategy. The Associate will be exposed to multiple initiatives during the term and therefore, must be able to learn quickly, manage multiple tasks/projects simultaneously and act in a professional and ethical manner. The focus of the Spring term is to assist the SAF Marketing and Recruitment team with the implementation of marketing, outreach, and recruitment strategies as well as building new digital programming and initiatives.

Due to exposure to confidential student records, AFM, CFM, SFM, Biotech/CPA and Math/CPA students are ineligible for this role (conflict of interest); therefore, any applications from students in those programs will not be considered.","The position involves:

column1: As the Social Media & Web Associate, you will write and design communication and marketing assets for the SAF's social media channels. You will apply your analytics knowledge to help review and report analytics and performance of SAF's websites and social handles. The Communications & External Relations team works closely and provides communications and marketing support for all administrative and academic areas within SAF. As a key member of the team, you will be creating communications and social posts that appeal to SAF's diverse audiences - students, parents, teachers, employers, alumni, staff, faculty, and the Waterloo community. You will be exposed to multiple initiatives during the term and therefore, must be able to learn quickly, manage multiple tasks/projects simultaneously and act in a professional and ethical manner.

The focus of the Winter term is to assist the SAF Communications & External Relations team with building and enhancing communication collateral and assets (i.e. social media posts, blogs, videos, etc) to support the teams within SAF with focus and priority given to pivoting in-person strategies to digital/virtual strategies.

NOTE:  Due to exposure to confidential student records, AFM, CFM, Biotech/CPA, Math/CPA, and SFM students are ineligible for this role (conflict of interest); therefore, any applications from students in those programs will not be considered.","The Winter 2022 co-op work term will more than likely be an in-person work environment with the possibility of moving to an online work from home (WFH) environment, based on Public Health requirements. Please note that all UWaterloo hired co-op students must reside in Canada during the duration of their co-op work term if a WFH environment persists into the Winter 2022 term. The hired incumbent will be notified prior to the start of the Winter 2022 co-op term if SAF administrative staff are required to return to the office in January 2022.

column8: ,4 month work term,The Social and Intelligent Robotics Research Lab (SIRRL: https://uwaterloo.ca/social-intelligent-robotics-research-lab/) at the University of Waterloo is looking for a student to work on electrical hardware for a custom robot based on the MAKI open source platform (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/391398742/maki-a-3d-printable-humanoid-robot/description). At SIRRL we upgraded the MAKI robot with extra actuators and sensors, and updated the mechanical design of the robot. The robot needs a reliable electrical system as it will be used for human-robot interaction research. Your task will be to implement/improve the preliminary electrical system and program the microcontroller to get sensor information, communicate the robot state back to a raspberry pi computer, and program a basic interface for researchers to use. In SIRRL, we are using social robots in a variety of application areas, including robot-assisted play for children with special needs and healthy aging for older adults. The completiton and rigorous testing of the robot will allow the robot to be used in those application areas, and others.","Study and evaluate shortcomings with the current electrical system in the robot

Write basic social behaviors (software) for the robot to demonstrate its operation

column8: ,4 month work term,The student will work with a team to evaluate the use of the pressured ice model developed by the National Research Council (NRC) of Canada for shipping during the winter season. Climate change is leading to increased shipping activities in the Arctic due to reductions in ice cover and ice thickness. However, the ice continues to be hazardous, with mobile ice and pressured ice two significant risks to mariners. NRC works with the shipping industry to develop better tools to monitor and predict ice conditions.

column1: Outputs from the pressured ice model will be compared with high resoution satelite data and data acquired on a ship (eg. a large carrier operated by the shipping company FedNav) for two events where the ship became beset (or stuck) in the ice. These kind of events pose significant challenge to safe and efficient shipping in the winter season, leading to wasted time and fuel, in addition to the possibility of a spill. Analysis will be carried out using MATLAB and/or python. Students will also become familiar with packages used to manipulate remote sensing data.

This position will provide the student with an excellent opportunity to work in a multidisciplinary environment. The student will work within a team at the University of Waterloo (sea ice remote sensing, machine learning, physical modelling), in addition to a team at NRC. The project is funded by ArcticNet, which is a Network Center of Excellence with the objective of studying the impacts of climate change and modernization in the coastal Canadian Arctic. Work carried out by the student would likely contribute to a poster (to be presented at the ArcticNet annual meeting) in addition to a collaborative journal publication.","Writing code to analyze ice model output data, documenting the code and results from numerical experiments in a systematic manner. Preparing slides for presentations and for a term report. Meeting regularly with supervisor.","Previous experience with either matlab or python.
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
Strong interest in a research-orientated environment.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ABOUT:

The Engineering Ideas Clinic will supplement a traditional Engineering Curriculum with open-ended activities to spark student self-learning and exploration.  Through Ideas Clinic activities, students will learn good Engineering practices by experimenting with real-world engineering problems, and they will exercise their creativity, judgement and problem-solving skills, while acquiring soft skills such as communication and team work.  Students will gain an appreciation for the connections between courses in their curriculum.  Most importantly, the activities will provide students with a breadth of experience in an enjoyable, and safe, environment.
PRIMARY PURPOSE:

Students employed in this position will be aiding faculty across Engineering to develop a new platform for teaching principles of industrial automation. The Engineering Ideas Clinic has partnered with a local engineering firm who are experts in this domain to develop a flexible, small-scale industrial automation platform that will be used for multiple programs/years at Waterloo.","Students in this position will continue the development of a real-world teaching platform anchored in the industrial automation domain.  This platform is being developed in partnership with several industry partners to provide students with an engaging real-world activity that shows the context of their classroom learning.

column8: ,4 month work term,Video chat with end-to-end encryption

column1: Cynorix (www.cynorix.com) is a startup, founded by University of Waterloo faculty members, focusing on various security products. Cynorix distinction is in its innovative solutions founded on Information Theoretical principles, brought to life through the power of software. This position is to work on secure video chat product of Cynorix.

Summary in non-technical terms: There are a large number of video chat applications in the market, however, none of the existing video chat applications support true end-to-end encryption. This means, the video/audio is encrypted within the sender's computer and decrypted only at its final destination. This is quite challenging when the number of participants is 100 or more. In addition to end-to-end encryption, Cynorix video chat application has several other distinct features, such as an authentication system that makes the most common form of attack on such systems, namely the man-in-the-middle attack, impossible. We also rely on machine learning to detect from the face gestures when a person is speaking and automatically mute/unmute the micro-phone (mute if the participant is just listening to others, and unmute if the participant is actively speaking). This features improves the privacy, and also reduces the network load.","Work in more technical terms: The video chat itself is implemented starting from an open source sfotware. Main features of the chat itself are completed, but we need to speed-up the key distribution algorithm, enhance the management platform in forming and managing chat rooms, and in interfacing the chat events with email and calendar entries. The machine learning algorithm for face gesture detection needs to be enhanced, to improve accuracy, reduce the size as well as the complexity. The authentication is through Cynorix authentication platform, in which the loop is closed by scanning a QR code. We want to provide the option of using near field or Bluetooth connectivity for closing the loop. This requires developing an application (that should be installed) for Windows/MAC, as compared to the current setup in which the entire system is browser-based.
Front-end Web Developer: React and React-Native
Back-end Web Developer: NodeJS
Desktop Developer: Qt-C++, Electron, C#","Candidates possessing all or a subset of the following are preferred:
Front-end Web Developer: React and React-Native
Back-end Web Developer: NodeJS
Desktop Developer: Qt-C++, Electron, C#","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Sharing files with end-to-end encryption, without sharing passwords

column1: Cynorix (www.cynorix.com) is a startup, founded by University of Waterloo faculty members, focusing on various security products. Cynorix distinction is in its innovative solutions founded on Information Theoretical principles, brought to life through the power of software. This position is to work on secure file sharing product of Cynorix.

Summary in non-technical terms: These days we all use cloud for delivering of documents. Many such documents contain sensitive information and should be delivered from a sender to a receiver in an encrypted form. This is called end-to-end encryption, i.e., file is encrypted locally within the sender's computer and decrypted locally within the receiver's computer. It is also desirable that the provider of this file sharing service does not have access to encryption key or password used to encrypt the file and thereby cannot decrypt the file even if they want to. The main challenge in realizing this setup is as follows: How can the receiver decrypt a file that is encrypted using the sender's password, where sender password is not stored anywhere, and is never shared. We have been able to solve this problem. This means, in our setup, a file that is encrypted using person A's password, upon being shared with person B in encrypted form, can be decrypted using person B's password; and this happens without storing/sharing the passwords (nor encryption keys) and without passwords (nor encryption keys) ever leaving their owner's local computers.  Each user types his/her password when prompted, the local program uses the typed password to generate the encryption key, uses the key to encrypt or to decrypt the file, and then the password and the key are erased from the local computer. Using one password to encrypt a file and another password on a different computer to decrypt the same file may sound impossible, so please join us to see how Information Theory empowers such an apparently impossible task.","Technical work: The above file sharing is implemented on Google cloud using Google firebase and codes are in Java script. The authentication is through Google platform, but Cynorix has a more advanced authentication platform that we would like to integrate with the secure file sharing. Cynorix authentication setup is functional on its own, but the associated registration system and two factor authentication need to be modified to function in harmony with Google authentication.
There are several aspects and accordingly job resposibilities. The candidate, depending on qualifcation and personal interest, can get involved in one or more of the following general tasks:
Front-end Web Developer: React and React-Native
Back-end Web Developer: NodeJS
Desktop Developer: Qt-C++, Electron, C#","Candidates possessing all or a subset of the following are preferred:
Front-end Web Developer: React and React-Native
Back-end Web Developer: NodeJS
Desktop Developer: Qt-C++, Electron, C#","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Overview

column1: Soft robotics is an emerging field with promising potentials for a new paradigm regarding body-worn assistive technology. The main advantage of soft robots is its compliance, which allows for tailored conformability to the body while providing stabilization and movement assistance via fluidic actuation.

Waterloo Microfluidics Lab directed by Prof. Carolyn Ren collaborates with the Department of Kinesiology to design and implement soft wearable robots for rehabilitation, movement assistance, and minimizing the risks of injuries.
The Location
We are located on the University of Waterloo Campus with labs at E5 3008 and E3 3175, and offices at E5 3012 and E2 4403.","The Position

We are looking for a student interested in developing technologies for soft wearable robotics. You will work in an interdisciplinary setting involving fluid mechanics, mechatronics, and biomechanics. A Ph.D. student will work with you throughout your work term. You will gain research experience while working on the cutting-edge development of fluid mechanics and robotics with the potential for publishing a research paper. Below is a list of tasks to be expected.
Tasks
Design soft actuators for various applications involving human biomechanics and physiology, particularly for treating breast cancer-related lymphedema and prosthetic devices.
Test and characterize elastomer materials for soft actuators, looking at modulus, fatigue, and compatibility with various fabrics.
Design, fabricate and test microfluidic chips using soft lithography and 3D printing techniques.
Develop and implement control systems for microscale pneumatics and hydraulics.
Build laboratory testing fixtures, jigs and protocols for microscale pneumatics and hydraulics.","Skill Requirement
SolidWorks and AutoCAD
Matlab and C++
Hands-on skill regarding building mechatronic systems
Basic knowledge of fluid mechanics or biomechanics","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,About the role:

column1: As the Alumni Relations Associate, you'll be part of a productive Environment Advancement team, working to connect Faculty of Environment alumni, donors, prospects and students to promote and advance the mission of the faculty and the university. This term, we have two openings; one focused on donor stewardship and the other on alumni relations. Both roles involve many exciting events, opportunities for professional development, and a special project that you will lead. You'll also have the chance to build your professional network and sharpen your communications skills. You'll be joining a fast-paced, fun environment with friendly team members and multiple projects on the go at any given time.","There is no 'typical day' on our team, but here's an idea of what a week could look like:
Email alumni to invite them to be volunteers at a Leadership Series event.
Write a stewardship report for a scholarship donor.
Help run the faculty's donor dinner.
Plan a social media campaign to promote Alumni Weekend.
Update the volunteer database.
Develop the marketing material for our events.
Research prospective donors.
Create a trivia quiz for an alumni class dinner.
Order catering for the Grad Sendoff event.
Design a poster for the Jack Rosen Pitch Competition.
and so much more...","This role might be right for you if:
You love to write and can craft a mean sentence.
You have the ability to maintain professional relationships and communicate with a variety of stakeholders (such as donors, alumni, students, faculty and staff).
Your friends know you as the organized one (i.e. your calendar is color coordinated and you love post-it notes).
You are self-motivated, strategic and a solutions-focused thinker.
You can easily step up to lead a project but you are also comfortable in a supportive role.
You're the quintessential host when friends come over and love to make sure everyone is fed, watered and has everything they need to have a good time.
You value authentic connections and like going the extra mile for people to ensure you leave a good impression.
You are a guru at graphic design programs such as Adobe InDesign, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator.
You think creatively and outside the box, but also know how to pay attention to details and stay focused on your priorities.
You have strong values and are motivated to make a difference.
You might also stand out if you have:
experience in event planning, professional communications, marketing and/or donor relations
knowledge of the Faculty of Environment and the University of Waterloo
creative skills in social media, digital arts, and photography/video making
natural and genuine customer service skills
a strong desire to develop, grow, and contribute to the faculty's mission and vision
Why Environment?

We are Canada's largest Faculty of Environment, founded nearly 50 years ago to address the most pressing sustainability challenges facing humanity. Our integrative approach combines the study of natural and human environments by bringing together ecologists, geographers, knowledge integrators, and planners as well as experts in green business, spatial technologies, environmental governance, and economic development. Every day, our talented researchers and passionate students are generating new ideas, mobilizing knowledge and spurring coordinated action across sectors to drive change at a critical moment in our planet's history. The advancement team supports this important work by raising awareness, connecting our alumni and students, building strategic partnerships and increasing philanthropic support.
*Note: This position will require some evening and weekend work virtually (with advanced notice).  You will be working remotely.","Targeted Clusters
