column1: ,University of Waterloo,Human Rights, Equity and Inclusion",1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Intermediate,2,"

column8: ,4 month work term,ABOUT THE OFFICE OF HUMAN RIGHTS, EQUITY AND INCLUSION

column1: The Office of Human Rights, Equity and Inclusion is focused primarily on supporting, educating and connecting members of our campus community together, to make the University of Waterloo an equitable and safe place. Our work raises awareness across campus on issues relating to inequity, sexual violence, colonization, discrimination and harassment, as well as engaging senior administration to revise, create, and enhance university level systems, policies, and practices.

Led by the Associate Vice-President, the Office of Human Rights, Equity and Inclusion is organized across six functional areas: Equity, Conflict Management and Human Rights, Sexual Violence Prevention and Response, Indigenous Initiatives, Education and Training, Events and Engagement.
For more information about the Office of Human Rights, Equity and Inclusion please visit www.uwaterloo.ca/human-rights-equity-inclusion/
IS THIS JOB RIGHT FOR YOU?
Are you passionate about engaging in conversations to build equitable and anti-racist spaces on campus?
Are you interested in developing and contributing to informal and formal education and training opportunities for students, staff, and faculty?
If this sounds appealing to you, we're eager for you to apply to the Educational Programming Assistant in the University of Waterloo's Equity Office.

The Equity Office is looking for an energetic and eager student who is passionate about human rights and equity, research and has strong written and oral communication skills and the ability to engage in tactful discussions and think critically on sensitive issues. If you are eager to join a fast-paced team working towards a campus community of compassion, acknowledgement, and respect this placement is for you.
Our job at the Equity Office is to work with students, faculty and staff across campus to advance equity through evidence-based policies, practices and programs.
To learn more about the roles of the Equity office please review the link here:
https://uwaterloo.ca/human-rights-equity-inclusion/equity-office","WHAT ARE THE JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES?
Below is a list of your accountabilities, the areas you will be responsible for managing and ensuring are carried out the best way you can.
Education and Training Initiatives
Assist the Senior Equity Training Specialist to develop and deliver trainings and workshops and work with the Communications and Engagement team to promote trainings
Research content, compile information, and create resources relating to existing and new training and educational opportunities
Create content, written, visual, and video, to implement in trainings and workshops
Assist with the development of online learning modules and use various educational technologies to create compelling online learning opportunities
Assist with administrative tasks related to the Equity Office education portfolio as required
Provide technical support during workshops
Research and Administration
Assist with research on a variety of topics related to equity, anti-racism, diversity, and inclusion
Conduct environmental scans on relevant practices and initiatives and write reports summarizing findings
Provide administrative support for focus groups to determine training needs
Work on development of best practices for key university stakeholders
Participate in meetings and take minutes for relevant meetings
Communications and Promotions
Work closely with the Senior Equity Training Specialist and the Communications and Events team to identify and target specific audiences for equity training
Create factsheets, infographics, presentation slides, and other communication materials to support the training","Technical Skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office Programs (Word, PowerPoint, Excel), Microsoft Teams, and Zoom
Waterloo Content Management Software (or willingness to be trained)
Excellent writer for both personal (e.g., blog stories) and report/business associated writing
Strong personal organizational and project management skills
Photography and videography skills considered an asset
Qualities of Candidate:
Ability to develop relationships with diverse groups of people (staff, students, faculty)
Excellent communications skills both oral and written for the preparation of reports and making presentations
Open to constructive feedback and learning new ways of doing things
Someone who is organized and detail oriented is a big asset!
Ability to act with tact and discretion on sensitive matters
Excellent organizational and project management skills and strong attention to detail","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Help with upgrading the security of the University of Waterloo's digital infrastructure by joining the Information Security Operations team (a.k.a. ""The SOC""). The SOC's mission at UW is to provide services in the areas of network monitoring, vulnerability scanning, information security incident response and handling. As a DevOps Specialist, you will assist with the extension of a suite of internal services built with Python/Django, and help set-up and maintain a variety of open source security tools to support the SOC's mission.","Your role will have two primary functions. The first will be to assist with ongoing development of a Django web application. The second will be to assist or take the lead on installation and integration of open source applications.  Some examples of these systems are MISP, MineMeld, and Zeek. Other related technologies are Elastic Stack, PostgreSQL, and Clickhouse. These applications are largely run on Linux or FreeBSD systems. You will need to be, or to become, familiar with various technologies: web APIs, UI/UX, database interfaces, etc. As The SOC is fairly self-contained, we also manage many aspects of the computing systems running these applications: specifying and tuning the operating system, installing and maintaining database stacks, and so on.","Comfortable with Python and shell scripting

column1: Comfortable with web application frameworks, particularly Django
Familiarity with HTML/CSS
Familiarity with database technologies: SQL, Lucene, column-based databases
Comfortable with Linux command lines and systems administration
Adaptability to potentially rapidly-changing circumstances
Self-motivation, problem-solving ability, ability to cooperate in a team with mixed technical skills
There is an expectation of a certain amount of on-the-job learning, particularly with any systems administration skills.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Transformative Quantum Technologies co-op position is an exciting opportunity that will allow you to combine your technical writing skills with your ability to showcase scientific information in a creative way. If you have strong graphic design skills, technical writing ability and are excited about quantum, this is an opportunity for you!

column1: The Communications Assistant is responsible for supporting communications, technology, and web activities as they relate to the Transformative Quantum Technologies (TQT) research initiative. The incumbent will serve as a primary resource to the TQT office in the management of the TQT website, intranet and third party software services, and the co-ordination of print and e-communications. This role involves communications (print, web, and electronic), technical implementation and performance monitoring. This is an exciting opportunity that will allow you to combine your technical writing skills with your ability to showcase scientific information in a creative way.

TQT aims to accelerate the development and deployment of impactful quantum devices to further Canada's leadership position in the quantum revolution. This research program is thanks in part to funding from the Canada First Research Excellence Fund.  You can learn more about TQT by visiting the website: https://tqt.uwaterloo.ca/","- Co-ordinate the creation of new content, including copywriting and editing for TQT communications
- Publish and edit all materials on TQT related websites, intranet and third party software
- Provide web content management and editing support to TQT office staff
- Ensure consistency of content type and format in all communication and records management activities
- Assist with TQT record management, including file naming, uploading and tagging
- Collect and respond to web feedback forms
- Advise on technology trends, e.g., software and services, as applicable to TQT communications
- Help develop flyers, brochures, or other print materials
- Assist with technical design and/or implementation of software tools
- Migrate content where appropriate
- Develop, implement and maintain effective performance tracking tools for various aspects of the TQT program
- Co-ordinate and execute upon other projects that relate to TQT communications, as assigned

- Work effectively with other communications staff on campus, as appropriate","- Mid to senior level undergraduate student currently enrolled at the University of Waterloo in Engineering, Science, Math or Arts, preferably with a Business, Communications, or Software focus
- Demonstrated professional communication skills, both verbal and written
- Experience with graphic design programs such as Adobe Illustrator or InDesign
- Experience working with various on-line software tools for productivity enhancements

- Exceptional organizational skills

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Institute for Quantum Computing,4,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",5,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,The Quantum Simulation Group in the Transformative Quantum Technology Program at the Institute for Quantum Computing at the University of Waterloo is seeking two to four undergraduate students to support its effort of building and operating a quantum simulator based on neutral atoms trapped in two-dimensional arrays of optical traps.

column1: The students will become full-time members of the quantum simulation group and directly contribute to meeting its near-term goals of delivering quantum simulators to early adopters. In the process, the student will acquire valuable knowledge and skills in building and operating integrated software/hardware modules powering a complex scientific apparatus. This experience will prepare the student for making a meaningful contribution in quantum information science in academia and the industry.","The student will be assigned a project directly contributing to improving the performance of our quantum simulator with specific and realistic deliverables. Typical projects involve developing a software module to simulate and control one or more hardware devices to accomplish a specific task, e.g.,
Creating large homogeneous arrays of optical tweezers using acousto-optic deflectors and/or spatial light modulators;
Developing and benchmarking novel algorithms for sorting neutral atoms in arrays of optical traps;
Designing, building, and characterizing a low-latency control system to acquire and process images from a high-resolution camera using NVIDIA's GPUDirect protocol;
Designing, manufacturing, and characterizing a high-resolution microscope objective.
We currently are looking into expanding our research activities into the following areas

Developing a browser-based front-end user interface for early adopters to submit jobs onto our quantum simulator. This front-end interface will be used to demonstrate our experimental capability to investors and might establish the basis of a cloud-based quantum computing service.

Developing and implementing reconfiguration algorithms based on graph theory using graphical processing units (with collaborators from the Faculty of Mathematics).","We spend a significant amount of our effort mentoring students to accelerate their personal and professional development, so we are looking into hiring ambitious and hard-working top-of-the-class students that aim at achieving nothing less than outstanding work.
The most successful students will be independent, inquisitive, proactive, and hardworking, continuously seeking opportunities to improve themselves and achieve excellence.

In terms of skills, we are seeking quick learners with strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a strong academic background in (applied) mathematics, physics engineering, hardware/software system design, and programming (Python, C++, CUDA).
Prior experience with Quantum Physics is not needed; curiosity and drive are more important.","Targeted Clusters

column11: Quantum Outreach and Education Research Assistant

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Institute for Quantum Computing,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",11,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Institute for Quantum Computing (IQC) is a multidisciplinary research institute at the University of Waterloo, bringing together researchers from Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Chemistry, and Engineering to explore many different facets of quantum information science. Part of our commitment to quantum research is to make sure that the results are accessible and understandable through outreach activities.

column1: The Quantum Outreach and Education Research Assistant will work with the Senior Manager of Scientific Outreach at the Institute for Quantum Computing (IQC) to develop and maintain IQC's world-class outreach program teaching quantum information science to a variety of audiences. In particular, the successful candidate will be responsible for developing workshops and demonstrations using techniques from quantum optics, including working with research-grade entangled photon sources and 3D-printed demonstration of quantum key distribution. The successful candidate will also have the opportunity to deliver workshops on quantum technologies to student audiences, developing an essential skillset for science communication and quantum research.","Building demonstrations for quantum education
Through guided research, understand the physical principles and real-world necessities
In the lab, put together and fine-tune/align optical components
Ensure proper working order and robustness through benchmarking tests
Design and test components using 3D printing and electronics
Build plug-and-play extensions to core components (e.g. entangled photon source) for educational experiments
Design control and user-end software for both testing and educational use
Outreach and education
Research and co-write lesson plans for introducing quantum science to middle- and high-school students
Assist with the delivery of workshops on quantum technologies to high-school students
Assist with the planning and setup of various educational and public-facing events and workshops
Develop ideas for further hands-on educational demonstrations
Virtual learning
Help design and develop online activities and simulations in, for example, HTML5 and Javascript
Develop tutorials and guides for students to learn quantum science through coding exercises
Help run and moderate workshops and events for students, teachers, and the public
Due to the scheduling of outreach events, some weekend and evening work will be required. Any requirements outside of normal working hours will be planned well in advance.","Education
Pursuing a university degree in physics.
Experience
200-level or above quantum physics and optics courses are a strong asset.
Prior experience in an optics laboratory is not necessary, but is an asset.
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Familiarity with concepts in quantum physics, e.g. superposition, entanglement
Ability to communicate scientific ideas effectively to broad audiences
Ability to work independently
Ability to leave detailed and legible lab notes and reports for both supervisors and future users
Able to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team
Pre-existing knowledge of programming in Python, Mathematica, HTML5, Javascript or Unity is an asset (but not essential)
Pre-existing knowledge of experimental design and acquisition software, such as AutoCAD, LabView, and Arduino interfacing, is an asset (but not essential)

Physical and Sensory Demands: Lasers, electronics, and machine-shop equipment will be used, and proper safety precautions must be taken. Some lifting and transport functions may arise. Optics laboratory work often requires extended periods of standing.

Working Environment: Split between an office environment and a laboratory. If the applicant desires, a teaching and public outreach component can be emphasized. Due to COVID-19 restrictions, some work-from-home days are to be expected, but laboratory presence will be required following the current health and safety regulations","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The University of Waterloo Library's Special Collections & Archives (SCA), located in the Dana Porter Library, holds early editions and rare books, collections of archives and research collections, and other materials that require special care and handling because of their early publication date, provenance, physical condition, aesthetic value, or unusual format. The University of Waterloo Archives, consisting of records and publications documenting the history of the university, is also part of Special Collections & Archives.

column1: We seek a motivated, self-starter to work on a variety of projects including, but not limited to, data entry, digitizing archival material, research projects, and creating on-line exhibits.","Main duties will include:

- Revising and creating transcriptions of digitized documents
- Assisting with ongoing scanning and digitization projects involving our holdings of historical photographs, manuscript diaries, and university records
Other duties may include:
-Retrieving and returning archival and rare book material
-Re-housing materials not currently stored in appropriate containers or file folders
-Assisting with the preparation of instruction or outreach activities
-Contributing to the design of web-based content or promotional items including banners, blog posts and exhibits.","Candidates for this position should have:
-Interest in historical research and/or information management practices;
-Attention to detail and an ability to work independently;
-Experience in using MS Office applications and some experience with database management applications;
-Ability to lift records boxes weighing up to 18kg (40 lbs), using step-ladders to retrieve and return boxes
This position will work in the Dana Porter Library.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,ABOUT THE POSITION

column1: Reporting to the Library's Senior Development Officer and Head of Communications, you will support fundraising and communications efforts at the Library.
ABOUT THE LIBRARY

Through our unparalleled services, research collections, deep expertise, and indispensable teaching of critical information appraisal, we equip scholars and students to find, assess, and integrate data and scholarship into ground-breaking solutions to real-world problems.

The Library Advancement team aims to connect donors and prospective donors with the mission of the Library, to deepen engagement and increase support. For more information about the Library, please read the most recent annual report, strategic plan, and explore the Library website and Library giving pages.
ABOUT THE OFFICE OF ADVANCEMENT
The Office of Advancement's mission is to inspire and engage people in philanthropy to advance the University of Waterloo in becoming one of the world's top innovation universities.

Led by the Vice-President, Advancement, the Office of Advancement is organized across six functional areas: Development & Alumni Relations, Faculty Advancement teams, Advancement Strategy, and Advancement Services. In addition, the Office of Advancement operates in close partnership with the advancement functions in each of its affiliated and federated Institutions (university colleges) as well as non-academic units such as the Library and Athletics & Recreation.
For more information about the Office of Advancement, please visit www.uwaterloo.ca/support
IS THIS JOB RIGHT FOR YOU?

Would learning the fundamentals of fundraising and donor communications benefit your academic and career goals? Do you plan to pursue a career in fund raising or not-for-profit work? Are you comfortable working within a team setting? Would you feel confident in being responsible for managing your own tasks and projects? Would you like to gain experience in project management? Are you interested in supporting the implementation of a communications plan?
If the skills required, job tasks and key accountabilities suit your interests and abilities, we would love to have you apply.","WHAT ARE THE JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES?
Below is a list of your accountabilities, the areas you will be responsible for managing and ensuring are carried out the best way you can.?
Assist the Library Advancement Senior Development Officer (SDO) primarily with donor stewardship activities as well as any other projects that arise
Assist with preparing data & copy for monthly donor thank you emails and postcards
Assist with the coordination of scheduled donor stewardship events
Assist with compiling information, resources, and drafted copy for scheduled donor stewardship communications, such as annual impact reports and quarterly Library donor update newsletters
Assist with prospect research and moves management organization for the Library Advancement SDO
Support SDO in preparing files to assist fund custodians in expending donor funds
Support data entry needs of the SDO, using the Raisers Edge database
Update the Library's giving pages website and other content as needed
Coordinate the inclusion of Library resources in the Student Success Office's (SSO) Parents and Supporters monthly newsletter
Support the Library's Communications team with projects as needed
Update the Library Advancement Assistant co-op manual throughout and at the end of your placement and assist with general co-op hiring for this position
Represent the university in a courteous and professional manner","WHAT SKILLS ARE REQUIRED?
The following is a carefully designed list of skills required to successfully carry out the Library Advancement Assistant job duties.
Interest in and affinity for fundraising on behalf of the University of Waterloo
Self-motivation; the ability to push yourself to complete tasks efficiently and to keep focus in a highly computerized and remote work environment
Exceptional attention to detail; inputting data and communicating correct information with a high degree of accuracy

Interpersonal skills; ability to interact professionally and respectfully with colleagues, ability to work effectively and efficiently within a team setting, comfort in communicating to a variety of audiences
Good judgement; tact, diplomacy, confidentiality and sensitivity are required at all times

Communication skills; professional in-person, telephone manner, ability to maintain open communication with supervisor and colleagues to ensure task completion and effective project management; must be friendly, outgoing and pleasantly persistent in communications
Technical skills; experience and comfort using databases and virtual communication tools an asset","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The International Research and Partnerships (IRP) Administrator assists the IRP team with daily operational functions and assists with general workflow processes for research applications and contracts. Through the IRP team, the administrator also works with international institutions and funding agencies in the grant application process and coordinates initiatives to support and strengthen the diversity of international funding mechanisms for research at Waterloo.","Research Administration

column1: Provides general administrative support to the International Research Partnerships team;
Maintains complete and accurate files for each proposal and assigned award, including all documentation received from the sponsor, and archives all closed or non-initiated projects;
Processes all proposals/projects through research administration workflow using the OR InfoEd system;
Plays a key role in the tracking, monitoring, and reporting of all matters associated with research projects and proposals.
Customer Service/Correspondence/Communications
Helps organize virtual information sessions and online international funding events;
Assists with correspondence with external sponsors to clarify funding opportunity information for our researchers such as eligibility criteria, budget requests and application deadlines;
Assists with communication materials, including announcements and promotional materials;

Assists the Coordinator and Managers in the monitoring of and timely dissemination of announcements and calls for proposals for international funding opportunities, maintaining university distribution lists, prepares clear and informative announcements in a timely manner,  including contacting individual researchers when appropriate;

Provides logistical support for and contributes to the organization of presentations, preparation and communication of competition results, and any other arrangements associated with international research activities.
Streamlining Workflow and Business Practices
Researches and recommends enhanced administrative tools, and keeps current with best practices;
Carries out other general and specific duties as may be determined, including the completion of various projects as assigned, and the design and generation of any specific reports requested;

Responsible for data entry and the maintenance of information and records within data management systems with respect to research proposal and contract documents, including recording appropriate alerts, tracking progress of the application, and monitoring and reviewing to ensure the accuracy of the input.","Required skills:
Highly detail-oriented with excellent communication (oral and written) skills;
Ability to learn quickly, exercise problem-solving skills and work independently;
Strong computer skills, especially with the Microsoft Office suite;
Experience with grant applications and research administration is an asset;
Proven high level of aptitude for and success in providing exceptional customer service;
Understanding of, and familiarity with Waterloo Content Management System;
Awareness of, and sensitivity to cultural, language, religious, political, socio-economic, and other relevant factors in areas associated with the university's international interests;

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively, maintain confidentiality, exhibit sensitivity to the needs and interests of a variety of stakeholders, and support the functioning of a diverse team both within individual departments and across a larger institution; and
Strong organizational skills coupled with the ability to take initiative, handle multiple tasks, meet multiple deadlines, and excel in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Professional Development Program (WatPD),25,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",54,"

column8: ,4 month work term,At WatPD, within the WIL Programs department, we genuinely care about the students we support and the students we hire. We're invested in you and want you to have the best experience possible. We will support you in your role as a Teaching Assistant (TA) with the tools and resources necessary to help you improve our courses and make an impact from day one! Because we believe in professional development (PD) and lifelong learning, professional development opportunities will be provided to assist you in improving yourself. We are proud to be a world leader in this field, offering compelling courses that aim to help students develop valuable future-ready skills. We understand and value the importance of having a diverse, inclusive workforce and workplace. Our team is made up of staff and TAs from various backgrounds, faculties, experiences, and abilities. Through events run by our team building, wellness, or our gold-certified green teams, we pride ourselves in being a collaborative group fostering a work environment that balances hard work with fun. We care about the work we do and are committed to improving our courses and student service. Your ideas can make an impact on the student experience, which is why we're proud to invest in the co-op program by hiring students every term.

column1: WatPD TAs are an integral part of our team in WIL Programs and are the first point of contact for student support in the PD courses. TAs are responsible for supporting students in the completion of their PD courses by grading assignments, providing meaningful feedback, and answering questions. TAs may also work with different members of the WIL Programs staff on projects designed to enhance specific courses or WIL Programs.","WatPD TAs assist students in improving their academic work by grading and providing quality feedback on their PD course assignments. Through email and discussion boards, TAs support students by providing professional and helpful responses to inquiries. TAs use their unique skills and interests to suggest new and innovative ideas that help enhance WIL Programs.

In addition to supporting a PD course, TAs support a group of 25-50 students taking PD1. TAs mentor and assist students as they make their way through their first co-op work search experience, providing one-on-one meetings to discuss their résumé and practice their interview skills. TAs will grade and provide feedback on assignments throughout the term and support students through their work search process.

TAs enhance their employable skills such as time management, problem solving, organizational skills, teamwork, adaptability, communication (written and verbal), and technical skills (Excel, LEARN). As a professional development opportunity, TAs will deliver an oral presentation to their peers on a topic of their choosing. To assist in preparing for their futures, TAs will be asked to set goals related to the workplace, academics, and personal goals around intentional and substantial professional development. TAs develop strong relationships and teamwork skills through participation in team-building activities with other co-op students.","Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent organizational and time management skills to juggle multiple priorities and adapt to variations in workload over the term
Team player who can also work independently
Genuine interest in helping students
An understanding of the importance of professional/soft skill development
Resourceful and thoughtful problem solver; able to identify solutions using available resources and by understanding implications of decisions
Creativity and initiative to present and implement ideas regarding course and program improvements an asset
Applicants MUST have completed at least one of PD11, PD12, PD19, or PD20
Additional Returner Qualifications

WIL Programs hires TAs who are returning in the role. In addition to the TA job responsibilities, returning TAs are expected to provide leadership and mentorship to TAs new to the role. Since returner TAs are already familiar with the role, we expect returners to take initiative and use their creativity while implementing ideas for program and course improvements.","Targeted Clusters

Comfortable with Adobe suite, Publisher, Canva, PowerPoint, or similar graphic design programs. Has a keen eye for visual and graphic appeal.

column8: ,4 month work term,Are you the type of person who is inspired by content creators? Have a favourite YouTuber? Find yourself scrolling for hours on Instagram? What about TikTok? Marketing and Undergraduate Recruitment is looking for a dynamic, creative, and high energy co-op student to help us take our social media efforts to the next level while we recruit the class of 2022.

column1: This role will be based in Waterloo, ON with on-campus reporting when deemed safe to do so. Required tools and software will be provided.
About Marketing and Undergraduate Recruitment

Marketing & Undergraduate Recruitment (MUR) leads campus-wide strategies, digital communications, publications, research, and events that influence smart, motivated students to choose Waterloo for their education. Our work is innovative, data-driven, student-centric, and informed by enrollment management principles as well as the University's strategic plan.

MUR emphasizes continuous learning and provides many opportunities for students to learn and to expand their skills in a supportive, fun environment. Our team hires five to six co-op students each term to provide support and leadership in areas such as marketing communications, research and marketing insights, social media production and measurement, and video production.
About the Registrar's Office

Undergraduate studies at the University of Waterloo are administered through the Registrar's Office (RO). The RO leads registration support and maintenance of undergraduate student records, including:
- admission
- communication
- marketing and undergraduate recruitment
- course scheduling
- final examinations scheduled and administered by the Registrar's Office
- grade reporting
- convocation
- financial aid, awards, and scholarships
- Undergraduate Calendar

The RO is the central administrative unit working  in tandem with faculties and departments to administer undergraduate programs, prepare data for internal groups, and submit data to various government and external agencies.","What you'll do:

In this role, you'll be responsible for the day to day management of UWaterloo's prospective student social media and email marketing efforts. This includes, storyboarding, filming, and producing Instagram stories and takeovers. You'll be the magic behind the scenes, preparing content for over 42,000 followers on the @UofWaterloo channel. You'll learn about new tools, new apps, art directing, how to adapt web content for social platforms, and how image composition can make or break a shot.

You'll also be responsible for additional projects given to you by members of our team and learn the benefits of an integrated content marketing model. You'll learn about email marketing, the importance of documenting your work, the critical nature of analytics and research, and how social media advertising works.

This is an opportunity to show off your talents and your university to high school students around the world. Your opinion will be considered on everything, from what music gets used in the background of a video and how we roll out our content, to how we piggyback off the latest trends in digital advertising, and what makes a newsletter great.","Must have experience with:
- Social media platforms such as Instagram, Facebook, and/or Twitter
- Microsoft office
It'd be great if you also knew how to use:
- Mailchimp or other email marketing platforms
- iMovie or other movie editing software
- VSCO or other photo editing software
- Google drive or other cloud based file storage
Other skills we're looking for:
- A keen aesthetic eye
- Organizational skills, thoroughness, and accuracy
- Time management skills
- Proven project management skills
- Attention to detail that borders on the obsessive
- Proven communication skills (written and oral)
- Passion for a creative and collaborative environment","Targeted Clusters

column1: The Marketing & Undergraduate Recruitment (MUR) team is looking for a qualified co-op student to support the University's digital communication with prospective students as well as our research efforts which help inform our strategic directions.

MUR is part of the Registrar's Office and provides a team-centered environment where you can work independently and with other team members to help the University achieve its recruitment goals. MUR emphasizes continuous learning and provides many formal and informal professional development opportunities.","- Administer and maintain the integrity of data in our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system, which houses our prospective student database.

- Design and implement research projects including writing questionnaires, analyzing results and writing clear, timely, documented reports that include appropriate recommendations for strategy enhancements and improved tactical solutions based on the results.
- Analyze enrollment data and gather intelligence needed to support and guide MUR in developing marketing and recruiting strategies.
- Collect data and prepare reports for team members.
- Produce technical documentation of operations processes as well as the CRM to support key collaborators as well as end-users.
- Proofreads and edits survey instruments produced by or associated with MUR to ensure accuracy, consistency, and grammatical correctness.
- Maintains awareness of, analyzes, and understands various data types including university, government, and survey data.
- Assist with on-campus recruitment events, such as our open houses","Required:
- Strong organizational and communication skills
- Strong knowledge of statistics and research methods
- Familiarity with basic marketing concepts and/or prior experience in marketing
- Experience in technical writing and communicating technical concepts to end-users
- Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, specifically in the utilization of statistical analysis, lookup formulas, pivot tables, filtration, graphing, and charting
- Proven problem-solving ability and attention to detail
- Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new technologies
Assets:
- Knowledge of relational databases and the ability to work with an SQL database
- Prior research experience, with usage of Qualtrics
- Experience with data analysis tools such as Tableau, Microsoft PowerBI, SPSS
- Experience with web analytics and platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Search Console
- Experience with social media analytics (e.g., Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.)
MUST be OSAP eligible. Please see Additional Information for more details.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The Renison Marketing and Recruitment Department is hiring one (1) co-op student in the role of a Marketing and Recruitment Assistant.

column1: This position holds responsibility for the delivery of support activities related to recruitment and admissions processes. In this capacity the Marketing and Recruitment Assistant is trained to support various marketing and recruitment initiatives including: Renison campus tours and open houses (could be in a virtual format), social media initiatives, and responding to inquiries from prospective and admitted students.  The incumbent works with the Marketing and Recruitment team and may be responsible for various projects related to communications, digital design, and interactions with prospective and admitted students. The incumbent will help Renison meet its overall enrolment management goals by also contributing to marketing and recruitment by conducting research and analysis to inform specific strategies, key messaging, and positioning.

The successful candidate must possess excellent project management experience with strong attention to detail and basic digital design skills. The candidate will work collaboratively with multiple partners in Renison, including program managers and administrative staff, student experience and activities staff, as well as student program assistants, peer leaders, and residence dons.

This position is ideal for senior undergraduate students who possess strong project management experience; leadership skills; an ability to manage responsibilities effectively; and robust time management skills.","Supervised project management of Recruitment initiatives. column1: The Student Affairs Digital Engagement Assistant has a strong understanding of the SJU Student Affairs portfolios, and unique SJU student experience; and supports several different portfolios in Student Affairs (student advising, incoming student transition, orientation, wellness, service learning) as they shift their programs, services, and engagement to digital platforms for Fall 2021, and beyond.  The ideal candidate has well developed digital literacy, exceptional written and oral communication skills, experience with website content creation and online engagement, and demonstrated experience in working independently as well as a member of a team.

This role will work collaboratively with relevant areas at both SJU and UW and reports to the Director, Student Affairs, and Student Affairs Administrative Assistant, in the department of Student Affairs at St. Jerome's University. The position works remotely/from home amid the COVID-19 pandemic, until campus and the Student Affairs office reopens, with some in-person work that may be required at the main entry reception at St. Jerome's University.","Digital Engagement & Communications
Provides guidance and support to staff in Student Affairs on effective implementation and maintenance of online digital tools including: website, online forms, video sharing, social media, email.

In collaboration with Student Affairs staff, proposes, develops, and coordinates the diversification of several different Student Affairs portfolios using online and digital spaces. These portfolios include but aren't limited to: PAL program, Orientation Week, Incoming Student Transition, SJU House System, student staff and student leader training.

column8: ,4 month work term,Job Title: Outreach and Recruitment Associate

column1: Department: Enrolment and Upper-Year Transitions, St. Jerome's University
Reports to: Manager, Outreach and Recruitment
Employment: January 2022 - April 2022
What you'll do:

As the Outreach and Recruitment Associate, you're part of a small but energetic team who works with prospective students to determine if St. Jerome's University is where they want to live, study, and grow. You'll be responsible for planning and implementing outreach and recruitment activities such as Fall (Virtual) Open House, (virtual) campus tours, (online) school visits, TikTok videos, and/or Instagram Stories. You'll also be working with student leaders and staff to oversee the Ambassador Program, and you'll be interacting with future students to answer their questions live, on the phone, through e-mail, at the front desk (if on campus at all), and over various interactive web platforms (such as blogs, the SJU website, social media, etc.). It's a fast-paced, people-first environment with multiple projects on the go at any given time through which you will actively contribute to bringing in the next cohort of St. Jerome's University students at the University of Waterloo. Your suggestions, ideas, and innovations are encouraged and empowered as a member of this team.","A typical day may look like:
- Take, edit, and create photos, videos, and other visual content that can be added to various web platforms (such as what activities students will attend in their best Hallowe'en costumes!).
- Call back a parent of a prospective student who has questions about co-registration between SJU and Waterloo.
- Eat your lunch while playing our classic ""SJU Stay at Home Trivia"" with staff, faculty, and students.
- Attend a Recruitment Roundtable meeting and share your ideas in preparation for Fall (Virutal) Open House.
- Analyze statistics you gathered in a survey of why current students chose to study at SJU and/or live at SJU.

- Reach out to a Professor in the English Department at SJU to do a quick interview about the exciting online lessons and course they are planning for the Winter (and so you can share it on social media!)
- Partner with the Student Affairs team to create off-campus (online) social events for continuing students

- Join staff and faculty as they come together (on Zoom) for a weekly coffee time on Friday mornings. A great opportunity to get to know the people that you work alongside!","This position might be right for you if:
- Your calendar is detailed and colour-coordinated, and you've already mapped out what your next two weeks look like.
- You love having friends over and making sure they have all the food and comfort they need to enjoy themselves.
- You're an enthusiastic member of a team, able to take charge and stand in the spotlight, but are also just as happy to ensure everything is running smoothly behind the scenes.
- You thrive by helping people and by going that extra mile to make sure their interaction with you is a memorable one.
- You love social media and might spend more time that you'd like to admit out loud posting, retweeting, and scrolling through endless TikTok videos.
- You're a self-motivated self-starter who takes initiative to dive into new projects without being asked.
- You are passionate about digital design and digital communication and like creating and editing videos, graphics, and creative content.
- You think creatively and outside the box, but you also know how to pay attention to details and stay focused on your priorities.
You might also stand out if you have:
- experience in recruitment, marketing, sales, and/or public speaking
- knowledge of St. Jerome's University and the University of Waterloo
- knowledge of the Kitchener-Waterloo region and culture
- creative skills in fine arts, digital media, photography/video making, and/or writing
- natural and genuine customer service skills
- a strong desire to learn and grow, to ask questions, and to bring your best each day.
Why SJU?

Every day we put ourselves in the shoes of our future students to go where they are, understand their needs and wants, and make standard what our competitors consider above and beyond. We challenge ourselves to be 1% better tomorrow than we are today, and we rely on each other to guide and to give that extra push when needed. At the end of the day, we want to raise the profile of the university, and we want to create memorable moments and lasting relationships with our current and future students.
Interested?

We're excited to add your energy and ideas to our team. If you feel you might have only some of the qualifications we're looking for, but you're willing to work hard and learn the rest, we'd still love to see your application!","Targeted Clusters

column1: We're looking for a creative and high-energy student to take our social media efforts to the next level and keep current students engaged and informed about all things UWaterloo.
About The Student Success Office (SSO)

We lead and coordinates student-focused programs and initiatives to promote student success both in and out of the classroom. The role of the SSO's Communications team is to provide strategic communications to support the SSO's objectives, provide leadership to the campus community on student-focused communications, and promote stories of student success.
We cover a wide range of topics from academic support to exchange and study abroad programs, plus collaborate with other teams across campus to help share a robust student experience.
The Digital Communications Assistant supports this work by engaging students online + on campus to foster a sense of community, support, and access to campus resources.","In this role, you'll get to:
Write content and create an editorial calendar for the @UWaterlooLife Social Media accounts (Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter)
Be the face of the account, introducing weekly content via Instagram Stories and covering events live while they take place (only if on-campus activities resume)

Design and create digital assets for an integrated approach
Provide social media monitoring (reply to direct messages, and comments)

Provide support with website content development for student engagement
Collaborate on website, photography, videography and print communication needs
Support a variety of student engagement initiatives that align with our services offered
Coordinate any special projects as assigned
Work with a team of communications and marketing experts who are eager to support your professional development and help you hone your skills
Collaborate with other Student Success Office Co-op students on projects that support the office","You'll need to:

column1: The Communications Design Assistant will produce original, creative, and appropriate designs for in-house SSO print materials digital and video content, including but not limited to: postcards, booklets, emails, infographics, digital screens, social media short-format videos and web content.  The Communications Design Assistant will be required to learn University brand guidelines and follow them appropriately.  This includes, but is not limited to colour palettes, logos/wordmarks, typography, layouts and image styles.

The successful applicant will need to take initiative, be creative and flexible, find efficiencies in workflow and possess the ability to work independently.  This position will require a strong understanding of Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere with problem-solving abilities and excellent verbal and written communication skills.
A design portfolio highlighting five or more original pieces must accompany your application.","- Update existing SSO designs by following Waterloo branding guidelines
- Conceptualize and create visual designs to support the achievement of SSO goals and those of our partners.

- Produce original, creative, and appropriate designs for in-house SSO print materials and digital content, including but not limited to: postcards, booklets, emails, infographics, digital screens, social media, short-format videos, and web content.
- Render all design solutions using suitable, effective design software applications for print, web, or multimedia, with adherence to accessibility standards.
- Work collaboratively with all members of the Communications and Research team on communication projects
- Attend staff meetings and professional development opportunities
- Coordinate any special projects as assigned","- Strong understanding of design software with an emphasis on Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, and Premiere
- Ability to work independently and to carry out assignments to completion within Waterloo branding guidelines

- Excellent written and verbal communication
- Exceptional organization skills and flexibility
- Strong understanding of social media platforms and how to design effectively for each platform.
- Ability to manage several projects concurrently, prioritize tasks and meet deadlines
- Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Student Success Office,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Intermediate, Senior",39,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Student Success Office (SSO) offers a broad based experiential Student Leadership Program (SLP) to all current UW students. The intent of the program is to help students discover and enhance their leadership potential, to gain knowledge and develop skills in leadership that can be applied on campus and within the community. The SLP is comprised of 6 interactive workshops which discuss various topics related to leadership (i.e. Building Effective Teams, Exploring Conflict Management). a leadership experience and reflection. For more information about the SLP, visit https://uwaterloo.ca/student-success/slp

column1: As well, the Foundational Training Program (FTP)  program has been created by the Student Success Office to provide foundational training for undergraduate and graduate students who will be working with other students in a peer-to-peer program at the University of Waterloo. Our program contributes to the quality and effectiveness of peer-to-peer programs across campus by providing common training for students to enhance skills that are critical to mentorship success but also workplace preparedness.","The main responsibilities of the Student Development Assistant (SDA) involve:

- Preparing for and coordinating the SLP and FTP workshops. This includes: ordering and preparing workshop materials, assisting with creating the workshop schedule, setting up and maintaining the learning space, tracking and entering attendance, overseeing workshop registration, responding to inquiries about the program, and issuing the SLP e-certificate
- Maintaining on-going communication, both written and oral, with participants, facilitators, Team Leads and staff members
- Overseeing and managing the student.leadership@uwaterloo.ca email account
- Addressing facilitator and participant requests and concerns with sensitivity, respect and promptness
- Coordinating outreach and promotion initiatives for the SLP and FTP
- Collecting and entering workshop feedback
- Assisting with the planning and delivery of team meetings, professional development training and team socials
- Day to day trouble-shooting
- Attending meetings and other professional development opportunities
- Project work
- Providing support for other SSO related events that may require assistance
- Report writing and data analysis

The SD Assistant also has the opportunity to take on project work contributing to department initiatives. Project areas may include, but are not limited to: marketing and communications, content development, event planning, feedback and evaluation, and technical support and development.
Note: this position may require work in non-traditional hours, including evenings and/or weekends.","The SSO is looking for a co-op student who possesses the following qualities:
- Demonstrated leadership skills and an interest in leadership development
- Self-motivated and high level of autonomy
- Clear written and oral communication skills
- Excellent organizational and time-management skills
- Interpersonal skills, and the ability to work effectively in a team environment
- Creative problem solving skills
- Sound judgment, tact, and diplomacy
- Proficiency with common computing software, including MS Office Suite
- The ability to work independently with little to no supervision","Targeted Clusters

column11: Student Relations and Front Desk Assistant

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Student Success Office,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",15,"

column8: ,4 month work term,This position is a Work Placement position. Please see eligibility details here.

column1: The Student Success Office (SSO) leads and coordinates various student-focused programs and initiatives which promote student success.  On a daily basis, many students, staff, faculty and community members contact and visit the SSO to obtain information about programs and resources offered by the SSO.  The Student Relations & Front Desk Assistant's role is crucial to the smooth operation of the office.  As a front-line staff member, the Student Relations & Front Desk Assistant is responsible for providing information, resources and outstanding customer service to students, staff, faculty, and parents who visit/contact the SSO.  In addition, the successful candidate will provide general administrative and clerical support to the entire office as required.

Please note that due to the COVID-19 pandemic, this job may require you to work remotely from your home location. You must have access to a computer, reliable internet, and a work from home space.","- Provide outstanding and professional front line customer service to all individuals who contact the Student Success Office
- Direct students and visitors to the appropriate resources
- Book, cancel and monitor appointments
- Monitor the success@uwaterloo.ca email address and respond to all inquiries
- Answer phone calls, check the voicemail, respond to all incoming inquiries and transfer calls to the appropriate resource
- Respond to Live Chat inquiries and direct students to appropriate resources
- Provide resources and information to the campus community regarding events, services, and programs
- Use knowledge of campus resources to direct/refer SSO visitors to the correct offices/services outside of the SSO
- Observe daily interactions, concerns, and general inquiries and suggest ways for SSO to improve interactions with students
- Record and track daily in-office activity and produce monthly reports outlining activity, trends and suggestions for improvement
- Responsible for opening and closing the office each day
- Complete multiple housekeeping tasks, including distributing mail, ordering supplies, and keeping the workspace tidy
- Assist in the planning and implementation of events
- Assist in any additional office tasks as assigned","- Superior customer service skills and strong team player
- Excellent communication skills, verbal and written
- Excellent interpersonal skills
- Demonstrates a compassionate attitude and genuine interest in helping students
- Knowledge of the University of Waterloo's services and programs
- Ability to problem solve and remain calm in stressful situations
- Detail oriented and ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks and deadlines
- Self-motivator, ability to work without constant supervision","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University of Waterloo,University Relations,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",1,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Community Relations and Events team supports the University's strategic goals through developing and executing an outstanding suite of programs, events and partnerships to positively position and build the reputation and impact of the University of Waterloo both within our community and abroad.

column1: This co-op placement will provide an enthusiastic candidate with the opportunity to play a dynamic role in the University of Waterloo's central community relations and events office. The Communications and Events Assistant will provide assistance and support for the implementation of communications and events agenda for the University of Waterloo.

This position will offer experience in communications, event planning (virtual, hybrid and in-person events) and production, streaming, design of event materials and community engagement. The candidate will play a support role in Spring Convocation and many other campus-wide events. The ability to be proactive and an independent worker while still collaborating within a team is an asset that will help the Communications and Events Assistant.
This is a 4-month work term with the ability to extend it to an 8-month work term.","The successful candidate will undertake a number of projects and responsibilities including:
Assist in the creation and implementation of campaigns promoting events and the reputation of the University of Waterloo
Drafting and/or editing event invitations, registrations, reminder emails, and all other event related communication materials

Support and participate in the planning and execution of a number of signature University of Waterloo events such as Convocation, International Women's Day event, Waterloo Innovation Summit and community events.
Compose notes, capturing key messages, and provide content for event related promotions
Responsible for maintaining and updating strategic communication tools and tracking databases such as Airtable
Support the creation and editing of event videos
Assist with management of online streaming events
Support the pre-planning for a number of key initiatives through the use of various event-planning tools such as; work-back schedules, scenarios, and cue sheets
Execute on a number of events through on-site and off-site support; including management of the event day inbox, help desks and more
Act as an ambassador for the University in all community settings which may include; public, government, at any special events.
Effectively manage event inventory requests and organization of collateral.
Perform public relations, communications, marketing/advertising, and administrative duties as required.","The successful candidate must demonstrate:
The student must be a highly skilled writer, with a good understanding of digital platforms (website / social media)
Exceptional written and verbal communications skills, excellent editing skills
Event planning experience is an asset
WCMS training and experience, would be considered an asset
Experience with creating, or editing videos (Adobe Suite) is an asset
Consistently able to meet deadlines
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
Keen analytical skills, with an eye for attention to detail
Experience with streaming online events would be considered an asset
Ability to proactively and creatively solve problems
Committed to both personal and professional growth and actively seeks out opportunities for development
Ability to adapt to a changing environment and handle multiple priorities
This position may require work in the evenings and/or weekends on occasion to execute special events","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,This co-op placement provides an energetic and enthusiastic candidate with the opportunity to play an integral role in the University of Waterloo's dynamic central communications office. Through direct involvement with members of the internal and external communications teams, media relations, digital initiatives and creative services, the successful candidate will be exposed to a wide range of communications strategies and initiatives.

column1: Applicants for this position must be OSAP eligible.
A cover letter and resume with one to two references from previous employment is required with all applications. Two writing samples (no more than 750 words) must be provided upon application.
This co-op placement provides full-time employment opportunities for University of Waterloo undergraduate students who meet all of the following criteria:

You must be returning to full-time degree studies at the University of Waterloo in the term immediately following this co-op placement and you must maintain satisfactory academic progress in accordance with the standards of the university.","The incumbent is responsible for supporting the activities of various units within the Integrated Communications team:
Internal/External Communications
Leads in the creation, authoring and interviewing of articles for University channels including Waterloo Stories
Conducts research, interviews, writes, edits and fact-checks a variety of communications materials
Collaborates with faculty members, University leaders and communications teams across campus to identify story opportunities
Attends events to compose notes capturing key messages, takes photographs and video and networks with attendees to provide content for communication channels (both print and digital)
Assists in the creation or implementation of campaigns promoting the University of Waterloo
Ensures consistency, accuracy and excellence in quality and content of messaging in all materials
Responsible for maintaining and updating strategic communications tools and databases
Responsible for communications with colleagues across campus
Digital and Web Communications
Supports for the University of Waterloo's home page feature stories
Supports the execution of environmental scans and competitive analyses

Updates and maintains the database used for publications","The student must be a highly skilled writer, with a good understanding of both traditional (i.e. print) and digital platforms (i.e. websites / social media)
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; excellent editing skills
Solid interviewing and researching skills
Experience using web-based user interfaces to manage and maintain web content. Prior knowledge / training with the WCMS is an asset
Experience managing multiple-source projects that requires attention to detail, consistency in meeting deadlines and the ability to work with many different people with competing priorities
Experience with photography, videography and/or Adobe Creative Suite programs an asset","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Waterloo Undergraduate Student Association (WUSA),1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Intermediate, Senior",7,"

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,The Waterloo Undergraduate Student Association (WUSA) is seeking a Research and Policy Assistant (SRPA), who will provide research support vital to WUSA's operation and advocacy efforts. We conduct research on student needs, wants and quality of life to determine what WUSA, the University and governments can do to better serve students.","Reporting to the Research Coordinator, the Student Research and Policy Assistant provides research support to the Waterloo Undergraduate Student Association (WUSA), potentially including quantitative and qualitative research design, secondary research, survey design and execution, data analysis, writing of reports and other research tasks that assist the mission of WUSA. Additional support may include updating WUSA advocacy policies, self-selected projects, and research communication. Other duties may be assigned that generally fall within the areas of research, policy, student relations and advocacy.

column1: The SRPA also works with the student Executives to develop research plans and policy development. They collaborate with partners and resources both within and outside of WUSA to execute research plans. They will also develop research work plans, reports, summaries, position papers, and other research and policy documents on request for those within the organization.","Required skills:
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience with both qualitative and quantitative research
Strong organizational skills
Basic knowledge of statistics, research methods, research design and data analysis
Technological literacy, including knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Familiarity with academic integrity, proper citation and research ethics
Excellent personal initiative and strong work ethic
Critical thinking and analytical skills
Preferred skills:
Experience with policy development
Experience with survey design
Experience coding and analyzing both quantitative and qualitative survey data
Experience in creating research reports for a government or management audience
Familiarity with advocacy and stakeholder relations
Knowledge of current issues in post-secondary education
Experience and affinity for working in a collaborative team environment","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,University of Waterloo,Work-Learn Institute,1,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Intermediate, Senior",15,"

column8: ,4 month work term,The Work-Learn Institute (WxL, formerly WatCACE) was established to further Waterloo's leadership role in co-operative education. WxL advances co-operative education practice through conducting and disseminating research. The purpose of this position is to support research activities within WxL.

column1: Examples of current research initiatives within WxL include: (1) examining student experiences with the WE Accelerate program; (2) assessing (measuring) co-op students' lifelong learning attributes; (3) exploring student perceptions of the relevance of (senior) online learning assistant (S/OLA) employment opportunities. The successful applicant would be involved in the continued success of such initiatives and may also be involved in the conceptualization and management of new research projects.","Key responsibilities for this position include:
1. Conducting research on a broad range of topics within the work-integrated education field.

2. Supporting the production of high-calibre research output, including peer reviewed manuscripts, conference presentations, and other knowledge products (e.g., research briefs, executive summaries, literature reviews).

3. Supporting the promotion of WxL and work-integrated education research within the Waterloo community and abroad.","Qualified candidates can come from any academic discipline and can have any number of previous work terms/experiences. However, successful applicants should demonstrate:
1. An understanding of the research process applicable to the social sciences (typically gained through formal coursework regarding research and/or previous research experience).

2. Strong verbal and written communication. Preference will be given to individuals with documented success in reading, writing about, and speaking to existing research (e.g., conducting literature reviews, giving presentations about research).
3. Both convergent (i.e., focused problem solving) and divergent (e.g., creativity, ""brainstorming"") thinking.
4. Ability to work both independently under minimal supervision and the ability to work together within a small group environment.
Additional qualifications and skills that are an asset include using presentation software (e.g., PowerPoint, Prezi) and data analysis software (e.g., SPSS, NVivo).","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,The University of Waterloo Writing and Communication Centre (WCC) is a hub of communication and writing practice, support, and research on campus. Communication is part of all academic and professional activities, and we offer a welcoming space to discuss, explore, plan, and implement feedback and strategies.

column1: The Office and Communications Associate works with the WCC team to support our services by providing exceptional front-line service, engaging with the Waterloo community through our external communications, including (but not limited to) social media, marketing, promotions, and other outreach initiatives, and supporting the Operations and Marketing Coordinator's portfolio.","In this role you will be responsible for:
Providing exceptional front-line service to the Waterloo community by:
Monitoring the wcc@uwaterloo.ca email address and responding to all inquiries
Distributing information and resources about WCC services to the Waterloo community through a variety of mediums including websites, e-news, calendars,
Monitoring and engaging with the Waterloo community through the WCC's social media platforms, email, e-newsletters, website, etc.
Representing the WCC at campus events (online and in-person as necessary) and engaging with campus partners to increase our outreach and participation at campus events
Supporting the services that the WCC provides to the Waterloo community by:
Designing and developing content for a variety of marketing and communication materials, including social media, posters, brochures, reports, etc.
Collaborating on outreach, marketing and communication-related projects with our student service partners across campus (SSO, CCA, Libraries, etc.)
Tracking and reporting on social media engagement and activity
Providing support to the Operations and Marketing Coordinator's portfolio by:
Assisting with WCC program logistics
Attending and recording minutes for team and other meetings
Assisting staff with cancelling and moving appointments in our online booking system
Assisting students with their online booking accounts, including booking, rescheduling and cancelling appointments; changing passwords, etc.
Assisting with any additional office tasks as assigned","Experience in customer service, and strong organizational and time-management skills

Demonstrates excellent communication skills, both written and oral, as well as excellent interpersonal skills and diplomacy. Experience writing for the web (e.g. websites, blogging, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, online publications, etc.) is considered an asset.
Detail oriented, flexible, and able to prioritize tasks and deadlines
Motivated, self-directed, able to work both independently and collaboratively
Knowledge of and ability to discuss the WCC's services and programs in detail
Demonstrates basic design skills to create communications materials. Experience using graphic design tools (e.g. InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva, etc.) is an asset.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,unlearn is a social enterprise with a passion of provoking thought to inspire positive change.  Critical thinking is at the heart of everything that we do. At unlearn, we use design to create a dialogue around human rights, social justice and equity issues. unlearn challenges learners of all ages to think critically about their unconscious biases and examine how they can be reinforced by the media, their experiences and their relationships.

column1: We believe design has the ability to inspire us and make the world a better place. unlearn uses clothing, posters and programs to provoke thought and discussion around human rights and social justice issues.
The goal is to gradually achieve superior customer engagement and intimacy, through events and social media by strategically using all aspects of the marketing roadmap.
The specialist should have a solid understanding of how each social media channel works and how to optimize content so that it is engaging on those channels.
Learn more about unlearn at www.unlearn.com","Develop, implement and proactively manage a social media strategy with internal and external partners.
Create, manage and publish consistent content on all social media platforms, including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok and YouTube
Manage and improve the social media content calendar
Support in building brand awareness and audience engagement.
Moderate and proactively engage in all community conversations
Continuously improve by capturing and analyzing the appropriate social data/metrics, insights and best practices, and make recommendations prior to actioning.
Cover events and collaborate with other colleagues to coordinate social media content.
Other duties as assigned.","Passion for human rights, social justice, equity and global issues
Previous working experience in social media marketing or as a digital media specialist.
Excellent consulting, writing, editing, presentation and communication skills.
Experience in various social networks including: Twitter, Tik Tok, YouTube, LinkedIn
Knowledge of paid advertising and analytical tools
Knowledge of web design, content creation software and video editing software
Knowledge of online marketing and good understanding of major marketing channels.
Positive attitude and detail oriented with good multitasking and organisational ability.
Active Social Media Presence

column1: ,Untether AI,Divisional Office,7,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",25,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster, while using less power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text-to-speech, and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones, and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

column1: As we prepare our next chip design for tape out, our hardware design work is focused on a few primary areas:
The design of the control systems for the AI accelerator in hardware description languages (e.g. VHDL, verilog)
The design of verification programs (using cocotb or UVM for example)
The design of the custom circuitry for our AI accelerator engine - this includes design and simulation at both the analog and logic level
The design of a circuit boards to support and run the chip within different customer applications
Integrating hardware simulation models with our software systems for design validation

We are looking for self-motivated and innately curious candidates. You can expect to be put in a charge of an important project that will challenge you to learn, and you will be provided with mentoring and guidance from veteran hardware engineers. Because we're building new systems from the ground up, you'll get to work on new unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience in hardware or software, come talk to us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.","Join our team and learn about our hardware projects. You can pick your own project from a large number of topics, and we'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us. In general, expect to work in a loose SCRUM like environment (weekly/biweekly work sprint with code deliverable) where you are submitting your designs or code for team review via git merge/pull request or group presentation.
Some examples of tasks:
Evaluate competing hardware designs' performance or tolerances via SPICE or RTL level simulations
Exactly reproduce the behaviour of a piece of digital logic in the chip (logic gates, muxes, registers) in simulation code (python or C)
Help write verilog HDL for custom microprocessors
Implement the verilog in FPGA for evaluation prior to silicon
Write Python code to test chip in a system","We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:
Tools and programming languages we use: cadence, synopsys (VCS, dc-shell, primetime), spice, verilog, VHDL, python, cocotb, git, icarus, verilator
Topics and skills we are interested in include: cpu design, dsp design, artificial intelligence, neural net training and inference, digital logic design and analysis","Targeted Clusters
