column1: ,Untether AI,Divisional Office,2,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",28,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerators for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

column1: We are looking for creative problem solvers who are interested in optimizing neural networks for inference. You can expect to be contributing to a small agile team working on challenging problems in deep learning, software engineering, and mathematics, and be provided with close mentoring and guidance from senior engineers. As part of our fast-moving startup, you'll be contributing to foundational infrastructure and algorithm development, as well as working on new, unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.","Join our Neural Networks team and come learn about our software projects. We'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us, but in general you can expect to work primarily in Python (including TensorFlow and PyTorch), and some C/C++ within a loose agile environment (sprints, thorough code review, continuous integration etc.).
Some examples of topics:
Quantization: Develop and implement integer approximations for neural network layers from across myriad application domains (e.g. vision, NLP, recommendation engines)
Software development: Build out our customer-facing APIs to enable push-button model quantization, compilation, and on-chip inference acceleration

Research: Explore and experiment with automated approaches to optimizing nets for inference","We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus, including:
Experience with NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Experience deploying neural networks for inference
Software development experience including data-structures and complex algorithms
Experience writing production code
Experience with low-level programming, such as assembly language or CUDA
Strong math background
Hardware experience","Targeted Clusters

We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

column1: We are looking for creative problem solvers interested in solving the hard graph optimization problems involved in allocating the physical chip resources; for instance place and route optimization. You can expect to be contributing to a small agile team working on challenging optimization problems, and be provided with close mentoring and guidance from senior software engineers. As part of our fast-moving startup, you'll get to contribute to foundational infrastructure development, as well working on new, unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.","Join our Physical Allocation team and come learn about our software projects. We'll work together to set the code deliverables for your term with us, but in general you can expect to work in C/C++ and python within a loose agile environment (sprints, thorough code review, continuous integration etc.).
Some examples of topics:
Identify data-flow bottlenecks and devise algorithmic or heuristic place and route solutions
Implement algorithms to partition a network efficiently across multiple devices
Export new networks to our device and optimize their performance
Design and develop scheduling algorithms to optimize network performance

Develop tools to profile, measure, and visualize kernel and network performance","We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus, including:
Experience with C/C++, python, bash, git
Software development experience including data-structures and complex algorithms
Working experience or clear understanding of graph theory and discrete optimization
Experience with EDA (Electronic Design Automation) algorithms, e.g. place and route
Experience with python data science libraries and visualization tools (pandas, numpy, scikit)","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerators for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

column1: We are looking for self motivated and innately curious candidates to join our Runtime team. You will implement key aspects of our production kernel and user-mode drivers, their APIs, and the corresponding toolchain. You will craft elegant solutions to exciting problems and help form the future direction of our system software, and how our accelerator will be used by our users. You should demonstrate the ability to excel in an environment with complex software and hardware designs.","Join our Runtime team and come learn about our software projects. We'll work together to set the code deliverables for your term with us, but in general you can expect to work in C/C++, python and assembly within a loose agile environment (sprints, thorough code review, continuous integration etc.).
Some examples of topics:
Design, develop, and verify software that interacts with our chip via PCIExpress
Collaborate with hardware engineers and fellow software engineers
Identify functional/performance bottlenecks and alleviate them in order to achieve scalable and reliable software

Help with chip bring-up, testing and ensuring that our board, chip and associated software all work together","We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus, including:
Experience with C/C++, python, git, bash, make
Low-level debugging of device drivers and custom hardware
Experience programming and debugging microcontrollers
Experience developing Linux device drivers, kernel modules and/or systems software
Above all - smart, curious and tenacious with a willingness to learn","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Untether AI,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",10,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerators for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

column1: We are looking for candidates with strong interest in compiler development, graph and compiler optimizations, and platform specific code-generation. You can expect to be contributing to a small agile team, working with open-source technologies such as LLVM and MLIR, and be provided with close mentoring and guidance from senior software engineers. As part of our fast-moving startup, you'll get to contribute to foundational infrastructure development, as well working on new, unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.","Join our team and come learn about our software projects. We have a large number of projects and we'll work together to set the code deliverables for your term with us. In general you can expect to work in C++, python, and assembly in a loose agile environment (sprints, thorough code review, continuous integration etc.).
Some examples of topics:
Develop custom MLIR dialects fit for purpose
Assess and integrate existing dialects into the compiler flow
Design and implement elements of code-generation in LLVM
Debug emulation- and hardware executed code
Identify performance bottlenecks and design optimization passes","We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:
Tools and programming languages we use: C/C++, python, git, LLVM
Topics we are interested in include: neural nets inference, compiler design, digital logic design and analysis, graphs and high dimensional spaces

Skills we are looking for: good data structures and algorithms knowledge, experience with software architecture patterns, confidence with low-level topics like bit manipulation, general hardware and/or HDL experience, assembly languages, AI experience","Targeted Clusters

MATH - Computing and Financial Management","University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report"

column1: ,Untether AI,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",15,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerator for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self-driving cars within the next 5 years.

column1: We are looking for creative problem solvers who are interested in developing a deep understanding of our technology and applying that knowledge to the creation of high performance compute kernels. You can expect to be contributing to a team effort focused on delivering performant networks servicing real custom needs. The scope of your task would be limited only by your abilities and ambition. You would be provided with close mentoring and guidance from senior software engineers. As part of our fast-moving startup, you'll get to contribute to foundational infrastructure development, as well working on new, unsolved problems.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.","Join our kernel development team and come learn about our software projects. We'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us, but in general you can expect to work primarily in C++ with some Python scripting.
Some examples of topics:
Compute kernel: Understand, code, optimize and test compute kernels for common machine learning layers (eg convolution, upsample, NMS, etc)

Re-usable library components: Define, develop and test reusable library components that build towards the goal of efficient performant compute kernel development.","We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus, including:
Experience with C/C++, python, bash, git
Assembly language development experience
CUDA or other low-level GPU or AI accelerator programming experience
Knowledge of AI algorithms
Strong mathematical skills
Enjoy solving very complex problem (like doing IQ tests, solving tricky math problems)","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Untether AI,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",8,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Untether AI is a rapidly growing Toronto startup building a next generation hardware AI accelerators for neural net inference. We're designing integrated circuits that will run neural nets orders of magnitude faster and lower power. This class of chips will be the standard platform for running image recognition, speech synthesis, text to speech and many other applications in data centers, mobile phones and self driving cars within the next 5 years.

column1: As we work on the design of our next chip, we are building software in several areas:
- Hardware emulation: Functional emulation of the entire chip, allowing us to run jobs before we have actual silicon.
- Compiler infrastructure: Compiler, place-and-route, tooling and standard libraries required run neural net models on our custom hardware.
- Runtime infrastructure: Kernel drivers and server run-time environment for integrating our chip into data centers or other client applications.

We are looking for self motivated and innately curious candidates. You can expect to be contributing to a small agile team working in one of the core areas, and be provided with close mentoring and guidance from senior software engineers. In addition, because we're building new systems from the ground up, you get to work on new unsolved problems, building systems with few external dependencies and no legacy codebase.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.","Join our team and come learn about our software projects. We have a large number of projects and we'll work together to set the code deliverables for your term with us. In general you can expect to work in python/numpy, a custom assembly language and likely also other languages and tools in a loose agile environment (sprints, thorough code review, continuous integration etc.).
Some examples of topics:
Contribute to compiler infrastructure; parsing, code generation, debugging, run-time emulation
Explore neural networks and implement layer variants using our assembly language
Implement specific activation functions (non-linear functions such as tanh, relu, etc) using opcodes for the chip
Contribute to the software architecture that tracks memory allocation and meta data for programs running on the chip
Research and quantify the difference between various nonlinear function estimation approaches
Reproduce or adapt recent published neural net research on quantization and sparsity (using pytorch, tensorflow, numpy, etc)
Work on PCIe linux kernel drivers
Help with chip bring-up, testing and ensuring that our board, chip and associated software all work together","Required Skills
We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools and skills we use is a plus:
Tools and programming languages we use: python, numpy, keras, tensorflow, C, C++, cocotb, verilog git
Topics we are interested in include: neural net training and inference, compiler design, digital logic design and analysis, graphs and high dimensional spaces

Skills we are looking for: good data structures and algorithms knowledge, experience with software architecture patterns, confidence with low-level topics like bit manipulation, general hardware and/or HDL experience, assembly languages, AI experience","Targeted Clusters

MATH - Computing and Financial Management","University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report"

column1: As we work on the design of our next chip, we are looking for co-ops interested in the following areas:
Hardware and software design and development
Working with data scientists to ensure their AI workloads are ported and running efficiently on Untether AI products
Researching developing trends in machine learning / deep learning, including upcoming models, competitive analysis, customer usage models, etc.

We are looking for self motivated and innately curious candidates. You can expect to be contributing to a small agile team working in one of the core areas, and be provided with close mentoring and guidance from senior software engineers. In addition, because we're building new systems from the ground up, you get to work on new unsolved problems, building systems with few external dependencies and no legacy codebase.

We encourage interdisciplinarity and learning, so if you have experience spanning hardware and software, come talk with us. But don't worry if you think your experience is too narrowly focused, we've got great projects for people with a wide range of interests and specializations.","Join our product team and come learn about our projects. We'll work together to set the deliverables for your term with us. In general you can expect to support the product and sales team in a technical capacity, work in python/numpy and a custom assembly language, and likely also other languages and tools in a loose agile environment (sprints, thorough code review, continuous integration etc.).
Some examples of topics:
Technical demonstrations of our neural network design flow
Explore neural networks and implement layer variants using our assembly language
Product engineering and development
Contribute to the software architecture that tracks memory allocation and meta data for programs running on the chip
Reproduce or adapt recent published neural net research on quantization and sparsity (using pytorch, tensorflow, numpy, etc)

Chip bring-up, testing and ensuring that our board, chip and associated software all work together","We don't have strict skill requirements, but of course prior experience in the tools we use is a plus:
Understanding of major AI development frameworks including TensorFlow, Pytorch
Topics such as neural net training and inference, compiler design, digital logic design and analysis, graphs and high dimensional spaces, technical writing/marketing, sales, applications engineering

Good data structures and algorithms knowledge, experience with software architecture patterns, general hardware and/or HDL experience, AI experience, business development, experience supporting customers and end users","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,At Uplift, we're on a mission to help people get more out of life, one thoughtful purchase at a time. Our enterprise Buy Now, Pay Later solution is used by the world's most loved brands including Southwest Airlines, Carnival, Universal Studios, and more. With flexible pay over time installments, we empower consumers to buy what matters most while unlocking higher conversions and customer lifetime value for our partners. We're in high growth mode but we still hold on to the values that have inspired our mission since the beginning; innovation, diversity, agility, and a desire to help people elevate their lives. If our mission inspires you, let's talk!

column1: Uplift Pay Monthly is used by top travel brands such as Air Canada, Sunwing, Tripcentral.ca, RedTag.ca, Itravel2000.com, Carnival, United, Southwest and many more. Learn more at www.uplift.com.","-Design, build and maintain data pipelines in cloud infrastructure (AWS), using Python, Databricks Spark, Snowflake and Airflow
-Build Python libraries, tools, serverless applications and workflows
-Internal process improvements such as automating manual processes, building alerting/monitoring to ensure data quality
-Work with analysts and data scientists to extract actionable insights from data that shape the direction of the company

-Actively engage in design and code reviews - learn from your peers and teach your peers","-Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field

-Experience with cloud data warehouse, preferably Snowflake, and Apache Spark
-Familiar with Linux, AWS, and Docker
-Entrepreneurial, persistent, with the desire to go deep in details

-Comfortable working in a startup culture with the ability to earn trust","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Upsolve Inc,Divisional Office,5,Open for Applications,Remote in Canada,Intermediate, Senior",21,"

column8: ,4 month work term,Upsolve helps low-income families in financial distress access their legal and financial rights, through tech products, community, and education. Our mission is to fight for a legal and financial system we can all access. Our first product, a web app that helps families file for bankruptcy for free, has relieved $300 million+ in debt for low-income families suffering from medical bills, predatory loans, and layoffs. Today, Upsolve has 150,000+ members. Named to TIME'S 100 Best Inventions of 2020. Upsolve is fighting for racial, economic, and social justice at scale.

column1: Upsolve is funded by Y Combinator, Jack Dorsey, Eric Schmidt, the Robin Hood Foundation, Jim Breyer, Vinod Khosla, and Chris Sacca, the Hewlett Foundation, the Legal Services Corporation, and several others. To date, we've raised over $6 million.

Hear from our users about the difference Upsolve has made in their lives and watch our recent TED Talk, sharing our work and our vision for a more equitable legal and financial system. Read this post to learn more about where Upsolve is headed in the long run and how we see our advantages compounding over time: Understanding Upsolve.
Read more in-depth about what engineering at Upsolve is like.","Who We're Looking For

You're currently looking for opportunities that will allow you to reach your full potential as an engineer, helping marginalized communities with the skills you've gained throughout your career. You must have a passion for social, economic, and racial justice.
You've always told yourself: ""one day, I'm going to use my engineering skills to actually help people who need me.""

Before you became a software engineer or in your current career, you've had a track record of helping people in need. This could include volunteer experience, activism, or a full-time job. You have a well-developed awareness of the inequity in our society and a burning desire to do something about it. You've been looking for the right opportunity to work on these passions full-time while being fairly compensated.
You care about working with a very diverse team from all walks of life.
We're committed to making Upsolve the most meaningful professional experience of your life.
We are looking for team members with the following specific traits and experience:
You are interested in focusing on social impact
You have a willingness to learn fast
You ship incrementally and love to iterate
You love data, analytics, and ways to measure features you ship
You are intersted in moving fluidly between frontends, backends, and DevOps to ensure the greatest experience is delivered and supported
What You'll Get Out of It:
The chance to build a product that relieves hundreds of millions of dollars per year and transforms the lives of low-income and working-class families
A welcoming and collaborative environment with people who are dedicating their lives to fighting poverty
An environment for rapid experimentation and ownership
Ownership of entire systems and features that deliver society-changing impact
Contributing to the foundation and culture of a young and growing organization
Experience working cross-functionally and exposure to a variety of business functions
Cash compensation on par with for-profit tech companies","Requirements:
An incredibly high bar for velocity of shipping and the quality of your work
You build software that is explicit and intuitive
You're pragmatic in knowing when to refactor and when to ship
Desired: Professional experience with NodeJS
Desired: Experience with cloud service providers like AWS

Upsolve is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that everyone should receive equal consideration and treatment in all terms and conditions of employment regardless of sex, gender(including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, age(over40), physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, domestic partner status, military or veteran status, height, weight, AIDS/HIV status, and any other protected category under federal, state or local law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,About us:

column1: Uptake Canada delivers solutions that enable industrial equipment dealerships to increase productivity, reliability, and safety. Uptake Canada formed in 2016 when Uptake, a leading predictive analytics provider, purchased Canam Solutions Inc., a provider of enterprise workflow software for industrial equipment dealerships. Uptake aggregates asset, enterprise, and external data and applies cross-industry data science to produce high-value, actionable insights.

As a member of one of our QA Team, the Software Tester will work in a fast-paced environment with a group of over fifty software, service, and sales professionals to create, enhance and support testing activities on the web and mobile applications for our customers.","As a Software Tester, your responsibilities may include, but are not limited to, the following:
Increasing our test coverage, build and maintain test case suites
Work as a fully engaged member of a SCRUM team, testing stories developed in the sprint
Support all testing activities related to manual and automation testing of stories developed in the sprint
Develop product knowledge of the application and use this knowledge to uncover defects and drive up test coverage
Create and execute test plans consisting of functional, system, regression and integration test suites
Build and maintain the test case, author test cases for various types of testing that will cover mobile applications, web applications and REST API
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to work effectively in team-oriented collaborative environment
Perform system level regression testing to ensure product readiness for release cycles

Work with Product stakeholders and engineers to ensure all the aspects of the application have proper test coverage and overall system reliability, performance and quality standards are met","The ideal candidate would have the following:
A passion for Software testing and an understanding that testing is not one person or one team's responsibility
Experience in testing applications built on architecture supporting cloud computing architecture
Understanding of object-oriented programming (Java)
Experienced with JIRA, Git and Bitbucket
Outstanding problem-solving skills
Ability to work quickly and collaboratively in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Ability to demonstrate ownership and accountability through self-directed task management
Good verbal and written communication skills in English","Targeted Clusters

column1: Uptake Canada delivers solutions that enable industrial equipment dealerships to increase productivity, reliability, and safety. As a member of one of our product group teams, the Full Stack Developer will work in a fast-paced environment with a group of over fifty software, service, and sales professionals to create, enhance and support state of the art web and mobile applications for our customers.  The work is a highly varied mix of application maintenance, new feature development, new product development, and application deployment support.  This position is focused on user interface development for our CAT dealer business application products, with contributions to our middle-tier and back-end code.","Learn the underlying technical architecture of our web applications, and be able to analyze change requests and the impacts of the changes to determine how to accomplish them
Develop and maintain .Net and JavaScript-based SPAs programs
Develop and maintain SQL objects, especially complex stored procedures and functions
Conduct daily written and verbal interaction with the development team and with customers to interpret requirements, designing, defining and implementing solutions
Perform deployment testing and troubleshoot issues with new deployments
Be a very strong team player who knows what has to be done and takes the initiative to ensure the success of the team and the customer","The ideal candidate would have the following:
Experience with JavaScript-based SPAs, Sencha or Angular.
Experience with C#, .Net, JavaScript, Typescript and node.js
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server programming
Good verbal and written communication skills in English.
Able to operate individually and as part of a team; effectively set expectations, manage work and deliver results","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Urban Ecosystems Limited is a consulting engineering firm specializing in land development/municipal engineering and project management.  The firm was established in 1993 by a team of dedicated professionals with many years of domestic and international engineering expertise.  Our projects typically range from small specialized engineering assignments to large integrated urban land developments.

column1: We are seeking a candidate that has a strong working knowledge of AutoCAD, and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.) programs, strong organizational skills, and the ability to prepare clear and concise construction and inspection reports.  Applicants must have access to their own vehicle as field work & site visits will be required.","We are seeking a third- or fourth-year engineering student to work on a variety of projects including the following:

Various site servicing inspections during the construction of commercial, industrial, and residential site plans and subdivisions ensuring works are completed as per approved drawings and applicable standards, codes, and regulations
Assist with administration of construction contracts
Review of contractor's requisition for payment
Coordination and updating of construction schedules
Lot Grading Inspections for conformance with approved site plans
Assist with preparation of tender documents and cost estimates
Assist with other project related tasks as required including drafting and modifying Drawings within AutoCAD
Liaise with municipal officials and contractors
Report to and assist the Construction Manager
Coordination with other utilities, review agencies, clients, contractors, and others in a professional manner,","Knowledge of AutoCAD/AutoCAD Civil 3D
Strong Computer Skills - Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel
Strong Technical/report writing an asset

Strong work ethic and ability to effectively and efficiently communicate with other team members, Engineers, Clients, and other professionals.

column1: ,Urban Systems Ltd,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Kelowna,Junior,6,

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term required,About the Opportunity

column1: Our energetic Kelowna branch is currently looking for a capable and enthusiastic engineering or planning student to join our diverse transportation team for a 4 or 8 month work term starting in January 2021.

We understand the need for you to have meaningful work terms during your co-op education, and so we strive to create opportunities that are engaging, varied and rewarding. Our goal is for you to come away with an enhanced skill set that will serve you well in your career as an engineer or planner.

This opportunity will involve varied experience in most areas of our transportation practice working with top-tier veterans and recent graduates alike. As well, in keeping with our philosophy of ""hands-on"" learning and growth, you will be given as much freedom and responsibility as you demonstrate you can handle.
Typical duties may include:
Traffic analysis and modelling;
Traffic data collection;
Spreadsheet development and statistical analyses;
Transportation research;
Technical writing and communications; and
Project support and administration.","About You

Our preferred candidate is currently enrolled in the Civil Engineering or Integrated Engineering (with emphasis in Civil Engineering) degree program.","You wish to round out your skills and knowledge with exposure to some of the following: transportation planning, traffic operations, roadway design and active transportation
Apply theory and conduct research to provide workable solutions related to the implementation of transportation engineering/planning work;
Some working experience with software such as: Synchro, AutoCAD, GIS;
You have a keen interest in transportation engineering/planning;
You make connections between multiple topics and enjoy long-term planning;
Strengthen business relationships by providing a contribution to project teams;
Excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills;
Strong written and oral communication skills;
A self-starter that can work independently and collaborate effectively with others;
Known for producing high quality work under all circumstances; and
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment with a team of professionals who are deeply committed to exceeding client expectations.","Targeted Clusters

column1: We are looking for a highly motivated intermediate to senior Civil/Environmental Engineering student to work as an integral member of the design production team. The candidate must be able to work effectively in a team environment and primary responsibilities will include providing technical support and production assistance for all aspects of land development projects. Urbantech will strive to provide the successful candidate exposure to all aspects of the municipal design and approval process. Responsibilities will escalate given the individual's technical proficiency and desire to excel.
Urbantech has hired over 50 co-op students and counting with 10 becoming full time hires. As Urbantech continues to grow, this intern opportunity may lead to a full-time position.
For more information on Urbantech, visit our website at www.urbantech.com or connect with us on social media!","Specific duties include:
1. Perform stormwater management related calculations and design.
2. Perform design calculations for lot grading, sewer capacities, and storm drainage.
3. Assist in the preparation of design briefs and functional servicing reports.
4. Provide AutoCAD support in the preparation of detail design drawings.
5. Assist in the preparation of cost estimates and figures.
6. Assist with the Municipal Permit Application process.
7. Occasionally assist with site supervision tasks, as required.","Requirements:
Preference will be given to candidates with experience in the construction and/or municipal design field, who have advanced knowledge of MS Office Tools and who are proficient with AutoCAD/Civil 3D.

The successful candidate will have enthusiasm and a keen interest in municipal engineering, strong interpersonal and communication skills, and excellent planning, organizing and time management abilities.
Access to a vehicle for periodic site visits and other tasks is required.
We are looking for a team player that is up for any task presented to them!","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Uvaro Inc,Divisional Office,2,Open for Applications,Waterloo,Senior,10,

column8: ,4 month work term,We're on a mission to help the world's professionals lead more fulfilling careers - from their first job to their last. At Uvaro, we've created a better way to help everyday people launch and grow successful and rewarding careers in tech.

column1: We're growing quickly, and we're looking for Jr Associate Software Developers to help us realize our vision.

That's where you come in! If you are looking to work in a fast-paced, highly collaborative environment that delivers life-changing impact every day, then we should talk. The Jr Associate Software Developer is responsible for helping to build everything from internal tools to complex SAAS products used by professionals every day. This dynamic position requires the ability to learn quickly, work in both self-directed and collaborative settings, and deliver quality, test-supported code to real users.
If you are a dedicated problem-solver and are ready to make a huge impact in a growing company, we would love to hear from you!","In this role, you'll be:
Creating and managing React components, CSS, and custom front-end code across an array of web-capable devices and browsers
Working with other developers to design and build software services, API structures and the back-end data models and services to power them
Creating and maintaining integrations between internal systems and third-party products
Using rapid prototyping tools to deliver new functionality to users and collect feedback
Investigating issues reported by customers or internal teams, determining impact and root cause, and assisting in remediation
Growing and maintaining our suite of automated tests

Writing quality, test-supported code and participating in peer code review","Don't worry if you don't have all the qualifications listed below we are particularly interested in someone who learns quickly, so if you don't meet some of the criteria below but think you're up for the challenge, please still reach out - we'd love to talk to you!

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term preferred,We're on a mission to help the world's professionals lead more fulfilling careers - from their first job to their last. At Uvaro, we've created a better way to help everyday people launch and grow successful and rewarding careers in tech.

column1: We're growing quickly, and we're looking for Co-op Digital Content Creator to help us realize our vision.

That's where you come in! If you are looking to work in a fast-paced, highly collaborative environment that delivers life-changing impact every day, then we should talk. The Co-op Digital Content Creator is responsible for helping to build, support, monitor, and publish content related to our digital presence on both . This dynamic position requires the ability to learn quickly, work in both self-directed and collaborative settings, and deliver quality content that speaks strongly to our prospective customers.
If you are goal-driven, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are ready to make a huge impact in a growing company, we would love to hear from you.","In this role, you'll be:
Creating blog and social media graphics and copy
Updating web pages, links, and meta information to help us support our SEO efforts
Contribute to our online presence through the creation and coordination of blog and social content
Ensure we present a consistent voice across various content channels
Collaborate with fellow team members on various projects ranging from social media content and campaigns, to lead-generating projects and reporting
In this first 6 months you'll:
Create copy and creative for various digital platforms including social media, pay-per-click advertising, and website pages
Work within Canva to create compelling creative imagery and videos
Bring content and creative together to create moving messaging to our prospective customers
Monitor and report on aspects of digital platform channels such as campaign performance tied to specific content and creative developments
Make decisions independently on how to evolve specific messaging and creative as it relates to campaigns under your management
Collaborate with fellow team-members on projects and campaigns

Provide reporting on social media platforms, campaign performance, and project statuses.","Don't worry if you don't have all the qualifications listed below we are particularly interested in someone who learns quickly, so if you don't meet some of the criteria below but think you're up for the challenge, please still reach out we'd love to talk to you!
Someone who is comfortable working independently in a remote work environment
A strong sense of adaptability as things change quickly and you'll need to keep up!
Someone who believes in the positive work Uvaro does to eliminate barriers in the tech industry and empower remarkable students
Self directed, a quick study and an enthusiastic team player
A demonstrated history of completing complex projects with minimal supervision
A comfort with using and learning new software tools
Excellent interpersonal skills
Exceptional organizational and time management skills
Superb communication skills with a focus on high quality writing
Detail and results oriented who works well under pressure","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,For over 40 years, VanMar's values have remained the same - and we continue to live by them everyday.  Today, VanMar is a well-established and highly respected Developer, Design-Builder, Construction Manager, and General Contractor specializing in multi-residential, high rise, mid rise, institutional, and mixed-use projects.

column1: We are growing and looking to add a Development Coordinator to our dynamic team of professionals.  This is an exciting opportunity, for the right candidate, to gain knowledge and be involved in the development process in the Region of Waterloo as well as to interact with several disciplines on high-profile projects to both leverage and build upon their existing skills to navigate through complex challenges.

Reporting to the Planner/Development Manager the Development Coordinator is primarily responsible for assisting development management with the monitoring of obligations, facilitation of municipal development approvals, and management of relationships with project stakeholders. This position will also support the preparation of development and municipal planning approval processes.","Responsibilities:
Assisting development management with the monitoring of obligations, facilitation of municipal development approvals and management of relationships with project stakeholders.

Supporting the preparation of development and municipal planning approval processes such as site plan applications, re-zoning applications, and other processes under the Planning Act, as well as building permit related inquiries.
Coordinating and keeping updated procurements of multiple projects to closely monitor the progress in all areas of the development cycle.
Support in ad-hoc projects as needed.","Working towards a post-secondary degree in Urban Planning.
Previous co-op placements in Residential Urban Development considered an asset.

Interest in real estate development and related activities, which may include municipal development approvals (e.g., secondary planning, re-zoning, site plan approval), the application of best practices and an understanding of the full development cycle of a project.

Interest and/or knowledge of the development process in the Region of Waterloo, including an understanding of applicable policies and the municipal development approvals and environmental regulatory processes.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Ability to work independently.
Organization skills.
Co-ordination skills.
Ability to use MS Suite including, Outlook, Word, Excel, and Project.
Processing information: inputting, recording, transcribing, and updating data using electronic or manual information systems.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Veeva Systems,Head Office (Canada),2,Open for Applications,Toronto,Junior, Intermediate, Senior",19,"

column8: ,4 month work term,What do we do?

column1: We make cloud software for the global life sciences industry.
Ok, what does that really mean?

In short, we make it easier for large pharma companies get drugs to market faster, which helps those that are sick get better faster, and makes the world a healthier place faster. Yep, we're all about speed.
How do you fit in?
- Help us develop these solutions. We are looking for talented, budding, QA Engineer to join our Engineering team.
- We work in a fast-paced, agile environment. Our small dev teams combine their technical passions with the latest open source technologies to create cutting edge cloud software.
Where are we?

We are all over the world, but this gig is located at our downtown Toronto office in Canada.  Veeva now has a ""work from anywhere"" policy due to Covid-19.  So, depending on the situation for your specific work-term, you may be able to work from home for this position.","What will you do?
- Participate in functional, system, integration and regression testing activities
- Work closely with the automation team to improve automation coverage
- Work with Software Engineers and Product Managers to deliver a user experience that solves the business needs
- Create and improve documentation for test cases and automation test scripts
- Become a Subject Matter Expert in your test areas","What do you need to have?

- We're looking for a high energy, passionate individual to be part of a team that delivers enterprise applications for the Life Sciences industry. If you have a passion for quality and are someone who likes to figure out how things work, then Veeva has an opportunity for you!

- An ideal candidate for this role is a self-starter with a keen eye for details who loves technical challenges and who wants to learn. You will take pride and ownership of key parts of the software and certify its quality and correctness before delivery to the customer
- Computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, OO design, and software design)
- Capable of conduct root cause analysis of any defects found
- Usage of Unix and MySQL (or equivalent Database experience)
- Experience with testing web-based applications","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,About Veeva

column1: Veeva [NYSE: VEEV] is the leader in cloud-based software for the global life sciences industry. Committed to innovation, product excellence, and customer success, our customers range from the world's largest pharmaceutical companies to emerging biotechs. Veeva's software helps our customers bring medicines and therapies to patients faster.

We are the first public company to become a Public Benefit Corporation. As a PBC, we are committed to making the industries we serve more productive, and we are committed to creating high-quality employment opportunities.

Veeva is a Work Anywhere company which means that you can choose to work in the environment that works best for you - on any given day. Whether you choose to work remotely from home or work in an office - it's up to you.
About the Role

Join our Engineering Development Program (EDP) as a front-end, back-end, or mobile software developer (including iOS and Windows Tablet) where you'll work on small teams in a fast-paced, agile environment, releasing features every four weeks. Help us design our solutions! You will contribute to technical and functional design decisions, troubleshoot and provide technical product support, and be responsible for all aspects of the software development lifecycle. We have intern positions on the following product teams in which you'll be matched according to your development preference and technical skillset.
Vault
Safety
CP&C (Consumer Goods, Chemical & Cosmetics)
Network
Data Cloud","What You'll Do

Work in all aspects of the software development cycle: design, implementation, tuning, testing, and monitoring of the functional areas that you will own, delivering products within the schedules and timelines
Contribute to technical design decisions for the product
Contribute to troubleshooting and technical support of the product","Requirements
Working toward Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical degree
Graduation date is by Summer 2023 or earlier
Overall GPA must be 3.0 or higher
Programming experience in Java
Solid CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented design)
Nice to Have's
Working knowledge of HTML and JavaScript
Working knowledge of relational databases
Relevant internship/project experience is a plus","Targeted Clusters

column8: ,4 month work term,Vena Medical is seeking an engineering student to fulfill the role of Opto-Mechanical Engineering Co-op to assist with the design, development, prototyping, manufacturing and testing of novel medical devices. The successful candidate will work on all stages of the medical device development process, but will contribute heavily to the design transfer and verification and validation testing of Vena Medical's catheter based devices. The Co-op will work closely with contract engineers and internal quality engineers to ensure devices comply with device performance and safety requirements.","-Supporting prototyping, development and design transfer of catheter based medical devices

column1: Vena is a Canadian scale-up founded in 2011 and is one of the biggest tech success stories.  Our award-winning cloud finance software helps over 900 global clients streamline and scale their plan to grow. In the past year, Vena has grown to over 400 employees worldwide-and yes, we're still hiring!
Vena's headquarters is located in Toronto's Liberty Village and features state-of-the-art conveniences and amenities. We also have an office in London, England, located near the London Bridge.
Currently, most of Vena's workforce is operating remotely due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
About the Role
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Financial Reporting, the Finance Assistant will support month end responsibilities, year end financial statements, and internal and external reporting requirements.

The successful candidate will be a highly analytical, organized and self-motivated individual with excellent communication skills who is looking to learn and grow in their career.  You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and seize opportunities to take ownership and increase responsibilities as the company grows.  You are able to think outside of the box and you love to develop creative solutions to complex and challenging problems.
Can be extended to 8 month if mutually agreed upon","Support the month-end close and reporting process
Preparing journal entries/support and account reconciliations
Support in financial reporting as required
Assist in Accounts Payable with setting up vendor invoices and payments, supplier statement reconciliations and responding to vendor queries
Assist in Accounts Receivable with application of customer payments and responding to customer queries
Assist in invoicing/billing with customer set-up, order set-up and issuance of invoices
Assist with preparation of year end financial statements
Any other duties that may be assigned","Passionate about learning and growing in the technology industry.
Strong project management skills including the ability to provide leadership and project accountability.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to build relationships both among internal and industry peers to keep abreast of current issues within the industry
Knowledge of IFRS accounting
Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Excel, and experience working with accounting software (i.e. NetSuite, Expensify).
Working towards the completion of an Accounting designation.","Targeted Clusters

column1: ,Venterra Realty Canada,Divisional Office,1,Open for Applications,Richmond Hill,Senior,10,

column8: ,8 month consecutive work term required,With a 9.4 out of 10 Student Satisfaction Rating and our last Waterloo coop being hired full time, we are excited to offer an 8-month coop term in our Finance team. Check out the opportunity below!

column1: COMPANY OVERVIEW

Venterra Realty is a privately held Canadian corporate success story by any measure. It is a technology company, an investment management company and a commercial real estate company. Venterra has $3.0 billion assets under management; revenue of $250+ million. It owns and operates over 60 multi-unit residential properties, representing more than 17,000 units in the highest growth cities in the Southern U.S.

Founded in 2001, we haven't just expanded our size; we've grown into a company that is paving a new way in the industry, where our employees can really make a difference, career growth is available, and where our residents are provided an amazing living experience!
We're honoured to have received the following workplace recognitions:
2021 Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials
2020 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women
2021, 2020, 2019 & 2018 Fortune Best Workplaces in Texas
2021, 2020, 2019, 2018, 2017, & 2016 Fortune Top 100 Best Medium Workplaces
2018 Fortune Best Workplaces for Diversity
2018 Houston Top Workplaces
2021, 2018 Glassdoor Top CEOs
2021, 2017 & 2016 Glassdoor Best Place to Work
50 Most Engaged Workplaces by the Achievers Corporation
And have 100% of our communities recognized as ""Top Rated"" by ApartmentRatings.com
Community Involvement

As a company built on a culture of unparalleled service and care toward our own communities, we recognize the importance on making a positive impact in the communities where our employees live and work. Our Venterra Cares program provides employees with several opportunities throughout the year to donate to and/or volunteer for various causes and organizations. In 2019, Venterra Realty Canada has chosen to support and work with the Heart and Stroke Foundation, Yellow Brick House, Richmond Hill Community Food Bank, CIBC Run for the Cure, and the Super Sofia Project. Employees can choose which organization(s) to support through planned activities, events and/or fundraising initiatives. Just as we provide our residents with a 'Better Way of Living"", we hope to empower our employees to contribute to a 'Better Way' in their communities.
We are currently all working remote.  This position will be expected to be come into the office as required once a return plan is established.
We are looking for people who:
Have strong personal values and want to work for a values-based company
Are ambitious and hard working with exceptionally high personal standards
Have strong communication skills; are able to succinctly convey complex ideas
Embrace problem-solving and learning new skills
Thrive in a rapidly changing and high growth environment
Are passionate about driving continuous improvements and the use of technology with data to drive business results","The Opportunity

Venterra has built a high-performance accounting and finance team focused on delivering financial insight and value-added analysis. We are blurring the lines of finance and technology to support the company's rapid growth and expansion efforts.

Reporting to our Lead, Finance, the Financial Analyst (Co-op) will be immersed in a variety of financial performance areas including continuous improvement projects, data visualization, property performance analysis, and lender/insurance relations.

The Financial Analyst (Co-op) will join the organization at an opportune time where we are well-capitalized and expanding into a new asset class and evaluating new geographies. We are looking for someone who has a keen interest in a starting a finance career and wants to learn how to drive change through the application of technology while building their analytical skills alongside a knowledgeable group of finance professionals. The successful candidate will grow their capabilities and develop a deep financial understanding of the business.
Key Job Responsibilities
Modelling and Financial Analytics (50%)
Recommend/implement solutions to simplify and automate business processes; reduce manual effort, improve accuracy and add new actionable insights
Using Excel/Power BI, build new or improve existing financial reporting to highlight insights that drive action for operations and management
Create automated QA tests to ensure Excel/Power BI solutions consistently deliver accurate results
Financial Management (50%)

Analyze historical property performance trends to assess reasonability of appraised property values; improve accuracy of appraised property values by recommending changes to appraisal forecast assumptions
Partner with operations on property/tenant insurance claims; interact directly with insurance brokers, lenders and Venterra management to process claims on timely basis and assess financial impact
Manage funding levels in bank accounts, notifying Finance leadership of potential shortages
Liaise with internal stakeholders to manage/govern key data in Venterra systems, including property budgets, capital expenditures, and loan transactions","Candidate Profile
Requirements
Basic skills in Microsoft Excel required with a passion for learning technology
Proficiency in SQL and Python/VBA is an asset
Pursuing a university degree, preferably in Accounting/Finance/Math
How You'll Succeed
Interest in automation and data visualization to drive actionable insights
Attention to detail, and discipline to build automated QA tests for ensuring accuracy of deliverables
Natural curiosity, and passion for digging into the details and learning new skills
Ability to manage multiple deliverables and work autonomously to deliver results
Strong communicator with ability to convey complex ideas in concise and digestible ways","Targeted Clusters
